properties.name: Adelaide Caravan Park
properties.description:
Just 2km from the Adelaide CBD sits a hidden gem, Adelaide Caravan Park.

Surrounded by nature and the sounds of animals from Adelaide Zoo, Adelaide Caravan Park is the perfect place to base yourself and enjoy all the wonders the city and surrounds has to offer. Whether it is a stroll through the Botanic Gardens, visiting the animals at Adelaide Zoo, a spot of shopping in Rundle Mall, or heading to the spectacular Adelaide Hills and beyond, we have accommodations to suit every occasion.

We also offer free parking, a camp kitchen, laundry, amenities and an outdoor pool.

So come and experience serenity today!

properties.name: NRMA Victor Harbor Beachfront Holiday Park
properties.description:
Whoever said the journey matters more than the destination didn’t have adventure-hungry kids on the backseat. Victor Harbor Beachfront Holiday Park is an hour’s drive south of Adelaide, so they’ll be appeased in no time. Whether it’s the beach, the heated pool or the pump track in their sights, there’s serious fun to be had.

Choose from modern family accommodation or back-to-basics campsites – either way you’ll be a stone’s throw from the beach (and your pet is welcome, too). With the cafes and shops of Victor Harbor within walking distance, this is a family holiday made easy.

And when it’s time to explore the endless beauty of the Fleurieu Peninsula, our friendly team is on-site to help plan your adventure.

properties.name: Second Valley Caravan Park
properties.description: Second Valley Caravan Park is a pet friendly family park set amongst beautiful shady pine trees, providing a cool breeze and shade in the summer months and is an easy stroll to the beach and jetty precinct. It has a full offering from Executive Cabins to unpowered camp sites complimented by modern individual amenities block, launderette, camp kitchen, outdoor showers, fish cleaning station and dump point. Adjacent to the park is a children's playground, public telephone and post box, a free little library and shaded Council reserve with picnic tables. A licenced Café/General store is adjacent.

properties.name: Belair National Park Caravan Park
properties.description: Belair National Park Holiday Park in the Adelaide Hills is the best place to make memories with your loved ones. The picturesque surroundings of the Belair National Park provide the perfect setting for complete relaxation and family adventures. Explore the many walking trails, play a game of golf, or just relax by the pool and forget that the city is only 25 minutes away. Ideal for day trips to explore the Adelaide Hills, the Barossa Valley, and coastal areas. Delightful new cottages, glamour camping eco tents, clean amenities.

properties.name: Port Lincoln National Park 4WD Tour
properties.description:
With an abundance of pristine beaches, towering sand dunes and rugged coastlines, Port Lincoln National Park is best explored on an exciting 4WD adventure. Buckle up and join this tailored half day tour for an off-road adventure like no other.

Start the day with a pick up from your Port Lincoln accommodation and set off into the Port Lincoln National Park. Sink your toes into soft sands as you enjoy a relaxing stroll along untouched beaches where a soul cannot be spotted for miles. Revel in the sweeping ocean views from a limestone coast lookout before a heart racing 4WD over the towering sand dunes on the Sleaford to Wanna 4WD track.

With an experienced local guide at the wheel, you’ll be in safe hands as you explore the hidden gems of Port Lincoln National Park on a personalised tour for small groups.

properties.name: Gorge Wildlife Park
properties.description:
Purchase tickets to Gorge Wildlife Park near Adelaide CBD online here for an entertaining and family-friendly day out. This wildlife park is home to an array of exotic and native animals set out over 14 acres of leafy green terrain.

Highlights:

- Exotic animals
- Koala holding
- Reptile presentation
- Native animal feeding
- BBQ and picnic areas
- Unleashed sessions with animals

properties.name: Wirrina Scenic Cruise
properties.description:
Departing from Wirrina Cove Marina, cruise south along the spectacular Fleurieu Peninsula on a scenic cruise showcasing the stunning South Australian coastline and native wildlife found in this corner of the world. The family-friendly ocean adventure provides a completely new perspective as you pass Second Valley, Rapid Bay and Cap Sevinge headlands and granite sea cliffs.

Admire amazing geological formations and get up close to caves and hidden coves with ease on this custom built vessel that can manoeuvre into secluded bays with ease. As you make your way around Rapid Bay, you’ll visit the Fur Seal Colony sunbathing near Rapid Head. Make one last journey past enormous wind turbines at Starfish Hill Wind Farm

Highlights:

- scenic cruise
- Spectacular views of the Fleurieu Peninsula
- Spot seals and dolphins along the way
- See stunning headlands, sea cliffs and turquoise waters
- Suitable for families and children of all ages
- Cruise past Second Valley, Rapid Bay and Cap Sevinge

properties.name: Victor Harbor Southern Ocean Adventure Cruise
properties.description:
If you're visiting Adelaide and looking to interact with the amazing sea life and creatures, then embark on a Southern Ocean adventure from Victor Harbor with a Wildlife and Whale Discovery Tour. 

The tour departs the Granite Island Causeway and motors its way to the northern side of Granite island, revealing exceptional views of the Victor Harbour shoreline. The next point of interest is Seal Rock, where passengers can watch the New Zealand Fur Seals and Australian Sea Lions basking in the sunshine as they flip and flop into the ocean - don't be surprised if their friendly demeanour inclines them to swim up to the boat for a quick hello. 

**Highlights** 

- 90 Minute Wildlife Discovery Tour 
- Spectacular views of the Victor Harbor 
- Seal Rock, spot New Zealand Fur Seals 
- Pass the granite boulders of Wright Island 
- Common and Bottlenose Dolphins 
- Cliffs of Kings Beach and Waitpingalar cliffs of Kings Beach and Waitpinga

properties.name: Kangaroo Island Dolphin and Seal Swim Safari
properties.description:
Have the opportunity to swim with wild dolphins OR among seals and snorkel some of Kangaroo Island’s stunning coastline. It’s an amazing wildlife encounter! We provide wetsuits, mask, snorkel & fins.

Arrive at The Visitor Information Centre in Penneshaw (Howard drive) where you will be fitted into a wetsuit, mask, snorkel and flippers and provided with a safety brief. Then jump on board our 28 seater vessels in search of the marine life that inhabits the incredible coastline. 

Spot the cheeky seals lounging on the rocks and playing in the water. Then it’s time to dive in! These curious seals can be quite interactive and playful and provide a fun snorkelling experience. Kangaroo Island Ocean Safari is the only operator in South Australia that provides the opportunity to swim with the Long-nosed Seals. 

Search for the dolphin pods that reside in these coastal waters and take the opportunity to swim alongside them in the wild. A truly unforgettable wildlife encounter. Your friendly guide will also provide informative commentary along the way.

properties.name: Kangaroo Island Full Day Tour
properties.description:
Visit Kangaroo Island in a day on this tour from Adelaide with all the top sights, a 2 course lunch, Kangaroo Island ferry tickets and return included. Kangaroo Island tours are the best way to experience the scenery with a local and there are plenty of opportunities to taste the yummy samples and see wildlife along the way.

Highlights:

- Return coach/ferry to Kangaroo Island from Adelaide
- Delicious 2-course lunch at Emu Ridge Eucalyptus Distillery
- Free Flight Birds of Prey Presentation
- Spectacular views of Pennington Bay
- Structured wine tasting at False Cape Wines
- Clifford's Honey Farm Shop visit

properties.name: Kangaroo Island Iconic Sights and Wildlife Tour
properties.description:
Set off on a journey exploring Kangaroo Island's natural wonders and wildlife. Start your day at Emu Ridge Eucalyptus Distillery, the only commercial Eucalyptus Oil Distillery in South Australia and enjoy a refreshing morning break while keeping an eye out for the native Emu mob. Next, visit the iconic Flinders Chase National Park to see the stunning natural rock formation that is Admirals Arch, and explore Remarkable Rocks unique granite boulders. Lunch at Vivonne Bay, known as one of Australia's finest beaches. 

Then, experience the thrill of the Kangaroo Island Raptor Domain, with an exclusive 30-minute flight show featuring fascinating and deadly birds like the Wedge-Tailed Eagle and the Barn Owl.

This full day tour offers an immersive blend of nature, wildlife, and adventure, so grab your camera and make some memories.

properties.name: Flinders Ranges Discovery Tours
properties.description:
Flinders Ranges Discovery four wheel drive tours take in the most spectacular scenery of the Flinders Ranges, and showcase the wildlife, geology and European history of the region. 

All tours are conducted by experienced local guides in modern four wheel drive vehicles. Most tours (except for Skytrek) are available as half day tours. Full day tours depart at 8.30am, return at 4.30pm, and include morning tea and lunch. 

Half day tours depart at 8.30am, return at 12.30pm, and include morning tea.

properties.name: Wine Blending Experience at Penfolds Barossa Valley
properties.description:
Visit the Penfolds Winery in the famous Barossa Valley and join this 60 minute winemaking experience to become a master wine maker. 

Learn how to blend your very own wine, bottle it and then take it home with you to enjoy with friends and family. This unique wine class is the perfect way to learn about the legend of the famous Australian Penfolds wine and see first hand how unique blends can be made. 

You will enter the 'Winemakers Laboratory' and choose from Grenache, Shiraz and Mouvedre to personalise the wine to your own tastes. The classes are held at 10.30am and 2pm daily. Book your Penfolds Barossa Valley winemaking experience here!

**Highlights:**

-   Blend your own unique wine
-   1.5 Hour Barossa Valley Wine Making Class
-   Take home your personalised bottle of wine
-   Learn about the legend of Penfolds
-   Become a master winemaker for the day
-   Designed for discerning wine-lovers

properties.name: Barossa Valley Hot Air Balloon Flight
properties.description:
Hit this Barossa Valley hot air balloon ride, you'll soar over this beautiful and verdant region of South Australia, taking in wonderful views from above on an aerial adventure that includes one hour of flight time, wine tasting and a gourmet breakfast. Long one of Australia's most popular spots for hot air ballooning, the Barossa Valley's landscape features rolling fields, expansive vineyards and a patchwork tapestry of farmland that make for a picturesque spot to take in by air.

Highlights: 

- Barossa Valley 60 minute hot air ballooning
- Gourmet Barossa Breakfast
- Wine Tasting at Langmeil Winery
- 5 hours (approx) of fun & adventure
- Transfers from the meeting point
- Balloonatics Certificate Presentation

properties.name: Adelaide Swim with Wild Dolphins Cruise
properties.description: Head out on the waters of Adelaide for a once in a lifetime encounter on this 3.5 hour cruise - you don't go to the dolphins, the dolphins come to you! Join this magical tour for chance of a lifetime to swim with wild dolphins in Adelaide! Join your friendly guides as you hit the waters of lovely Glenelg on the SA coast, and are taken out on a 58ft Sailing Catamaran from Holdfast Shores Marina to witness the intelligent and beautiful dolphins in their natural environment. On this dolphin cruise, you'll be able to marvel at the antics of these amazing creatures, and even have the opportunity to upgrade for an optional swim experience to enter the water right alongside them!

properties.name: Dolphin Sanctuary & Ships Graveyard Kayak Tour
properties.description:
A fun aquatic adventure awaits near Adelaide with this wonderful kayaking tour that will have you paddling alongside dolphins. Nature lovers will enjoy seeing the playful Port River dolphins as they play in the waters just 30 minutes from Adelaide's CBD. 

On this fun and entertaining dolphin kayaking adventure, you'll enjoy a three hour kayak led by friendly guides as you're shown the beautiful wildlife of Adelaide. See Mangrove creeks, sea birds, dolphins and even shipwrecks on this awesome mid morning adventure. 

**Highlights:** 
- 3 hour kayaking tour 
- Get up close with dolphins 
- Explore shipwrecks, mangroves & more 
- All equipment included 
- Scenic adventure 
- Memorable experience

properties.name: BIG4 Blue Lake Holiday Park
properties.description: Located on top of Australia's world famous mysterious Blue Lake. Situated on the Limestone Coast with a population of over 30,000, Mount Gambier is the largest town 4.5 hours south east of the Adelaide metropolitan area. Blue Lake Holiday Park is set on 27 acres of beautifully landscaped gardens with great views of the surrounding valley.

properties.name: Spear Creek Caravan Park
properties.description: Spear Creek, your gateway to the Flinders Ranges. Set immediately adjacent to the Western slopes of the Southern Flinders Ranges in the middle of a 21,000 acre working sheep station providing privacy and security. Spear Creek is located 25 kilometres south-east of Port Augusta, our eastern boundary follows the summit of the ranges north from Horrock's Pass, with walking trails through deep gorges to range top views of upper Spencer Gulf. The holiday park is nestled amongst 600-year-old river red gums adjacent to the ranges.

properties.name: BIG4 Normanville Jetty Holiday Park
properties.description:
BIG4 Normanville Jetty Holiday Park is situated along one of the most beautiful and safest beaches of the Fleurieu. Just a 40-minute drive, with magical views from Adelaide's CBD, you'll find our Park to be one of South Australia's Hidden Gems.

After an easy 10-minute stroll to the town centre, or 5-minute drive to Yankalilla, there you'll find great food, delicious coffee and charming local shops that will surprise. From here, it is a 30-minute drive to Cape Jervis and the Kangaroo Island Ferry, Victor Harbor, and McLaren Vale - the Fleurieu's wine region. You'll be sure to make this one of your favourite destinations.

There are 23 new Executive Cabins with space for all occasions, family and friends with beach views and sunsets to sooth the soul. Along with our current Standard 1 and Deluxe 2 Bedroom ensuite Cabins, powered and unpowered sites of various sizes, a camp kitchen, family games room, and boardwalk along the Bungala River to the beach, this park offers a magical stay in every direction.

If you're looking for a relaxing place to stay for a weekend away or if you're visiting South Australia and want to see the best the Fleurieu Peninsula has to offer, come and stay at BIG4 Normanville Jetty Holiday Park!

properties.name: Mannum Visitor Information Centre
properties.description: Please note temporary relocation to Shop 4 67 Adelaide Road Mannum due to the high river/flood situation. Your first stop in Mannum - come and meet a friendly local who can provide free visitor information and maps on Mannum and the Murray River Lakes and Coorong region, and the neighboring regions. Find out some insider knowledge on suggestions and directions for your day trip or extended stay within the region. Usually located at 6 Randell Street, Mannum we are the face of the Mannum Dock Discovery Centre, PW Mayflower and PS Marion Cruising, open seven days a week, 363 days a year (closed only on Christmas Day and Good Friday). Allow them to assist you with referrals to tour and accommodation bookings, places to go, experiences not to miss and much more; a good range of brochures maps, local produce, gifts and souvenirs

properties.name: Kingston Foreshore Caravan Park
properties.description:
Right on the esplanade at Kingston SE, on the calm shores of Lacepede Bay, a short walk from the town center and only 20 minutes from the busy town of Robe! The Kingston Foreshore Caravan Park has plenty to offer families, solo travelers, and adventurous caravanners.

Choose from six accommodation options at Kingston Foreshore Caravan Park and watch the sunsets, stroll along the beach, relax and enjoy Kingston SE from our seaside Caravan Park.

properties.name: BIG4 The Bend Holiday Park
properties.description: Located near the stunning Murray River, and only 1 hour from the Adelaide CBD, we offer a wide range of accommodation options and facilities, and walking distance to The Bend Motorsport Park. Come and explore our rich history, local wines and Coorong country.

properties.name: Oasis Tourist Park Coober Pedy
properties.description: Oasis Tourist Park is situated right opposite the Coober Pedy Drive-In, just 250 metres from shops and attractions. We have something for everybody, including underground accommodation!

properties.name: BIG4 Ceduna Tourist Park
properties.description: BIG4 Ceduna Tourist Park is located on Eyre Peninsula in South Australia. An ideal place to enjoy fishing, camping, 4WDing and whale watching tours. It is the gateway to the Nullarbor, including the the Nullarbor Links Golf Course - world's longest golf course, and a great place to stop over when travelling either east or west across the Nullarbor.

properties.name: BIG4 Mount Compass Caravan Park
properties.description: BIG4 Mount Compass is a secluded, peaceful park located in the heart of the Fleurieu Peninsula.  The pretty township of Mount Compass is only a 5-minute drive away. Attractions in town include a top 100 golf course, Harvest the Fleurieu, Mount Compass Spirits, Ambersun Alpacas, the Mount Compass Hotel and a number of walking trails including the Heysen Trail. A short drive from the world class McLaren Vale Wine region and the sandy beaches of the South Coast, we are ideally located as a hub to explore the Fleurieu Peninsula.

properties.name: BIG4 Cape Jervis Accommodation & Caravan Park
properties.description: BIG4 Cape Jervis Accommodation & Caravan Park is the perfect place to stay whether you are taking the Cape Jervis ferry to Kangaroo Island or exploring the Fleurieu Peninsula – Deep Creek National Park, Rapid Bay, Second Valley, Victor Harbor, Yankalilla, Normanville, and McLaren Vale are all a short drive away.

properties.name: BIG4 Barossa Tourist Park
properties.description: Situated 70km north of Adelaide, Nuriootpa is in the heart of the Barossa and our park is the perfect meeting place before exploring all there is on offer. Enjoy the ambiance and space of our luscious green park, encompassed by the natural beauty of the adjacent Coulthard Reserve, Bush Chapel, and ovals of the Nuriootpa sporting community.

properties.name: BIG4 Port Hughes Holiday Park
properties.description:
Our spectacular foreshore caravan park at Port Hughes is located in one of South Australia’s favourite tourism destinations, the Copper Coast region of the Yorke Peninsula.

We are only a short barefoot walk to one of the prettiest beaches on Yorke Peninsula – one of the many reason why BIG4 Port Hughes Holiday Park has been a family favourite for generations. We have just the right combination of relaxation, activities for all ages, along with a lovely community feel.

We’ve got something for everyone. Whether you wish to camp with mates, caravan with the family or stay in a cabin and enjoy the atmosphere of the park while enjoying the luxuries of home.

properties.name: BIG4 Loxton Riverfront Holiday Park
properties.description: Set on approximately 35 hectares along the majestic Murray River. This absolute river front park caters for everyone. You can relax by the river reading a book, fish and watch the river float by or get active on the river with your kayak, canoe, speedboat or houseboat. A great park for everyone.

properties.name: BIG4 Stuart Range Outback Resort
properties.description: We are a resort-styled park which offers a great range of activities and accommodation. You will find us perfectly located for a midway stop between Adelaide and Alice Springs/Uluru. Whether you are staying in our modern 1 or 2 bedroom apartments, or on a caravan and camping site, you can expect a warm outback welcome from our friendly team.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - West Beach Parks
properties.description: Nestled within 1.2km of stunning coastline, Discovery Parks - West Beach Parks is a holiday destination loved by families, couples, friends, groups and just about everyone else! Our significant selection of sites and spacious self-catering cabins means there is an option for every type of break and every kind of budget.

properties.name: BIG4 Echo Holiday Parks – Naracoorte
properties.description: Naracoorte is situated midway between Adelaide and Melbourne, in the centre of the Limestone Coast region. It links to the Great Ocean Road and the Grampians, and is the ideal central base for travellers to explore this beautiful region. The famous World Heritage listed Naracoorte Caves are nearby along with famous wine regions.

properties.name: Victor Harbor Holiday Park
properties.description:
Victor Harbor Holiday Park offers a scenic getaway in the charming seaside town of Victor Harbor on the Fleurieu Peninsula in South Australia.
Offering a wide range of accommodation options, from 3 bedroom cabins to our camp sites there is an option for all budgets and holiday makers.
Visitors to the area enjoy the best of Fleurieu Peninsula including McLaren Vale Wineries, Granite Island and the charming towns of Port Elliot and Goolwa

Beach – 5 minute walk
Granite Island – 3 minutes
Port Elliot – 11 minutes
Goolwa – 22 minutes
McLaren Vale – 35 minutes
Adelaide – 1 hour 15 minutes
Adelaide Airport – 1 hour 13 minutes

properties.name: BIG4 Port Elliot Holiday Park
properties.description:
With postcard-worthy beaches nestled along the coast between Victor Harbour and Middleton, BIG4 Port Elliot Holiday Park has an abundance of options to bring the holiday vibes.

The seaside town of Port Elliot is made up of stylish cafes and cute boutiques, while the coastline boasts epic fishing for keen anglers, a beautiful jetty, iconic surf spots and walking trails along the dramatic coastline.

Located right on the beachfront, making it easy to choose between a relaxing vacation or an action-packed adventure.

properties.name: BIG4 Mannum Holiday Park
properties.description:
Perfectly positioned on the banks of the mighty Murray River, BIG4 Mannum Holiday Park is waiting for you to visit. The country town of Mannum may be quaint but it’s got plenty to offer from river cruises to fishing and classic country pubs.

If food and wine is your thing, just a stone’s throw from Mannum is Adelaide and the Barossa Valley calling your name or, if you’d prefer to stay put, set up your camp chair on the banks of the Murray and enjoy the iconic Australian bushland.

For your next Australian adventure, Mannum is not to be missed.

properties.name: BIG4 Renmark Riverfront Holiday Park
properties.description: Hello and welcome to the multi award winning BIG4 Renmark Riverfront Holiday Park. Our park is situated on the banks of the mighty Murray River in Renmark, South Australia and has almost 1km of absolute river frontage where you can enjoy uninterrupted river views from your luxury self contained accommodation or from your caravan and camping site.

properties.name: BIG4 Port Willunga Tourist Park
properties.description: The BIG4 Port Willunga Tourist Park is located on South Australia's lovely Fleurieu Peninsula, we are just an hour from Adelaide and 10 mins from the famed vineyards of the McLaren Vale. Walk to stunning beaches renowned for swimming, diving and surfing, enjoy local seafood and wine, or just relax in our peaceful, laid-back park.

properties.name: Port Pirie Visitor Information Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Light Country Visitor Information Centre (Kapunda)
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Pine Country Caravan Park Mount Gambier
properties.description: We are a small tranquil country park, family owned and operated. We are dedicated to provide our guests with a warm welcome, clean and tidy facilities at competitive rates.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Port Augusta
properties.description:
At the gateway to some of South Australia’s most spectacular destinations - the Flinders Ranges, outback and Spencer Gulf - is Port Augusta, just over 300 kilometres from Adelaide. Discovery Parks - Port Augusta (formerly Port Augusta Holiday Park) is the ideal holiday park to plan your great southern adventure.

It’s not every day you get to travel on a moving museum, but step on board the unique Pichi Richi Railway and you’ll understand why it’s so special. 

Discover local history with a tour of the iconic Royal Flying Doctor Service and Wadlata Outback Centre, where you will walk in the steps of the Aboriginal people who have lived here for 40,000 years.

properties.name: Yura Udnyu - Our Culture Your Culture
properties.description: Yura Udnyu - Our Culture, Your Culture is a unique and innovative Aboriginal cultural experience located in Darwin. It is the first of its kind in Australia and is run by the Larrakia people, the traditional owners of the Darwin area.

properties.name: Sacred Canyon - Yura Mulka - Cultural Walk
properties.description:
Join an experienced Yura guide for a fascinating Aboriginal cultural experience in the heart of the Flinders Ranges, South Australia. This is an entertaining and informative walk to Sacred Canyon, a significant site to the Adnyamathanha people, home to an abundance of ancient rock engravings in the smooth sandstone walls. 

Walk along a dry river bed to an Aboriginal engraving site where your Yura guide will explain how these engravings were made and what they signify. Learn about the engravings, landscape and culture as interpreted by a Traditional Owner.

properties.name: Wilpena Pound 3 Night Discovery Package
properties.description:
Visit Wilpena Pound Resort, the only accommodation located within the Ikara Flinders Ranges National Park, 430km north of Adelaide for a relaxing and informative three night stay. Immerse yourself in this extraordinary 800 million years old landscape that has been home to Adnyamathanha people for tens of thousands of years. 

Enjoy a haven of outback hospitality on this exclusive 3 night package that includes a Welcome to Country ceremony, a half day 4WD Aboriginal cultural tour, accommodation and meals. Wilpena Pound Resort is the perfect base to explore the surrounding area with guided Aboriginal cultural walks, nature and bush walks, and 'must do' scenic flights.

properties.name: Time Travel & Gorgeous Gorges Half Day Tour
properties.description: Australia has the world's oldest visible geology on Earth and much of this can be found in the Ikara-Flinders Ranges. The gorges around Wilpena Pound Resort provide a fascinating history of the Ikara-Flinders Ranges and are visible in the fossil layers; a 'Corridor Through Time'. Explore over 100 million years of history whilst marveling at the rugged beauty of Brachina and Bunyeroo Gorges. Search for Yellow Footed Rock Wallabies and see spectacular, sweeping views.

properties.name: Flinders Ranges Sunset Spectacular
properties.description: Discover the history of the Adnyamathanha people as you enjoy views of this breathtaking ancient landscape as day turns to night. Observe the changing colours of sunset over Wilpena Pound and the Ikara - Flinders Ranges, and marvel at this vast ancient landscape from a spectacular local viewing location. Don't forget your camera, this tour offers unrivalled photographic opportunities! This tour lasts approximately 2 hrs with beverages and canapes provided.

properties.name: Adelaide Oval- Roof Climb Twilight
properties.description:
Experience the icon like never before on RoofClimb Twilight. Trained RoofClimb Leaders will guide you across the highest points of the Oval’s unique roofline and share the historical wonders of Adelaide, highlighting key landmarks across the breathtaking skyline. Those who dare can try the lean-out, 50 metres over the field of play. 

**highlights:**
-   Two hour guided roof top climb at Twilight
-   One of Australia's most popular stadiums
-   Spectacular views of the stadium & Adelaide
-   Receive a group photo, certificate & cap
-   Great introduction to Adelaide
-   Perfect experience for the sports fan

properties.name: Penong Caravan Park
properties.description:
Penong Caravan Park is one of the friendliest and quietest parks you'll find.

Located opposite Penong's famous Windmill Museum and the Nullarbor Links Hole 3 Golf Course, it is also the ideal base for trips to Cactus Beach with its world class left and right-hand breaks, the pink and blue lakes and sheltered Point Sinclair.

Penong is either your first or last stop with town services for your Nullarbor adventure.

Come and meet new owners Mick and Jen Aitken who'll make sure your stay is a great one.

properties.name: Stansbury Caravan Park
properties.description:
Located on the foreshore of panoramic Oyster Bay, Stansbury Caravan Park is an easy 2 hour drive from Adelaide. With stunning ocean views and accommodation to suit all needs, it is the perfect holiday destination. 

Our Foreshore Park offers a variety of accommodation guaranteeing instant relaxation from the moment you arrive. We accommodate pets in this park all year round. Please see our Oyster Point Drive link for pet-friendly options.

properties.name: Morgan Riverside Caravan Park
properties.description:
Morgan Caravan Park is situated on the banks of the beautiful River Murray, while in walking distance to the town facilities. There is so much to do whether you enjoy fishing, canoeing, water skiing, bird watching, swimming, a round of mini golf or just sitting back and relaxing in our pleasant environment.
We allow pets on our powered and unpowered sites and also in our basic (non ensuite) cabins

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Clare
properties.description:
Say hello to Discovery Parks - Clare, your slice of South Australian scenic magic. Just a stone's throw from the town centre and the famous Riesling Trail.

Discovery Parks - Clare provides a range of comfortable accommodation options, including modern cabins and well-maintained camping sites. The park’s location in Clare makes it an excellent base for exploring the Clare Valley and its attractions. 

Whether you're visiting for a weekend getaway or an extended stay, the park offers a relaxing environment with all the necessary amenities.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Whyalla Foreshore
properties.description:
Hey there, sun-chaser! Ever heard of Whyalla? With 300 sunny days a year, it's your perfect slice of South Australia. At Discovery Parks - Whyalla Foreshore, we've got you set for a full-on, or laid-back, adventure.

Discovery Parks - Whyalla Foreshore provides a comfortable and convenient stay with a range of accommodation options, including modern cabins and well-maintained camping sites. 

Its prime location along the foreshore makes it an ideal base for exploring the attractions of Whyalla and the surrounding Eyre Peninsula region. 

The park’s facilities and location make it a great choice for both short-term stays and extended vacations.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Barossa Valley
properties.description:
Welcome to Discovery Parks - Barossa Valley, where the grapevine literally meets your front door. Nestled near the heart of Tanunda, this is your ultimate South Australian basecamp for wine country adventures. Deluxe Safari Tents for the romantics, and a waterpark for the kids— we've got your holiday and accommodation sorted. Pop that cork and get ready for adventure.

Discovery Parks – Barossa Valley is the perfect base for exploring Australia’s most famous wine region, just minutes from Tanunda. Set amidst scenic vineyards and charming townships, the park offers a tranquil getaway with a range of accommodation options.

For a luxurious stay, book one of our new Deluxe Safari Tents. Located in a private area, these eco-luxe tents offer stunning vineyard views and include hotel-style ensuites, a private deck, and access to exclusive amenities like an outdoor lounge, BBQ space, firepit, and heated pool. Ideal for romantic getaways, special events, or a peaceful retreat.

For family fun, the park also features a large waterpark with slides and splash zones, plus newly launched cabins and powered sites. Explore nearby wineries, historic sites, and enjoy great dining, scenic tours, and art galleries.

properties.name: Highway 1 Caravan & Tourist Park
properties.description: Highway 1 Holiday & Lifestyle Park is a lush tropical haven perfect for singles, couples, and families looking to unwind. Sitting 30 minutes out of Adelaide CBD and the picturesque Barossa Valley, Highway 1 makes a convenient place for exploring South Australia’s best travel hotspots while providing a serene holiday atmosphere.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Lake Bonney
properties.description:
Discovery Parks - Lake Bonney, where the water's so close you could practically roll out of bed and into a kayak. Swimming, sailing, windsurfing, you name it. If you can do it in a lake, it's here. 

More of a landlubber? With 17 National Parks around, you’ll run out of breath before you run out of trails.

Discovery Parks – Lake Bonney offers the ultimate lakeside escape in South Australia's Riverland, where lake life is more than just a saying – it’s the real deal.

Dive into water fun with a water trampoline, water park, two pools, and rental equipment like canoes and paddleboats. After enjoying the lake, explore 17 National Parks filled with hiking trails. Prefer slides over hikes? Our new waterpark is a splash hit for all ages.

Wine lovers can indulge at the nearby Banrock Wine and Wetlands Centre, while local festivals and Monash Adventure Park provide even more entertainment for the whole family.

Whether you’re seeking water adventures or a relaxing wine experience with a scenic view, Discovery Parks – Lake Bonney has you covered.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Adelaide Beachfront
properties.description:
Discovery Parks – Adelaide Beachfront offers the perfect South Australian getaway in Semaphore, where the beach is your backyard and the city is just a short drive away.

With pedal carts for the kids, BBQ areas for the adults, and plenty of fun activities, your holiday is set. Relax and enjoy a truly memorable stay.

Located in the seaside suburb of Semaphore, the park puts you steps from the beach. Explore nearby museums, cafes, and boutiques, or enjoy local fish and chips. For day trips, visit the Giant Pandas at Adelaide Zoo, go whale watching at Victor Harbour, or explore the historic town of Hahndorf.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Goolwa
properties.description:
Discovery Parks – Goolwa. A comfortable park that will act as the perfect home base as you explore all the Fleurieu Peninsula has to offer. With a range of accommodation options from family villas to drive thru sites, you’ll find the ideal accommodation for you whether you’re a family, camper or solo traveller.

Spend your days exploring the town which is full of places to eat and things to see. With a beach that you can drive onto, Goolwa is a popular gateway to the Coorong National Park and you can head all the way up to the Murray Mouth where the mighty Murray River meets the Southern Ocean. Be sure to take a ride on the cockle train which runs daily between Goolwa and Victor Harbor and allows you to explore Middleton and Port Elliot in between.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Roxby Downs
properties.description:
Experience the rugged beauty of the Australian outback at Discovery Parks – Roxby Downs. Located less than a day’s drive from Adelaide, this is a place where the landscape leaves you speechless. The BHP Billiton Olympic Dam isn’t just a mine; it’s a unique experience in itself. 

Keep the adventure alive with a guided sunset trek at the Arid Recovery Reserve, where you can spot native wildlife and learn to interpret the desert’s secrets. Don’t miss Andamooka, the opal capital, where you might just be tempted to trade your dog for a gemstone—just kidding, bring your pup along to Discovery Parks – Roxby Downs!

properties.name: Lakeside Tourist Park
properties.description: Beautifully situated and sheltered from the sea breezes, Robe's Lakeside Tourist Park in South Australia is nestled amongst trees on the shores of picturesque Lake Fellmongery. This pretty caravan park has heritage history, is a lovely quiet spot for a holiday, and offers varied accommodation, shelter, shade, spacious green grassy sites and friendly service. Lakeside Robe offers the perfect respite from a hectic lifestyle.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Robe
properties.description:
Discovery Parks – Robe offers the perfect South Australian escape, just a 4-hour drive from Adelaide. The journey will fly by with kids' games and playlist debates along the way.

By day, embrace adventure—whether it’s off-roading through Little Dip National Park or catching waves at Long Beach. For a more relaxed pace, take a dip in the heated indoor pool or visit the Robe Town Brewery for a craft beer tasting.

The park offers a variety of accommodations, from cozy cabins to caravan sites that’ll test your parallel parking skills. Come experience the best of Robe at Discovery Parks!

properties.name: Mikkira Station Koala Sanctuary
properties.description:
Open to visitors in the winter months from May to October.

Tours etc can be arranged at other times on request.  Please click the email link below and send us your requirements and contact details and we will get back to you.

Experience the wonder of koalas in their natural habitat at Mikkira Station Koala Sanctuary, located on Eyre Peninsula just south of Port Lincoln. This privately owned sanctuary is a haven for koalas, kangaroos, emus and other native Australian wildlife. Spot koalas lounging in the manna gum trees, observe kangaroos and emus roaming freely, and camp overnight under the stars for a truly unforgettable wildlife encounter.

Mikkira Station offers guided tours or self-guided exploration for visitors to learn about koala conservation and the unique ecosystem of the Eyre Peninsula. It's a perfect day trip or overnight stay for families and nature lovers.

No motorbikes and no dogs are permitted.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Hahndorf Resort
properties.description:
Say hello to Discovery Parks - Hahndorf, in the heart of the Adelaide Hills. Just 20 minutes from the big smoke of Adelaide, and you're in a world flavoured with German charm and Adelaide Hills' beauty.

Discovery - Hahndorf Resort is a premium destination that combines the serenity of the Adelaide Hills with modern comforts and amenities. The resort offers a variety of accommodation options, including deluxe cabins, cottages, and well-equipped camping sites, making it a perfect choice for couples, families, and groups. 

Its tranquil setting and proximity to the attractions of Hahndorf and the Adelaide Hills make it an ideal base for exploring the region.

properties.name: Barossa Helicopters
properties.description:
Experience the Barossa Valley like never before with Barossa Helicopters! For travelers seeking soft adventure, our exhilarating aerial tours offer a bird's-eye view of South Australia's wine country. Glide over vineyards, rolling hills, and charming villages, soaking in the breathtaking scenery. Choose from a variety of flight itineraries, from short joyrides to extended tours, all guided by our experienced pilots providing informative commentary.

Capture stunning photos and create lasting memories as you witness the valley's beauty from above. Whether you're a wine enthusiast or nature lover, Barossa Helicopters promises an unforgettable addition to your journey through one of Australia's most renowned regions. Unleash your sense of adventure and let us take you on a sky-high exploration of the Barossa! Plus, we've got you covered with plenty of room for off-street parking of caravans and motorhomes.

properties.name: Three75 Bar + Kitchen
properties.description: The most recent addition to the Barossa culinary landscape, The Louise presents a cool and sophisticated bar with a view. Three75 + kitchen is the place to watch the sun go down over this special wine valley, cocktail in hand and burger at the ready.

properties.name: Appellation
properties.description: Appellation at The Louise is one of Australia’s finest dining destinations showcasing the finest produce and food culture of the Barossa. Appellation celebrates the world-renowned wines of its local region along with exemplary wines from around the world, paired with local, seasonal, fresh ingredients to deliver an inspired match of food and wine.

properties.name: Willow Glen Alpaca Farm
properties.description:
Willow Glen is set in the Adelaide Hills on 10 acres, close to Hahndorf and bordering the Onkaparinga River. The property is a private farm with 2 dams and views extending across the valley. There are a number of suitable locations to for bush camping.

​Site access is limited to dry weather and vehicles with single axle camper trailer or tent. It is recommend for vehicles with higher ground clearance.

​A number of alpacas and sheep share the camp grounds. Sites suit bush camping with limited amenities. Potable water is available upon request but there are no toilets or services on site.

There are a number of great wineries in the area all with excellent food and produce you can enjoy.

Campers must be self contained with their own camping toilet and water and take all rubbish with them upon departure. Due to the livestock on site dogs unfortunately are not allowed.

properties.name: Discovery Resorts - Wilpena Pound
properties.description:
Discovery Resorts - Wilpena Pound is as the only accommodation within the Ikara-Flinders Ranges National Park, providing a unique opportunity to stay in the midst of this spectacular natural wonder. 

For those on foot, take an easy walk along Wilpena Creek to the much-photographed Cazneaux Tree. Other favourites include Hills Homestead, the Wangarra Lookouts for spectacular views and the walk to Old Wilpena Station. The resort a wide range of guided walking tours.

properties.name: Port Vincent Caravan Park and Seaside Cabins
properties.description: Beachfront caravan park located on a quiet beach in Port Vincent with a large range of accommodation, powered and unpowered sites. Choose from our beachfront spa cabin, deluxe cabins, standard cabins, economy cabins & some powered or unpowered sites

properties.name: Kimba Recreation Reserve
properties.description: This is a designated camping area at the Kimba Recreation reserve. It is a large town park with fitness and recreation facilities like basketball and tennis courts. A carpark is set aside for RVs and campers to stay by donation. There is a picnic area, rubbish bins, potable water, showers, toilets, and plenty of space. There is some but limited shade. The area is gravel surfaced and all types of vehicles can access the area.

properties.name: Greenock Centenary Park
properties.description: This is a large and grassy camping area with good amenities. It offers many walking tracks, plenty of shade and a playground for children. Suitable for big rigs. Donation is requested.

properties.name: Mount Gambier Central Caravan Park
properties.description: Mount Gambier Central Caravan Park really is central.

properties.name: Sea Vu Caravan Park
properties.description: Welcome to Sea Vu! In the heart of the beautiful township of Robe, situated on South Australia’s magnificent Limestone Coast.

properties.name: Edithburgh Caravan Park
properties.description: Located on the South-Eastern tip of South Australia’s Yorke Peninsula

properties.name: Port Parham Foreshore
properties.description: This is a medium sized camping ground at Port Parham, on the Esplanade. The road is dirt and has a 5 Tonne limit. There is a large level hard park sand and dirt surface that could accommodate 15-20 vehicles. The campground has a barbecue, picnic area, toilet, drinking water from tap and rubbish + recycling bins. The campground is only a short walk to the beach but is sheltered by bush and sand dunes. There is little shade. All types of vehicles can access this area. No dumping of waste water.

properties.name: Padthaway Caravan Park
properties.description: Welcome to Padthaway Caravan Park.
properties.fees: Onsite Vans- $40Powered Sites- $30Unpowered Sites- $20 double*$10 extra personBackpacker Rooms$35 for 1 person***Camp KitchenFees apply for unpowered site visitors

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Kangaroo Island
properties.description:
Located just a short 10-minute drive from Flinders Chase National Park, Discovery Parks – Kangaroo Island is your perfect base for exploring the park’s wilderness and the rugged coastline of the island's western side. Be sure to visit the stunning Remarkable Rocks and Admirals Arch, where you might even spot a seal basking on the rocks.

The park offers a variety of accommodation options to suit all types of travelers, including spacious powered and unpowered sites, as well as luxury cabins for families or groups seeking a bit more comfort. Set in a tranquil bushland environment, the park provides all the amenities for a comfortable stay, including a fully equipped camp kitchen, modern toilet and shower facilities, a licensed shop for essentials, fuel, a guest laundry, a children’s playground, outdoor BBQ areas, and opportunities to spot local wildlife.

Wildlife encounters are a common delight at the park, with frequent sightings of koalas, kangaroos, wallabies, echidnas, and a wide variety of bird species. Explore the surrounding bush walks and immerse yourself in the natural beauty of Kangaroo Island.

properties.name: Waterfront Holiday Park
properties.description: Campsite with beautiful views over the Murray River and a very friendly, helpful front desk.

Enjoy your stay.

properties.description: Gawler Gateway Tourist Park

properties.name: Rawnsley Park Station
properties.description:
Overlooking the southern side of Wilpena Pound, Rawnsley Park Station provides the perfect base for exploring South Australia's beautiful Flinders Ranges.

Rawnsley Park Station is committed to environmental sustainability and social and cultural responsibility. We believe that human-caused greenhouse gas emissions are a chief cause of global warming and that their reduction may reduce the speed and degree of global warming.

properties.name: Ceduna Shelly Beach Caravan Park
properties.description:
Experience our Luxury Spa Villas and Eco Shacks with stunning ocean views or choose from one of our many spacious private sites, some with ensuites. Enjoy the tranquility of our 55 acre park that offers a sand dune walk trail and 1km of beach frontage.

Accredited and award winning accommodation business, friendly customer service and 24 hour check in service. Beach fishing, swimming, kayaking, windsurfing, snorkelling and free crab net hire and crab cooker in season. Free grapes and figs in season.

properties.name: Ceduna Foreshore Caravan Park
properties.description: A peaceful seaside town overlooking the beautiful Murat Bay.

properties.name: Port Kenny Caravan Park
properties.description: Port Kenny Caravan Park provides 40 powered and 40 unpowered sties as well as ensuite units, caravan sites and backpacker accomodation. Facilities include showers, toilets, BBQ, washing machine, campers kitchen, playground, and games room. There is a resident manager onsite.

properties.name: Chinaman Creek Campground
properties.description: Campground located at the foot of the mangrove. 10km of gravel road for access. Gravelly land with trees, lots of spaces. Very nice place with lush nature a little windy. Outhouse.

properties.name: Fishermans Point Campground
properties.description: This campsite has sheltered beaches on either side, and is located on a raised rocky area.  There are 8 campistes suitable for small trailers,caravans and vehilce based camping. There is access for small boats by 4WD, along with acces to Yatchies beach. Facilities include toilets, picnic tables, and a wood fireplace. You will need to bring water and firewood. Permits are required.

properties.name: Kingston SE Jetty Parking Area
properties.description: Large and spacious parking with a designated area for overnight stays (self-contained vehicles only). There is a flushing toilet with hand driers and a basic cold shower. There are also picnic tables, a modern playground and seafood shop just nearby.

properties.name: Lake Bonney Reserve
properties.description: This small rest area with good amenities is located on the bank of Lake Bonney and it's a good spot for swimming, fishing and boating (there is a boat ramp). 4WD recommended. Watch out for tree branches.

properties.name: Point Sturt
properties.description: Large campground with no facilities. It's a big grassy area (with underlying rocks) positioned by Lake Alexandrina, perfect for fishing, but not so much for swimming. Picturesque and tranquil!

properties.name: Williamstown Queen Victoria Jubilee Park
properties.description:
Williamstown Queen Victoria Jubilee Park: A Relaxing Escape in the Barossa Valley 

Surrounded by the rolling hills of South Australia's Barossa Valley, Williamstown Queen Victoria Jubilee Park offers a tranquil escape for visitors seeking a break from the everyday. This scenic park, located just an hour's drive from Adelaide, boasts a variety of amenities that cater to families, campers, and nature enthusiasts.

properties.name: Rivergum Cruises
properties.description: Rivergum cruises offer a unique blend of adventure, relaxation, and wildlife exploration. It allows you to get up close and personal with the captivating nature, unique birdlife, and local fauna while taking in the scenic beauty of the riverbanks and limestone cliffs. It's an experience that provides a deep connection to the natural wonders of the River Murray region.

properties.name: Baldwin's Budget Van Park
properties.description:
Big sites for all sized vehicles, camping, powered sites, non powered sites, cabins, budget motel style rooms, workers accommodation, fully self contained bungalow, family rooms with shared facilities.

No extra charge for kids.

properties.name: Wellington Caravan Park
properties.description: Quiet peaceful caravan park. Some lawned powered sites. Lots of shade. Ideal location for day trips to coorong, murrayland & fleurieu regions.

properties.name: Gulfhaven Caravan Park
properties.description: The Gulfhaven Caravan Park is located right on the magnificent beachfront at Port Victoria in South Australia. The attractive Park offers an abundance of accommodation choices from powered sites through to budget and upmarket de-luxe cabins, some with total foreshore views and access.

properties.name: Middle Beach Caravan Park
properties.description: Short or long term, bird sanctuary, national park. All Welcome!

properties.name: Barley Stacks Wines
properties.description: Barley Stacks Wines is the first commercial vineyard and winery to be established on the traditional barley belt of the Yorke Peninsula, SA. The vision of the vineyard was to transform the rich grey loam over limestone soil sloping paddocks into a vineyard, producing premium grapes. Owned and operated by the Schulz family who have a high level of determination, passion and commitment to ensuring only premium wines are produced. The wine produced at Barley Stacks Wines is made from grapes grown in our own vineyards, which are also crushed, fermented, stored and bottled on site. The onsite process allows for strict quality control of all facets of the wine production. The vineyard has a strong focus on environmental sustainability and ensuring leading edge technology is utilised to maintain consistently high quality wines. Our Cellar Door is open daily from 10am to 5pm (excluding Good Friday & Christmas Day).

properties.name: Palate 2 Palette
properties.description: Palate 2 Palette is located in the main street of Port Broughton with views of the bay and jetty. Owners, Grant and Helen Rowlands, have renovated and redesigned a 100 year old building to accommodate a restaurant, wine bar, coffee lounge and art gallery featuring works by established and emerging artists. Palate 2 Palette offers a fresh innovative menu influenced by the tastes and flavours of Asia and Europe, fine wines, great coffee, good art and on the first Sunday of the month live music from 1pm to 4pm, to provide a feast for all the senses.

properties.name: Cape Jaffa Caravan Park
properties.description: Located just 3.5 hours south of Adelaide, Cape Jaffa is a peaceful coastal holiday town located between Kingston SE and Robe in South Australia.

properties.name: Bordertown Caravan Park
properties.description: Bordertown Caravan Park is situated 280km from Adelaide and 450km from Melbourne in the Tatiara Region.

properties.name: Keith Caravan Park
properties.description:
Keith is recognised as the Gateway to the South East and the Limestone Coast, a two hour drive from Adelaide or Mount Gambier. It is an ideal base to explore the region’s caves, wineries and wave beaten coastlines.

Conveniently located, the Keith Caravan Park is a short walk to main street with bakery, hotel, craft/gift and coffee shop.

Enjoy a quiet, clean and family friendly park bordering a Conservation Park.

properties.name: Millicent Lakeside Caravan Park
properties.description:
Millicent Lakeside Caravan Park is a friendly, family-owned caravan park in Millicent. 

Located between Adelaide and Melbourne in the Limestone Coast region of South Australia, it is the perfect base for individuals, groups and families wishing to visit the fabulous nearby attractions.

properties.name: Beachside Holiday Park
properties.description: 75kms south of Adelaide

properties.name: Woodcroft Park
properties.description: Located in a peaceful bushland and creek setting with lawn common areas

properties.name: Wirreanda Bunkhouse
properties.description: Wirreanda offers spacious dormitory-style accommodation, located at one of the region’s most visited tourism attractions - the World-Heritage Listed Naracoorte Caves National Park.

properties.name: Wilpena Pound Lookout
properties.description:
Wilpena Pound Lookout sits within the stunning Flinders Ranges National Park, surrounded by some of the most spectacular scenery in South Australia - 430 kilometres north of Adelaide. 

This extraordinary landscape is 800 million years old and has been home to Adnyamathanha people for tens of thousands of years.

It's also one of the best Flinders Range viewpoint to view the Southern Aurora, thanks to its expansive views of the night sky, with minimal light pollution, making it an ideal location for witnessing the mesmerising display of the Aurora Australis.

properties.name: Echo Holiday Parks – Waikerie
properties.description: Waikerie Holiday Park

properties.name: Venus Bay Beachfront Tourist Park
properties.description: Venus Bay Beachfront Tourist Park

properties.name: Prairie Hotel
properties.description:
The Prairie Hotel is where the Flinders Ranges meets the Outback, in Parachilna, South Australia - population two! 

A family owned and run hotel, and licensed since 1876, it is a jewel of the region, a perfect base for exploring the Flinders and Outback, and acknowledged as one of the Hip Hotels of the World.

properties.name: Port Neill Caravan Park
properties.description:
Port Neill Caravan Park offers a peaceful, coastal town to relax enjoy and take in the history of the local area. The park is near sandy beaches with magnificent views of the bay. 

Port Neill is located between the Tumby Bay and Arno Bay townships just off the main highway (one hour drive from Port Lincoln).

properties.name: Port Lincoln Tourist Park
properties.description: Port Lincoln Tourist Park is rated 4 star and is situated on the foreshore of Port Lincoln, with uninterrupted views to Boston Island and Lincoln National Park. The Park has a large range of on-site accommodation options including executive units

properties.name: Pine Point Caravan Park
properties.description: The Park came about with the closure of the Pine Point School in 1971. Clean and comfortable onsite caravans are available for hire. They are fully equipped and you need only bring bedding, personal towels, food and drink.

properties.name: Paringa Caravan Park
properties.description: The Paringa Caravan Park is set in a beautiful bush setting only four kilometres from Renmark.

properties.name: Murray Bridge Resort Caravan Park and Marina
properties.description: Come and stay in style with an amazing view of the spectacular Murray River in one of our park units or scenic campsites.

properties.name: Mount Barker Caravan and Tourist Park
properties.description: Mount Barker Caravan and Tourist Park is in the Adelaide Hills and is a great base to see the Hills, Adelaide, Fleurieu Peninsula and Barossa. The park has a range of cabins and powered and unpowered sites available. Dogs are welcome but not inside the cabins.

properties.name: Moonta Bay Holiday Park
properties.description: Situated on the water's edge

properties.name: Middleton Caravan Park
properties.description:
Middleton Caravan Park is centrally located on the South Coast of the Fleurieu Peninsula in South Australia between Goolwa and Victor Harbor. 

Only one hour from Adelaide. Middleton has some of the state's best surfing beaches and whale watching vantage points, all within a 5 minute walk from the park.

properties.name: Merna Mora Station

properties.name: BIG4 Marion Holiday Park

BIG4 Marion Holiday Park: Your Family Getaway in the Fleurieu Peninsula

Escape to BIG4 Marion Holiday Park and discover the beauty of South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula. Located in the heart of Marion Bay, our park offers a range of accommodation options to suit every family, from spacious cabins to powered caravan and camping sites.   

Enjoy our fantastic park facilities, including a swimming pool, playground, games room, and BBQ areas.

 Explore the stunning coastline, with its pristine beaches and rugged cliffs, or visit nearby attractions like Granite Island and the d'Arenberg Cube.

properties.name: Laura Community Caravan Park
properties.description: Laura Community Caravan Park is located in the Southern Flinders Ranges.

properties.description: Lake Saint Clair is a secluded and private resort catering to the requirements of first time social nudist and devoted naturalists, featuring 25 powered caravan sites and self contained cabins which overlook the beautiful Lake Saint Clair. The resort has an indoor salt water heated pool, sauna and spa.

properties.name: Seafront Holiday Park
properties.description:
Seafront Holiday Park is arguably one of the most beautiful spots on Kangaroo Island, Australia. 
Choose from our Eco Luxury Glamping Tents, Bell Tents, Oceanview Villa's and Powered Sites. 
Surrounded by nature, glampers, campers and caravaners will be able to enjoy long hikes, ocean views, and will get to know the unique wildlife that calls this area home.

properties.name: Elliston Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Elliston Caravan Park, situated opposite the Elliston town jetty and beach. The park offers a relaxed holiday atmosphere to any avid camper, fisherman, family or group. 

The sites are flat and covered in the lush green grass even during summer, with clean modern amenities. If you are looking for a bit of comfort you can choose from the holiday units, one or two bedroom ensuite cabins are available.

properties.name: Coward Springs Campground
properties.description: Coward Springs Campground is between Marree (130 kilometres north-west) and William Creek (77 kilometres south-east). It is an oasis, a restored and heritage-listed railway site and a place to relax and really get a sense of the outback and its history.

properties.name: Cobdogla Station Caravan Park
properties.description:
You’ll find a clean, quiet and friendly caravan park ideal for families. The park borders a lagoon, providing a stunning backdrop for picturesque photographic opportunities, especially at sunset. 
The lagoon is ideal for bird watching, fishing and kayaking. You can launch your own tinny from the lagoon’s edge with entry to the main river. Alternatively, use the Bruno bay boat ramp which is located conveniently next door to the park. 
Our park is known for it’s relaxed country charm and you can’t help but feel stress free and rejuvenated.

properties.name: Catninga Mountain Hut
properties.description: Catninga Mountain Hut is ideally suited to the adventure camper or Heysen Trail walkers looking for a basic camp with facilities. Enjoy a hot camp shower after a long days walk. The hut is four wheel drive (low range) accessible from Catninga Homestead.

properties.name: Catninga Accommodation
properties.description: Secluded Bush Camps, Homestead Powered Sites, Mountain Hut on the Heysen trail, the Caravan or the wonderful old train carriage B&B - we've got it all.

properties.name: Carrieton Caravan Park
properties.description:
Carrieton Caravan Park is situated in the township of Carrieton in the Southern Flinders Ranges. 
The park offers on site powered and unpowered caravan sites, lawn camping and the old School Principal residence is now a self contained cottage with the old classroom now a bunkhouse.

properties.name: Burra Caravan and Camping Park
properties.description: The Burra Caravan and Camping Park is situated on the banks of the Burra Creek

properties.name: Berri Riverside Holiday Park
properties.description: Centrally located in the Riverland

properties.name: Southern Ocean Tourist Park
properties.description:
Beachport's Southern Ocean Tourist Park: Your Perfect Escape

In the heart of Beachport, South Australia, Southern Ocean Tourist Park offers an idyllic escape for nature lovers and travelers seeking a relaxing seaside experience.

Just a stone's throw away from the pristine shores of the Southern Ocean, the park boasts a peaceful location surrounded by beautiful coastal bushland.

properties.name: Beachport Caravan Park
properties.description: Beachport Caravan Park is located on the beachfront overlooking Rivoli Bay.

properties.name: Ardrossan Caravan Park
properties.description: Situated only 150km from Adelaide on the western shores of Gulf St Vincent, Ardrossan is the largest and most progressive coastal township on the Yorke Peninsula.

properties.name: Angorichina Tourist Village
properties.description: Angorichina Village, near Parachilna is surrounded by a panorama of breathtaking rugged hills, mountains and countryside and is central to most of the major attractions within the Flinders Ranges. You can spend the days discovering the gorges, seeing the wildflowers when in season and spotting the native fauna.

properties.name: Alpana Station
properties.description:
Alpana Station is an historic family owned merino wool producing property situated near Blinman in the Flinders Ranges. 

Facilities at the station are of a high standard with an uninterrupted view of the Alpana Creek and surrounding hills.

properties.description: The Adare Camp & Caravan Park is nestled alongside the beautiful Hindmarsh River with many nature walking trails and a short walk into Victor Harbor town centre. Adare has 55 grassed powered sites, many of which have shade.

properties.name: Almerta Station
properties.description:
Almerta Station is a unique destination in the Finders Ranges, just three and half hour's drive north of Adelaide. You will find a range of accommodation from the very comfortable Shearer's Quarters through to several camp sites in pristine creek settings throughout the property.

Once here you can explore the stunning beauty of the unspoilt natural environment. You can walk, cycle or taking exhilarating drives along the station tracks (suitable for most vehicles).

Make sure you explore the natural spring which retains water all year round; an ecosystem which forms an important habitant for fauna and flora.  With clear running water, native fish, yabbies and water birds- it's a place of silence and beauty.

At Almerta Station you can be part of a community and interact with the property owners - bringing back the values of life which is sometimes lost in the day-to-day rush.

Almerta will revive your senses.

The Moolooloo Shearer's Quarters can accommodate up to 20 peo...

properties.name: Willangi Bush Escapes
properties.description: Willangi Bush Escapes campsite allows you to get back to basics and experience the real outback. The sites are situated in secluded bush and mallee areas overlooking rolling hills and close to a sandy creek where children can play or leisurely strolls can be enjoyed.

properties.name: Discovery Lagoon Camping Grounds
properties.description:
Discovery Lagoon Campground on Kangaroo Island offers an eco-friendly experience, set in 4 acres of bushland beside the historical Discovery Lagoon. The lagoon is home to migratory birds in winter, while the site is often visited by wallabies, echidnas, kangaroos, and koalas.

Our off-grid campsite uses solar power and gas, with powered sites (#29–#36) available. The shower block features hot water, sinks with mirrors, and power outlets for device charging (no hairdryers allowed). There’s also a coin-operated laundry and a spacious camp kitchen with BBQs, gas rings, a fridge, and a herb garden for fresh cooking ingredients.

Picnic tables are scattered throughout, and our caravan sites are flat with drinking water. Tent sites are also spacious, though without water. At night, enjoy the starry skies and serene sounds of wildlife, making for a magical outback experience.

Come and explore the beauty and tranquility of Kangaroo Island at Discovery Lagoon Campground!

Facilities include amenitites block, BBQ, fire pits, dump point, laundromat, camp kitchen and tv room. Payments must be made by cash only. The office is open from April to October. There is a caretaker on site during the winter months for all bookings.

properties.name: Cummins Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Cummins Caravan & Cabin Park is a small, yet peaceful park located centrally on the Lower Eyre Peninsula, in the thriving township of Cummins, South Australia. As many visitors have stated it is the perfect place to base yourself for exploring the Eyre Peninsula. 

Created in 2000 by a group of enthusiastic local volunteers, this Park is another example of the great community spirit that Cummins is known for. Located on Council land at the southern end of the township, it hosts 2 self contained cabins (linen included), 8 powered sites, 4 non-powered sites and easily accommodates recreational vehicles. 

The added bonus to the very affordable rates is the free use of laundry facilities, free BBQ (located under shelter) and grassed surrounds. 

An easy walk down the street to the local shopping area will take you past the local Railway Triangle Park. This is home to some amazing mosaic creations, local history, public toilets, children's playground & free BBQ's. 

Bookings for the community Caravan Park are taken via the Cummins Takeaway & Deli, open 7 days & located at 62 Bruce Terrace. Cummins, SA.

properties.name: Great Australian Bight - Scenic Lookout No 3
properties.description:
The Great Australian Bight - Scenic Lookout No 3 is a breathtaking vantage point situated along the rugged coastline of southern Australia. 

It offers awe-inspiring views of the vast Southern Ocean, with towering limestone cliffs plunging dramatically into the deep blue waters below. This pristine location showcases the natural beauty of the Bight region, featuring unique rock formations, pristine beaches, and abundant wildlife. 

Scenic Lookout No 3 provides an unforgettable glimpse into the raw, untamed beauty of Australia's southern coast.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.

The surface is level and dirt and any type of vehicle can access this area. Shade is available. There is also access to the Freycinet Trail, an 8km walking, cycling, and driving trail.

properties.name: Mount Gambier Crater Lakes Trail
properties.description:
Experience the joy of strolling, jogging, or cycling amidst the awe-inspiring landscapes encircling the dormant volcanic crater lakes of Mount Gambier on the mesmerizing Crater Lakes Trail. 

Embark on this 4.2-kilometre adventure, commencing your journey at one of three spectacular vantage points: Mark's Lookout, Lions Lookout, or the Rotary Clubs Lookout (Potters Point Lookout). The trail will seamlessly lead you through the captivating terrain that defines Mount Gambier's unparalleled charm. As you traverse the trail encircling the volcanic craters' rims, take pause at various scenic lookouts, each offering a unique perspective of the surrounding beauty. Don't miss the opportunity to visit the Centenary Tower lookout, where you can bask in panoramic vistas stretching as far as the southern ocean on clear days.

properties.description: Point Lowly offers basic camping amenities close to the beach. Fees must be deposited in the repository and tickets displayed in the vehicle. Maximum stay of 14 days.

properties.name: Apex-Lions Park Kimba
properties.description: Apex-Lions Park is located on the Cunningham Hwy. Facilities include BBQ, picnic tables, shleter shed, toilets, skate park, children's playground, and dump point. Local attractions include Driver Reviver station and Olive Walkway. There is a maximum stay of 24 hours.

properties.name: Carpenter Rocks Community Assoc Camp
properties.description: Carpenter Rocks Community Assoc Camp is behind the community hall. Designated campsite for tents and self contained caravans and motorhomes. Maximum stay 14 nights. No open fires. Camping fees can be paid at the local store.

properties.name: Pinnaroo Caravan Park
properties.description: Pinnaroo Caravan Park provides powered and unpowered sites. Features include camp kitchen, amenitites block, laundry facilities, swimming pool, and rain water. Pets are allowed on a lead.

properties.name: Rocky Paddock Campground
properties.description:
Rocky Paddock Campground located in Mount Crawford Forest, provides sites for vehicle-based camping and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, picnic tables and a wood fireplace. You will need to bring your own water. Activities include cycling and walking trails.

Forest visitors wishing to use a campsite for day visits will also be required to book and pay for their site online prior to arrival.

Use of fire pits within picnic areas will remain free of charge and available on a first-in, first-served basis.

Camping is permitted from 1 April to 30 November annually, outside of the fire danger season.

Fees apply for camping. Please make your booking online.

Wood fires are permitted from 1 May – 31 October annually. (These dates may change in seasons where high fire danger persists).

properties.name: Yackamoorundie Park
properties.description: Yackamoorundie Park offers 4 powered campsites suitable for caravans and big rigs and unpowered campinng sites. Facilities include toilets, showers, wood fireplace, picnic tables and children's playground.

properties.name: Speeds Point Camping Area
properties.description: Speeds Point camping area provides bush camping near Yanerbie Beach. There are no facilities available. In the area you can enjoy swimming and fishing. Contact Streaky Bay Information centre.

properties.name: September Beach Campground
properties.description: September Beach campground is located In Lincoln National Park, near the sand dunes by September beach. There are 11 sites available. Facilities include toilets, picnic shelters and wheelchair access to the beach. You will need to bring your own water. In the area you can enjoy beaches, walking trails and the park's bays.

properties.name: Parnka Point
properties.description: Located 23 km south of Meningie, Parnka Point camping area offers sites for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include BBQ, picnic tables, and toilets.

properties.name: Dry Creek Camp Area
properties.description: Down short dirt road, SC and non-SC welcome. Flush toilets, tap water, covered BBQ (pay to use), no fires. Minimal cell reception, but area for swimming.

properties.name: Cockatoo Lake Reserve
properties.description: Nice grassy camp area on the E bank of the lake. Toilets, picnic tables and bins available, as well as a childrens playground. Also a boat ramp, and it's a nice area for swimming and fishing. Located off Grubbed Rd, 19km S of Padthaway. Access via 4km gravel road

properties.name: Marne River Reserve
properties.description: Grassy rest area on the N bank of the river. Picnic tables and shade from trees available here. Located on Ridley Rd, 10km S of Sedan or 30km NE of Mount Pleasant.

properties.name: Arthurton Rest Area
properties.description: This is an Overnight Rest Area at Arthurton, between St Agatha's Church on Third St and the cemetery. There are male and female flush toilets and rubbish bins. The area is a large level gravel carpark. Any type of vehicle can access this area. There is no signage. There is some shade and the area is peaceful and quiet. Maximum stay:  24 Hours

properties.name: Alford Recreation Reserve Community Park
properties.description: This is a community park in the locality of Alford. There are picnic tables and shelters, a playground, public toilet, dump station, potable water, and rubbish and recycling bins. The surface is sealed and it is a quiet and peaceful area. All vehicles can access this park. Maximum stay:  72 Hours

properties.name: Half Way Rest Area
properties.description: This is a standard medium sized rest area on the B100 Flinders Highway. The surface is rocky gravel and level and all vehicles can access this area. The area extends about 100 meters from the road and there are some dirt tracks that lead away into the bush. There are rubbish bins and picnic tables and no other facilities. Shade and shelter from wind is available. Road noise exists.

properties.name: Sherlock Rest Area
properties.description: Gravel rest area on Mallee Hwy in Sherlock. Picnic table and bins here, some shade from trees. Located opposite the hall, where there are toilets you can use.

properties.name: Blyth RV Park
properties.description: Camping area at the sports oval in Blyth. Located on Blyth Rd, 12km W of Clare. Max stay: 48hrs.

properties.name: Bowman Park Camping
properties.description: This is a camping area for self-contained vehicles only. It has fire pits and a sheltered picnic area. Potable water is available. It is shaded under large trees. Any vehicle can access this peaceful area. Maximum stay:  48 Hours

properties.name: Great Australian Bight - Scenic Lookout No 2
properties.description:
***Overnight camping is not permitted due the the instability of the cliffs.  Please be aware that fines apply***

Dogs are not per­mit­ted in this park.

There  is a dirt/gravel road that leads to a small turnaround near the cliffs. There is no vehicle access on the cliffs themselves.  All types of vehicles can access this area, except for long vehicles. There is no shade.

properties.name: Port Augusta Free Camping Ground
properties.description: A space with nothing, but a great view, just 12min from town. You can have fire here. Quiet in the night.

properties.name: Wudinna Showgrounds Campground
properties.description: Donation campground with new toilets and shower block, power sites and cooking shelter. There is an oval next to it and a kids playground and basketball court. Around the corner is a brand new apex park with a kids water park, swimming pool, jumping pillow and workout equipment.

properties.name: Pink Gum Camp Ground
properties.description:
Mountainous campground surrounded by forest, gravel road easy access by all vehicles. Toilets available and an outdoor fire pit. Lots of walks in the area.

Situated at the eastern end of the park, this campground has 11 campsites, including three that are suitable for caravans. The campground features an accessible toilet, washing-up facilities and fire pits for use outside the fire ban season.

Most of the campsites are wheelchair accessible, they are on flat ground with a compacted gravel surface.

Campsites 1, 2, 10 and 11 are closest to the toilets. The road slopes down to the toilets but is accessible by car. The toilet facilities are wheelchair accessible, with a 900mm door width and a fixed handrail alongside the toilet. Book and pay online where there are campsite descriptions and pictures to help you choose your site.

Check out your guide to camping at Onkaparinga River National Park on the Good Living blog for useful insider tips and inspiration.

properties.name: Tintinara Lake Indawarra Free Camp
properties.description: Great little spot for an overnighter. In the center of Tintinara close to the few shops, pub, petrol station, etc. Has toilets, tables, rubbish bins. Shaded and grassy flat areas. Located behind silo, easy to find.

properties.name: Peterborough RV Park
properties.description: Large grassed area with no facilities. Strictly self contained only, has signs prohibiting tents, swags and sleeping in passenger vehicles.

properties.name: Long Gully Campground
properties.description: Long Gully Campground is accessible by 2WD and only 400 metres from the surf beaches. The camping facilities are primitive and limited to a pit toilet. Phone to enquire about fire restrictions. The collection of firewood (both dead and alive) is prohibited. Maximum stay of 5 nights.

properties.name: Ippinitchie Campground
properties.description: Ippinitchie Campground offers basic bush camping between April and November in the scenic Wirrabara Scenic Reserve. The forest reserve offers ample opportunity for bush walking and bird watching. Fires are permitted from May to October in designated fire places. Camping permits can be obtained through the Wirrabara Forest Reserve Office.

properties.name: Browns Beach Campground
properties.description: Browns Beach Campground is walking distance from Browns Beach, which is a fantastic fishing spot. The campground has limited facilities including a drop- toilet. Fire restrictions apply and the collection of firewood both dead and alive is prohibited.

properties.name: Nationdale Bush Camping
