properties.description: Nationdale Bush Camping provides sites for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include chemical toilet, water, and fire place. Pets are allowed. Donations are requested.

properties.name: Cradock Hotel
properties.description: Cradock Hotel provides an overnight rest area as well as camping area. There are powered and unpowered sites are suitable for tents, camper trailers, carvans and large rigs. Facilities include hot showers and toilets. Generators and pets are allowed.

properties.name: Roadside Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small standard rest area on the B100 Flinders Highway. There is a rubbish bin and picnic area. There are no other services. The ground is gravel and level. All vehicles can access this area. Roadside noise exists.

properties.name: Tantanoola Rest Area
properties.description: SC, no camping in tents, max stay 2 nights, grass area for parking. Toilet, gas BBQ and covered picnic table. Playground, dump station, non-drinkable water.

properties.name: Georgetown Parking Area
properties.description: This is an RV friendly parking area at Georgetown. Donation welcomed for upkeep. The parking area is gravel and is medium sized and can accommodate about a dozen vehicles. There is a toilet, playground, barbecue, picnic area, water and rubbish bin. It is quiet and peaceful. There is some but not much shade. Maximum stay:  24 Hours. Shower is $1 for 2 mins.

properties.name: Agnes Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Big, basic rest area 150m of the highway down a rocky, rough road. The rest area has lots of parking spaces, is on a rocky/gravel ground and is surrounded by trees and bush. There are also trees in the parking area. There are two picnic tables, one being sheltered and three rubbish bins provided, though there is a lot of rubbish on the floor around them.

properties.name: Lawrie Park Camping
properties.description: Lawrie Park is a large park that allows self-contained RVs to stay for up to 48 hours. It is quiet and peaceful. The roads are dirt but the parking area for RVs is a grass field. There is a public toilet and rubbish bins, as well as a covered shelter. No fires during fire danger season. Dogs on lead. Potable water available. Shade available.  All vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Maslin Rest Area
properties.description: Basic rest area next to highway. Picnic table under shelter and two garbage bins provided. You can camp on the gravel ground or drive to the little area behind the rest area to camp or set up your tent on red dirt. Rest area is surrounded by some trees and bush.

properties.name: Manna Hill Rest Stop
properties.description: Rest Area at Mannahill. Suitable for small self-contained vehicles only. 38 km SW of Olary or 44 km NE of Yunta. Donation welcomed for upkeep of site by locals.

properties.name: Parilla Rest Area
properties.description: Unsealed rest area on Mallee Hwy. Toilets, shower, sheltered picnic tables and bins available. Some shade from trees. Located opposite store in Parilla.

properties.name: Frank Potts Reserve
properties.description: This is a park reserve 1 km E of Langhorne Creek across from a vineyard. The road into the park is dirt road that is muddy and has some deep Ruts, but any vehicle can access the area. The parking area is grass. There is a toilet, rubbish bins, and picnic areas. It is a shady park. No fires. It is peaceful and quiet but there is some road noise from the country road, that is infrequent at night.

properties.name: 10k Peg Parking Area
properties.description: This is a typical rest area 174 km W of Nullarbor Roadhouse or 10 km E of Border Village. There is a short dirt pullover that leads to a large dirt area with tracks leading into the bush. Some tracks go far into the bush. This area is close to the bight and cliffs. There are rubbish bins and picnic tables but no other facilities. This is a bush camping site with some shady bush sites and open areas. This site is medium sized and secluded. There is road noise. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: White Cliffs Reserve
properties.description: Camp area on the banks of River Broughton. Toilets and picnic tables available and also a great area for swimming and fishing. To access, take the Yacka Rd turn off N of Yacka for 6.5km. Take the left where road splits and continue to campsite.

properties.name: Yamba East Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed rest area located just off Sturt Hwy. Picnic tables and rubbish bins available, but not very much shade. 20km SE of Renmark.

properties.name: Springs Road
properties.description: Very basic roadside rest area with only a rubbish bin and a picnic table available.

properties.name: Talunga Park Caravan Park
properties.description:
Talunga Park Caravan Park: Your Relaxing Escape in Mount Pleasant. 

In the heart of Mount Pleasant, South Australia, Talunga Park Caravan Park offers a tranquil getaway amidst picturesque landscapes, rolling hills, and renowned Barossa Valley vineyards.

properties.name: Kiana Park
properties.description: Lovely campground with around 15 unpowered sites and 3 powered, all grassy. Amenities include hot showers, toilets and a small camp kitchen area.

properties.name: Ucontitchie Hill
properties.description: Rising sharply from the surrounding plains, Ucontitchie Hill is a beautiful rock formation located 32 kilometres south-west of the Wudinna Township. Scenically spectacular, this natural sculpture in bare rock is a geographical monument of international significance.

properties.name: Tjilbruke Trail Monument and Kingston Park Coastal Reserve
properties.description: With its superb coastal views, Kingston Park is home to the John Dowie Rock Sculpture at the heritage Aboriginal Site. Learn the Dreamtime Story of Tjilbruke and how the Spring Site evolved.

properties.name: The Seaview Walking Trail
properties.description: The Seaview Walking Trail hike showcases coastal features such as spectacular rock formations, sandy beaches, seabirds and a myriad of plants, while offering stunning scenic views of the coastal environment. The blue-green Coastal Daisy Bush Olearia axellaris features commonly along the walk.

properties.name: Tcharkulda Rock
properties.description:
Tcharkuldu Rock is a massive granite outcrop located in the Eyre Peninsula of South Australia, approximately 4 kilometres from the town of Minnipa. It is one of the most popular tourist attractions in the region, known for its unique landforms, stunning views, and cultural significance.

The rock is covered in tafoni, which are honeycomb-like formations created by wind and water erosion. These formations are particularly impressive at Tcharkuldu Rock due to their large size and intricate patterns.

Visitors can climb to the top of Tcharkuldu Rock for panoramic views of the surrounding countryside. From the summit, you can see the Minnipa township, the Eyre Peninsula coastline, and the distant Flinders Ranges.

properties.name: Riesling Trail
properties.description:
The Riesling Trail runs for 35 kilometres from Auburn to Clare and onto Barinia and is suitable for recreational walkers, mountain and touring bikes, as well as wheelchairs and pushers. Bike hire is available from the townships of Clare and Auburn.

Riesling Trail travels past many cellar doors and other visitor attractions, making it ideal for those wanting a leisurely walk or ride with a distraction or two.

There are three loop trails, which allow you to return to your starting point without traveling over old ground. Car parking is available in Clare, Sevenhill, Watervale and Auburn.

properties.name: Pildappa Rock
properties.description: Pildappa Rock is an impressive granite outcrop located in the Gawler Craton, a huge geological structure which spreads across the central part of the Eyre Peninsula, up into the Gawler Ranges and across into outback South Australia. The rock is estimated to be around 1.5 billion years old, and it is one of the most popular tourist attractions in the area. Visitors can climb to the top of the rock for stunning views of the surrounding countryside, including the Eyre Peninsula coastline and the Gawler Ranges.

properties.name: Murphy's Haystacks
properties.description: Murphy's Haystacks are a group of ancient granite rock formations located at Mortana, between Streaky Bay and Port Kenny on the Eyre Peninsula in South Australia. They are estimated to be over 1,500 million years old and are one of the most popular tourist attractions on the peninsula.

properties.name: Mount Schank - Volcano Walk
properties.description:
Mount Schank - Volcano Walk (State Heritage Area) is a dormant volcano located 12 kilometres south of Mount Gambier in South Australia. The cinder cone rises approximately 100 meters above the flat coastal plain and offers stunning views of the surrounding area.

The 2-kilometre Volcano Walk is a signposted loop track that circumnavigates the crater rim. The walk is moderate in difficulty and takes approximately 45 minutes to complete. Limestone steps have been installed along the track, making it accessible to some all-terrain wheelchairs.

The walk begins at the car park and winds up the side of the volcano, passing through native vegetation and offering glimpses of the crater below. Once at the top, visitors can enjoy panoramic views of Mount Gambier, the Blue Lake, and the surrounding countryside.

The Mount Schank Volcano Walk is a popular tourist destination and is also a popular spot for locals to enjoy a walk or picnic. The walk is open year-round, but it is best to avoid visiting on hot days as there is little shade along the track

properties.name: Mount Crawford Forest Reserve
properties.description:
Fossicking for gold, diamonds, opal, garnet and other gems is one of the more unusual recreational opportunities offered by Mount Crawford Forest. 

Mount Crawford Forest is in an historic mining area of the Adelaide Hills.

properties.name: Moonta Mines Walking Trails
properties.description: The Moonta Mines Walking Trails help you discover the history of this copper mining region via marked trails. Ryans Walk is a short walk of about 500 metres and takes about one hour. Hancocks Walk - from the miners cottage or sweet shop - is approximately 45 minutes return. Hughes Walk is a short loop around historic Hughes Engine House and takes about one hour. Interpretive signs illustrate the geology of Moonta ore bodies and the mining methods used to work them. A trail brochure is available from the Moonta Tourist Office and the Moonta Mines Museum. It's a fascinating part of South Australia's mining history, and well worth a look.

properties.name: Lavender Federation Trail
properties.description:
The Lavender Federation Trail is a 325-kilometer long distance walking trail in the eastern Mount Lofty Ranges in South Australia. It extends from Murray Bridge to Clare and is named after Terry Lavender OAM, whose vision established the trail in 1999. 

The trail is a linear walking trail through diverse countryside traversing the eastern flanks of the Mt Lofty Ranges. It intersects with the Kidman, Mawson, Heysen and Riesling Trails and links to trails within the Kinchina Conservation Park at Monarto. The trail network has been designed, constructed and is maintained entirely by volunteers from South Australian Recreation Trails Incorporated (SARTI).

properties.name: Kangaroo Island Wildlife Park
properties.description:
The Kangaroo Island Wildlife Park is located three kilometres past Parndana in the centre of Kangaroo Island, South Australia. 

The Kangaroo Island Wildlife Park is set over 50 acres and is home to over 1000 animals.

properties.name: Freycinet Trail
properties.description: The Freycinet Trail extends 12 kilometres along the coastline of Fitzgerald Bay in the Upper Spencer Gulf. Beginning at the northern end of Fitzgerald Bay it follows the coastline to the southern tip of the bay at Point Lowly.

properties.name: Chambers Way Walk
properties.description: Take a stroll along the beach front walk, from the jetty to the outlet and experience the ever changing moods of Rivoli Bay. Take a break on one of the many seats made out of recycled timber from the jetty.

properties.name: Cape Buffon Walking Trail
properties.description:
Cape Buffon Walking Trail is a two and a half kilometre loop walk, which highlights how the forces of wind and waves have shaped the limestone cliffs, sea stacks, reef platforms and vegetation along the coast. 

A variety of plant life can be seen, many displaying colourful flowers in season.

properties.name: Caernarvon Track
properties.description:
Caernarvon Track is the highest 4WD self-drive in the Flinders Ranges. 

The track is located on The Bunkers Conservation Reserve in the Northern Flinders Ranges and takes you to the summit of Mount Caernarvon (921 metres), providing spectacular 360 degree views of the Flinders Ranges and far beyond. 

The Bunkers Conservation Reserve is situated within the traditional lands of the Adnyamathanha Aboriginal people.

properties.name: Trinity Haven Lutheran Camp
properties.description: Trinity Haven Lutheran Camp offers privacy and isolation for several families and large groups to stay together. Escape to popular seaside getaway located right on the beach situated 12 kilometres south Tumby Bay. The area surrounding the camp has coastal sand dunes, rocky headlands and secluded white sandy beaches.

properties.name: Lake Hart Lookout
properties.description:
This spacious rest area with no facilities, except for picnic tables and rubbish bins, is located just off the highway. 

It offers scenic views over the salt lake flats - there is usually no water in it. 

Water is available but may not be suitable for consumption without pre-boiling.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Coffin Bay
properties.description:
Centrally located in one of the Eyre Peninsulas favourite destinations, Discovery Parks – Coffin Bay (formerly Coffin Bay Caravan Park) is always in high demand.

A stone's throw from the water and surrounded by several of the region's most stunning National Parks, accommodation options range from Deluxe Safari Tents and Superior 2-Bedroom Cabins to Powered and Unpowered sites that are large enough for the biggest van or motorhome.

Excellent in-park amenities include a large camp kitchen, free BBQs, Wi-Fi, a modern guest laundry and accessible and family bathrooms.

Only 45km’s from Port Lincoln, the unofficial capital of South Australia’s incredible Eyre Peninsula, there is no shortage of relaxation and adventure within easy reach of the park.

properties.name: The Lake Hart Rest Area and Lookout
properties.description:
The Lake Hart Rest Area and Lookout is a picturesque roadside stop located near Lake Hart in South Australia. It offers travelers a serene place to take a break, with amenities like restrooms, picnic tables, and parking. 

The highlight is the lookout, providing stunning panoramic views of the tranquil Lake Hart, a salt lake known for its unique salt crust patterns.

properties.name: Murray Recreation and Caravan Park
properties.description:
Immerse yourself in the idyllic peacefulness of Murray Recreation and Caravan Park, located in Eden Valley, South Australia. 

Eden Valley boasts stunning natural beauty, placing you at the heart of the Barossa Valley wine region. 

Book your stay today and discover the tranquility of Murray Recreation and Caravan Park!

properties.name: Federal Hotel
properties.description: Https://www. Facebook. Com/groups/777708599038235/permalink/2029425733866509/

properties.name: Roonka Water Activities Centre
properties.description: Roonka is owned and operated by Scouts SA and is the perfect destination for those who want all the excitement of canoes and water sports, while also enjoying a relaxing camp with all their friends.

properties.name: Baroota Ruins Campground - Mt Remarkable
properties.description: Beautiful allocated sites close to the hwy in Mt Remarkable National Park. Access to a plethora of walking trails and some historic ruins nearby. The sites all have a seasonal firepit, you must bring your own firewood.  Stunning Birdlife such as white-browed babblers, spiny cheeked honeyeaters, apostlebirds and pied butcherbirds to make a few.

properties.name: Dog Fence Lookout
properties.description:
The longest fence in the world. The South Australian section is 2.250 km long. 

The whole fence is 5.300 km long and goes further through Queensland and New South Wales. 

It's the only barrier that prevents dingoes from entering the sheep grazing land.

properties.name: Baldwin's Holliday Park
properties.description: Baldwin Holliday Park is a low cost campground located in Smoky Bay, Australia

properties.name: Tarlee Oval Camping Area
properties.description:
GPS: -34.27221 , 138.76927

Power available for $10 per night -see Post Office
Free unpowered camping
Clean toilets
Level grassy or gravel sites

properties.name: Duck Lagoon Camping Area
properties.description: Small well maintained simple place, who likes the nature and the peace is just right. We have seen a koala, parrots ducks and cockatoos. No showers, but a barbecue area and toilets.

properties.name: Ricky Bates Reserve
properties.description: Nice little spot on the water for a picnic.

properties.name: Tarpeena Recreational Grounds
properties.description:
Low cost camp for self-contained travellers. (donations)
Dump point, playground, public toilets, skate park.

properties.name: Lake MacDonell - Pink Lake
properties.description:
Lake Macdonnell is a pink lake located in the Outback of South Australia. The lake is known for its vibrant pink color, which is caused by algae that produce a pigment called beta-carotene. The lake is a popular spot for birdwatching, as it is home to a variety of bird species.
The lake is also a sacred site for the Aboriginal people

properties.name: Pink Lake
properties.description:
The Pink Lakes in Yorktown are a natural wonder that will leave you in awe. These picturesque saltwater lagoons, tinged with a stunning pink hue due to the presence of microorganisms and high salinity levels, offer a surreal and Instagram-worthy experience. 

Surrounded by lush greenery, these lakes are perfect for a peaceful stroll or a unique photo opportunity. Witnessing the vibrant pink waters against the backdrop of the Australian landscape is a must-see spectacle.

properties.name: The Tub
properties.description:
The Tub is a large crater in the cliff with a tunnel connection to the sea. It is 10 to 30 metres deep and 50 metres across with a granite base. It is located in Talia Caves, about 40 kilometres northwest of Elliston in the Eyre Peninsula, South Australia. 

The Tub is thought to have been formed by wave action over time. The tunnel connection to the sea allows water to flow in and out of the crater, creating a whirlpool effect.

properties.name: Waterfall Gully
properties.description: Waterfall Gully is a picturesque suburb and conservation park in the foothills of the Mount Lofty Ranges, just a short drive from Adelaide. The park is home to a variety of native flora and fauna, including towering stringybark trees, lush ferns, and playful koalas.

properties.name: Bight Lookout
properties.description:
Excellent views of the picturesque untouched rugged coastline. 

It's also a great place to spot whales as they migrate up and down the coast.

properties.name: MOGAS Regional Cadney Homestead Roadhouse
properties.description: Fuel and food during the day. Plenty of room to park.

properties.name: Overland Corner Hotel
properties.description: Free camp ing behind the pub power if needed. Walking trails everywhere to herons bend to the miles and native sites and of course to the Murray River.

properties.name: Rosetta Head Lookout Walk
properties.description:
The Rosetta Head Lookout Walk is a scenic hiking trail located in South Australia. 

This short but stunning trail offers breathtaking panoramic views of Encounter Bay, Victor Harbor, and the rugged coastline. 

Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk through native bushland, leading to a lookout point atop Rosetta Head (also known as The Bluff). 

It's a perfect spot to capture picturesque vistas and appreciate the natural beauty of the Fleurieu Peninsula.

properties.name: Whaler's Way Lookout
properties.description:
Whaler's Way Lookout is a scenic spot located on Pelamis Point in the Eyre Peninsula, South Australia. It offers stunning views of the coastline, including Fishery Bay, the Southern Ocean, and the cliffs of Cape Wiles. The lookout is accessible by a short walk from the car park.

The lookout is named after the whalers who once hunted in the area. The cliffs are home to a variety of seabirds, including gannets, cormorants, and pelicans. The lookout is also a popular spot for whale watching.

properties.name: Tapanappa Campground
properties.description:
Moderate sized coastal campsite, and you can see the ocean only a short walk along Tapanappa Road. 
At a rate of $15 per night, per vehicle, the tree cover and fire pits make these sites something to behold. All sites are unpowered.

properties.name: Stoney Creek Bush Camp
properties.description: Located approximately 5ks east of Wilmington in a beautiful red gum setting with great veiws. Head east from the Wilmington hotel

properties.name: 28 Mile Crossing Campground
properties.description:
Ideal for caravans and campervans, this campground is set among the sand dunes and samphire flats in a semi-protected, quiet location at the southern end of the park. There are some level grassed area and semi-sheltered by low trees. There is a walking trail to beach and park information located adjacent to campground. It is accessible by 2WD.
Stretching more than 130 kilometres, Coorong National Park protects a string of saltwater lagoons which are sheltered from the Southern Ocean by the sweeping sand dunes of the Younghusband Peninsula. Bookings are required and available on line via the booking link.
Cash self-registration stations are no longer in use in this park.
There is a 5 day limit at this campground.
Your campsite is available to you from 12noon on the day of your arrival until 11am the day of departure.

properties.name: Murry town RV Stop
properties.description: Camping area right in town.
properties.fees: There is power available at $15.00 pvpn & non power for $7.00 PPPN or $30 per night for buses and big rigs.

properties.name: Iga Warta
properties.description: Iga Warta shop, campground and cultural centre. Wwoofing available, cultural tours, art gallery, bush tucker tours, cabins, safari tents, powered and unpowered sites and much more. Drop in and speak to Terry

properties.name: Mount Gambier Showgrounds **PRE BOOKING NECCESSARY**
properties.description:
Shower, toilets, laundry and dump station.

20$ Key Deposit required
properties.fees: Unpowered site 15$, powered site 22$, powered site family (2 adult, 2 children) 25$, key deposit 20$

properties.name: Vivonne Bay Campground
properties.description: The camping ground is located walking distance from the long curved sandy beach of Vivonne Bay. Vivonne Bay is a fantastic location for fishing (jetty, beach or boat), swimming, beach combing and surfing. A general store is located on the main road. Bring $2 to operate the shower.
properties.fees: Fees apply for each location and are made onsite via a self-registration booth (iron ranger). Council does not take bookings for the sites and availability is on a first come, first serve basis.

properties.name: West Bay Campground
properties.description: West Bay stands in the middle of Kangaroo Island's west coast and supplies spectacular seaside views from the summit of the island's westernmost inlet. A campground, also named West Bay, is situated at the end of West Bay Road near the secluded fishing and swimming beach. Campers must bring their own portable stoves and water.

properties.name: Wendy's Walk
properties.description: Wendy's Walk meanders through bushland, sand dunes and eventually onto the beaches of the majestic Southern Ocean. The walk is within easy walking distance from Beachport town centre. Maps are available from the Beachport Visitor Information Centre.

properties.name: Wabma Kadarbu Mound Springs Conservation Park
properties.description: Explore the natural artesian springs within Wabma Kadarbu Mound Springs Conservation Park. The Blanche Cup and The Bubbler mound springs are created from water deep within the Great Artesian Basin which filters to the surface forming mounds and bubbling ponds.

properties.name: Tom's Opal Mine
properties.description: Tom's Opal Mine is an authentic opal mine worked in the 80s and 90s. It is now a display mine showcasing underground workings with opal seams visible throughout. The mine is located in Coober Pedy, South Australia, which is known as the "Opal Capital of the World." Visitors to Tom's Opal Mine can take a guided or self-guided tour to learn about the history of opal mining in Coober Pedy and see the underground workings of the mine. The guided tour includes a demonstration of how opal is mined and a chance to see some of the opals that have been found at the mine.

properties.name: The Fresh Fish Place
properties.description: Get factory direct seafood at The Fresh Fish Place. Fresh fillets and oysters are available every day, guaranteeing you get the best local seafood. Feast your eyes on the range - King George whiting, snapper, crayfish, prawns, succulent Coffin Bay oysters, Boston Bay mussels and much more.

properties.name: The Big Lobster
properties.description:
The Big Lobster is the most mouth wateringly delicious of all Australia's "Big Things" - you can keep your Big Banana and Big Pineapple - The Big Lobster wins hands down. 
Enjoy the finest seafood, fresh from the Southern Ocean, either take away or served in our restaurant.

properties.name: Tauragat Hill Walks and Lookout
properties.description: A few kilometres east of the Tauragat Well, you will find Tauragat Hill. The Hill provides a fantastic lookout over the small country town of Coonalpyn and surrounding regions. Choose from a number of unmarked walking trails to find your way up the Hill to enjoy the view from the top.

properties.name: Stansbury Seaside Markets
properties.description: Every year, between October and April, the award-winning Stansbury Seaside Markets takes place along the picturesque foreshore of Stansbury, located on the eastern coast of Yorke Peninsula, South Australia

properties.name: Port Vincent Walking Trail
properties.description:
A one and a half kilometre trail leaves Marine Parade for shoreline walk to 126 steps with handrail leading to Golf Course Road. Return via Golf Course Road for cliff top lookout, then via beach or back to town along roadway. 

A second trail about one and a half kilometres departs Marine Parade for walk in picturesque water reserve with outlets to Buttfield Avenue and Golf Course Road or return to starting point. A timber bridge and boardwalk cross the dry creek bed. 

The third trail about one and half kilometres departs The Esplanade with steps to 800 metre long cliff top trail, with steps at southern end leading to the beach. Return along the beach or back along the trail. Enjoy scenic views with possible sightings of dolphins. 

Trails include route maps with times and distances. 

There are seats along some trails.

properties.name: Painted Desert
properties.description: The Painted Desert is a geological wonderland in Arckaringa Hills, South Australia. It is known for its colorful hills and mesas, formed over millions of years by the erosion of sedimentary rocks. The colors of the Painted Desert range from red and orange to yellow and white, and are created by the presence of different minerals in the rocks.

properties.name: Oodnadatta Track
properties.description: The Oodnadatta Track is a long and winding road, stretching over 600 kilometres. The road passes through a variety of landscapes, including deserts, grasslands, and mountains. Along the way, there are a number of small settlements and historical sites, such as the ruins of the Old Ghan Railway and the William Creek Hotel, the most remote pub in Australia.

properties.name: Mount Wudinna
properties.description: Mount Wudinna is the one of the region's biggest tourist drawcards - a trip to the district would not be complete without visiting this impressive natural rock formation. It is one of Australia's largest granite monoliths. Located a convenient 10 kilometres off the National Highway One, access to the attraction is through the town of Wudinna. The roads are well sign-posted and suitable for travel by cars, caravans and buses. When you get there you will find a recently developed Interpretive Trail. The trail provides a pleasant picturesque walk and an abundance of information about the rock, its history, formation and local flora.

properties.name: Minlaton Walking Trail
properties.description:
The Minlaton Walking Trail is a picturesque nature trail located in South Australia. It offers a serene and scenic experience, spanning approximately 5 kilometres. 

As you hike along this well-maintained path, you'll be surrounded by lush native flora and may even spot local wildlife. The trail guides you through rolling hills and provides breathtaking panoramic views of the countryside. 

It's a perfect destination for nature enthusiasts and those seeking a peaceful escape in the heart of South Australia's stunning landscape.

properties.name: Lanky's Walk
properties.description: Located in Railway Terrace towards the entrance to the Beachport Conservation Park. Follow a well-defined path through natural bush land with native plants named for easy identification. At the end of this walk is Lanky's Well, which was dug to provide water for the police horses.

properties.name: Jack And Hilda McArthur Walk
properties.description:
The Jack and Hilda McArthur Walk is situated in the Beachport Conservation Park approximately five kilometres north of Beachport between Lake George and the coast. 

Woolley Lake is a small saltwater lagoon surrounded by native trees at the southern end of the park. 

A walkway has been constructed around this lake together with a lookout from which Woolley Lake, Lake George and the Woakwine Range can be viewed. A bird hide has been built beside a small freshwater hole near the car park. A walk around the lake takes approximately thirty to forty five minutes.

properties.name: Ikara - The Meeting Place
properties.description:
kara - The Meeting Place is an award-winning public art space that shares an important story of the Adnyamathanha people. The Adnyamathanha community has widely endorsed sharing information with visitors about their land to encourage a deeper appreciation of Aboriginal culture.

This contemporary artwork represents the first attempt within the Flinders Ranges (and South Australia) to acknowledge and interpret the impact of pastoralism on an Indigenous community. Ikara provides an inspirational space where Adnyamathanha people can share their culture with park visitors and discuss the role played by their community as the pastoral industry developed.

properties.name: Heysen Trail
properties.description:
The Heysen Trail is a renowned long-distance hiking trail in South Australia, spanning approximately 1,200 kilometres (746 miles) from the rugged coastline of Cape Jervis to the remote Flinders Ranges. 

It offers hikers diverse landscapes, including coastal cliffs, lush forests, rolling hills, and arid outback terrain. Named after landscape artist Sir Hans Heysen, the trail showcases the natural beauty of the state, with opportunities to spot native wildlife and immerse oneself in its rich flora and fauna. 

Hikers can choose from various sections and difficulties, making it accessible for both novice and experienced trekkers. The Heysen Trail provides an unforgettable outdoor adventure for nature enthusiasts and bushwalkers.

properties.name: Flavours of Campbelltown Food Trail
properties.description: The Flavours of Campbelltown Food Trail is an accessible food trail within metropolitan Adelaide that provides unique, flavoursome food with strong cultural backgrounds. The only Food Trail of its type in South Australia all within five minutes of Adelaide city and 20 minutes from the airport.

properties.name: Engelbrecht Cave
properties.description: In the centre of Mount Gambier lies an amazing cave system that winds it's way under the streets and homes of town. Open to the public via fully guided walking tours, this is also a popular dive site for fully certified cave divers. This is definitely a cave with a difference. A fully guided tour will take approximately 45 minutes, during which time you will view the sinkhole prior to entering two separate caverns, where you will see the beautiful underground lake with it's clear blue water that is home to one of our oldest living creatures! Whether you're an avid caver or a beginner into the underground wonder that is caves, this is a must see.

properties.name: Centenary Tower
properties.description: Walk to Centenary Tower, 190 metres above sea level for spectacular views of the lakes, the city and the beautiful countryside. Opened in 1904, the tower includes an extensive display of early photographs of the Lakes area.

properties.name: The Mount Gambier Cave Gardens and Environs
properties.description: This garden is located in the heart of the city of Mount Gambier and features a sinkhole that is over 30 meters deep. The sinkhole is surrounded by a variety of plants and flowers, and there is a viewing platform that offers stunning views of the

properties.name: Cape Borda Lightstation
properties.description: Cape Borda Lightstation is testament to a bygone era of travelling the open seas by sail. It is a monument to isolation and hardship. The precinct is steeped in European history. It has an unusual square lighthouse built in 1858, several historic light keepers' cottages you can stay in, and a museum.

properties.name: Birds Australia Gluepot Reserve
properties.description:
Gluepot Reserve Bird Sanctuary, located in South Australia, is a vital conservation area spanning approximately 54,000 hectares. 

It offers refuge to a diverse array of bird species, including endangered and rare ones like the Malleefowl and the Black-eared Miner. The sanctuary's arid landscape features mallee scrub, making it an important habitat for these unique avian species. 

Birdwatchers and conservationists flock to Gluepot Reserve to witness its remarkable birdlife and contribute to the preservation of this crucial ecosystem.

properties.name: Anna Creek Painted Hills
properties.description:
The Anna Creek Painted Hills are a spectacular and recently discovered section of the pristine Breakaways country in the far north of South Australia. They are located on Anna Creek Station, the world's largest working cattle station. The Painted Hills are a rocky outcrop of large and small hills, which emerge suddenly out of a flat, desert landscape. The hills are approximately 20 kilometres x 18 kilometres in size. 

The Anna Creek Painted Hills are formed by the erosion of sedimentary rocks over millions of years. The colors of the hills are created by the presence of different minerals in the rocks. The red and orange colors are caused by iron oxides, while the yellow and white colors are caused by kaolinite and other clay minerals.

properties.name: Alligator Gorge
properties.description: Alligator Gorge within Mount Remarkable National Park is the premier natural attraction in the Southern Flinders Ranges. This spectacular gorge cut through ancient quartzite by the Alligator Creek is easily accessible to visitors along a ten minute walking trail.
properties.fees: Mount Remarkable National Park entree fees apply.

properties.name: Admirals Arch
properties.description:
Admirals Arch is a natural rock formation located in Flinders Chase National Park on Kangaroo Island, Australia. 

This iconic landmark features a striking, natural stone bridge that arches over the Southern Ocean. It is renowned for its unique geological features and as a popular viewing spot for New Zealand fur seals. 

Visitors can observe these marine mammals in their natural habitat and enjoy stunning coastal views, making Admirals Arch a must-visit destination for nature enthusiasts and photographers.

properties.name: Adelaide Central Market
properties.description:
Adelaide Central Market is a vibrant indoor market located in the heart of Adelaide, South Australia. It is the largest undercover fresh produce market in the Southern Hemisphere, with over 70 stalls selling a wide variety of fresh produce, meats, seafood, cheeses, breads, and prepared foods.

The market is also home to a number of cafes and restaurants, making it a great place to stop for a bite to eat or a drink. The market is popular with both locals and tourists alike, and is a great place to experience the best of Adelaide's food and culture.

properties.name: Casuarina Campground
properties.description: This tranquil campground offers seven campsites with access to Pondalowie Bay and surf break via a walking trail through the coastal dunes. Pit toilet facilities are available.
properties.fees: $12 per night, online booking and payment required. There is also a park entry fee of $10 per vehicle.

properties.name: Burners Beach Camping Area
properties.description:
On the north coast of the foot on Point Souttar Road, 12 kilometres west of Point Turton, follow the track left leading away from Point Souttar beach toward Leven Beach, toilet facilities available but take toilet paper, natural boat ramp, snorkelling fun, no mobile phone reception, no shade, suitable for conventional vehicles and smaller caravans with care, camping also available on the right hand track towards Point Souttar and the boat ramp, suitable for smaller camper trailers only.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Greenways Landing
properties.description: Green ways landings road, there's plenty of camping spots. Fires permitted, self contained vehicles only. Right on the edge Murray. Best in a a 4b. Gets quite rough further up. Fishing water skiing etc. Quiet. No phone range.

properties.name: Cactus Beach Campsite
properties.description: It's a beautiful camp spot right next to cactus beach in the dunes. All vehicles can access. Loads of park slots and tent spots. We met many Aussies who came there because of the perfect surf conditions. The ranger goes around to collect the money twice a day.

properties.name: Port Lincoln Lions Hostel
properties.description:
Amid farming land, nestled against a backdrop of rolling hills, the Port Lincoln Lions Hostel is the perfect retreat for groups and individuals. 

The new accommodation block has 16 rooms, including two family rooms with a connecting door to another room. Other rooms accommodate six or eight people. 

Camping available for both self contained and caravan/camper and tents.
properties.fees:
Pricing: $25.00

$10 for tents and $20 for campers

properties.name: McLaren Vale Backpackers
properties.description: McLaren Vale is a friendly backpacker hostel located in the heart of wine country, surrounded by gentle rolling hills covered in vine yards and dotted with charming cellar doors.

properties.name: Hallett Recreation and Camping Ground
properties.description: The Hallett Recreation and Camping Ground has expansive camping areas and is right next to the pub. It is available for short stays (up to three days) for recreational vehicles (RVs), caravans and campers. Overnight tariff with power includes use of toilet and showers. Bike washdown facilities are provided at the swimming pool picnic area, follow the signs from the Mawson Trail at Jessie Street.

properties.name: Morambo Creek Rest Area
properties.description: This shaded, grassy and level rest area is located at the junction of Bordertown-Naracoorte Road and Riddoch Highway, however it is relatively quiet thanks to its size and the number of trees. There are no amenities, other than picnic tables and it is easily accessible from either side.

properties.name: Kingoonya Camp
properties.description: This large and rather open camping area is located in town, close to the shops and other services that town living has to offer. It is situated by the train line, but away from the highway noise. It is large and has good amenities.

properties.name: Island Lagoon Lookout
properties.description:
This is a large, drive-through area with no facilities, except for a few rubbish bins and picnic tables. 

It is located off the highway and offers scenic views. 

Suitable parking for big rigs.

properties.name: Chookarloo Campground
properties.description: Open between April and November, Chookarloo campground is situated in mixed Eucalypt woodland forest. It’s a large camping area with 23 campsites, picnic tables, untreated rainwater and a pit toilet. Camp fires are permitted in the fire pits from May- October. A few walking trails are in the area, the Chookarloo and Heysen. Camping permits can be obtained from the Kuitpo Forest Reserve Information Center.

properties.name: Bower Reserve
properties.description: Bower Reserve is an overnight parking area ($5 extra for a powered site), with toilets, water, BBQ stations and tennis courts. Payment is made at the honesty box near the BBQ.
properties.fees: $5 to camp, extra $5 for power and extra $2 for ezy dump

properties.name: Naracoorte Showgrounds
properties.description: Naracoorte Showgrounds features 28 powered sites suitable for self- contained vehicles. Please see caretakers van before taking a site.

properties.name: Pertendi Hut Campground
properties.description: Located in Ngarkat Conservation Park, Pertendi Hut Campground is small and relaxing with three sites. The area is accessible by 2WD, and provides secluded, shaded areas with picnic tables and toilets. Walking trails are nearby. Fire restrictions are in effect; the collection of firewood (dead and alive) is prohibited.

properties.name: Haslam Campground
properties.description: Haslam campground is a popular camping area, 100 metres from the jetty and foreshore. The campground is small, with only six sites, and operates on a first-come-first-serve basis. Facilities include toilets (bring your own paper), water, and a wood barbecue. Payment is made in the honesty box. Maximum stay of 10 days.

properties.name: Skytrek Willow Springs Station
properties.description: Skytrek Willow Springs Station offers private sites in a peaceful setting. Fire rings and barbecue plates are available at each site, as well as long drop toilets. Ablution amenities and a camp kitchen are available near the homestead. Bookings required.

properties.name: Mt Dare Hotel
properties.description: Mt Dare Hotel provides natural bush camping near Witjira National Park. Toilets and hot showers are available, as well as a limited number of powered sites. Bookings are unnecessary.

properties.name: Moorook Game Reserve
properties.description: Moorook Game Reserve is situated on magnificent wetlands that can be enjoyed through canoeing or fishing. Camping facilities are basic, including toilets, BBQs, and picnic tables. Fires are allowed, except during fire ban. Permits are required.

properties.name: Black Cockatoo Bush Camp
properties.description: Black Cockatoo Bush Camp is located within scenic bush surroundings beside a water hole. Facilities include flush toilets, hot showers, powered sites, barbecues, and picnic tables. Call to book.

properties.name: D'Estrees Bay Camp Ground
properties.description: D’ Estrees Bay Camp Ground is situated within the beautiful and culturally significant Cape Gantheaume Conservation Park. The campground has basic amenities, but with access to beaches and numerous walking tracks. Fires are prohibited all year. Call regarding any enquiries.

properties.name: Waitpinga Campground
properties.description: Waitpinga Campground is situated near the beach in Newland Head Conservation Park. Facilities include toilets, and a large communal gas BBQ. Generators and fires are not permitted. Camping fees are paid at the self-registration station. Bring your own drinking water.

properties.name: Haythorpe Reserve
properties.description: Haythorpe Reserve camping area is located along the eastern bank of Murray River and is suitable for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers.  Facilities include toilets, dump point, cement fire pits and a boat ramp. Local activities include swimming, fishing, waterskiing and canoeing.  You will need to bring your own water. A council attendant will verify that you have paid the camping fee.

properties.name: Kadina Showgrounds
properties.description: Kadina Showgrounds offers a large parking area for self sufficient vehicles. There is a dump point on Doswell Terrace. There is a maximum stay of 48 hours. Camp fee and keys can be collected from Copper Coast Info Centre on Mines Rd.
properties.fees: AUD $10/unpowered per night AUD $15/powered per night

properties.name: Arckaringa Station
properties.description: Arckaringa Station provides unpowered camp sites along with a bunkhouse with single and double beds. Facilities include toilets, showers, camp kitchen, wood BBQ, and washing line. You will need to bring your own food, fuel and drinking water. Pets are allowed on a lead. Bookings are not necessary for the campground, but are requried for the bunkhouse.

properties.name: Kaiser Strip Campground
properties.description: Kaiser Strip Campground is located in Loch Luna Game Reserve. Sites are not suitable for caravans or motorhomes. Toilets are provided. You will need to be self-sufficient. Gas fires are permitted if there's no fire ban. Payment can be made at the self-registration station.

properties.name: Paruna Comfort Stop
properties.description: Paruna Comfort Stop offers powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets and public phone. Honesty box provided.

properties.name: Perlubie Beach
properties.description: Located in Streaky Bay, Perlubie Beach camp area offers unpowered sites. There are limited facilities but toilets are available. You will need to bring your own water.  Activites include swimming and fishing.

properties.name: Burra Showgrounds
properties.description: Burra Showgrounds offers a large open area with powered and unpowered camping sites. Facilities include showers, toilets, and water. Dogs are allowed.

properties.name: Flinders Bush Retreats - Willow Waters Gorge Bush Camping
properties.description: Flinders Bush Retreats provides a range of accommodation from bush camping, self-contained accommodation or glamping. Limited and exclusive campsites suitable for self contained campers - tents, camper trailers and caravans. There are no amenitites available.  Firewood can be purchased at the homestead. Attractions include Willow Waters Gorge, Flinders Ranges National Park, Parchilna, Blinman and Wipena Pound. LIMITED AVAILABILITY! Bookings essential by phone. Due to the secluded location check in is required before dark.

properties.name: Martins Bend Campground
properties.description: Located beside the Murray River, Martins Bend Campground provides sites for vehicle camping, camper trailers and caravans. Facilities include toilets, picnic tables and wood fireplace. Activities include swimming, fishing, water skiing, sailing and canoeing.  Generators are permitted unil 10:30pm. There is a maximum stay of 21 days. Camp fees can be paid at the self-registration station.  There is a caretaker on site.

properties.name: Karte Conservation Park
properties.description: Karte Conservation Park provides bush camping for vehicle based camping, caravans, and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets and wood fireplace. Camping permits are required.

properties.name: Saddleworth Caravan Park
properties.description: Saddleworth Caravan Park provides powered caravan and campsites only. Facilities include showers, BBQ area, playground, and laundry area.

properties.name: Mundulla Showground
properties.description: Mundulla Showground provides powered and unpowered sites for tents, caravans and long rigs. Facilities include toilets, BBQ, picnic tables, bins, dump point and mobile phone coverage. Dogs are allowed. There is a maximum stay of 48 hours. Payments are made onsite by honesty box.

properties.name: Three Mile Bend Campground
properties.description: Three Mile Bend Campground located in Beachport Conservation Park provides 6 private sites suitable for all styles of camping. Facilities include toilet, tank water (not suitable for drinking), and wood fireplace. You will need to bring your own water and firewood. Camping permits are available from the self-registration station.

properties.name: Acraman Creek Conservation Park
properties.description:
Try a spot of fishing or go canoeing in the park's surrounding waterways, including the Great Australian Bight and Acraman Creek. There is also a shipwreck from past whaling activity that lies offshore. Small boats can be launched from the beach, while 4WD vehicles can launch boats at the creek and Port Lindsay.

Campsites need to be booked prior to arrival.

Users have commented that is best attempted in a 4WD

Click through to the online booking page for more details about individual campgrounds and fees.

properties.name: Sturt Bay Camping Reserve
properties.description:
Access to Sturt Bay Camping Reserve is via a sandy track and therefore not suitable for large caravans and motorhomes. You will need to be self-sufficient as there are limited facilities. There is no mobile reception. Activities include swimming, fishing and snorkelling. A permit is needed for camping.



When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Muloorina Station
properties.description: Located in Lake Eyre National Park, Muloorina Station camping area is suitable for vehicle based camping and camper trailers. There are toilets available.You will need to provide your own water.

properties.name: Laura Bay Conservation Park
properties.description: Laura Bay Conservation Park is located 20km south east of Ceduna. Local attractions include swiming, fishing and walking trails. There is camping availale suitable for the self-sufficient camper.

properties.name: Port Julia Oval (Reichenbach Memorial Park)
properties.description: Port Julia Oval campground is located in Reichenbach Memorial Park. It has suitable access for caravans, camper trailers, motorhomes and self contained vehilces. Facilities include toilet, BBQ, picnic tables and dump point.

properties.name: Warren Gorge
properties.description: Warren Gorge camping area offers sites for vehilce based camping, camper trailers and campervans. There are no facilities available. Dogs are allowed.

properties.name: Farm Beach Campground
properties.description: Located near Port Lincoln, Farm Beach Campground has 33 unpowered sites available. Facilities include toilets and showers. Advanced bookings are not available for this site.

properties.name: Cadell Recreation Ground
properties.description: Cadell Recreation Ground offers powered and unpowered camp sites suitable for tents, caravans, and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, showers, fireplace, picnic tables, laundromat, dump point, and drinking water. There is mobile phone coverage. Local attractions include the Cadell interpative centre, the Graeme Claxon reserve and the wetland trail.
properties.fees: AUD $20 per 2 adults $5 extra adult (Powered sites) AUD $12 per 2 adult $5 extra adults (unpowered sites)

properties.name: Blinman Hotel
properties.description: Blinman Hotel and caravan site offers 11 powered sites suitable for caravans. Facilities include BBQ area, and campers kitchen. There is a resident manager on site. The camp is pet friendly and short stays are permitted.
properties.fees: AUD $20 per 2 people. AUD $10 per extra person

properties.name: Lakeside Camping Ground
properties.description: Lakeside Camping Ground offers lake side sites for tents and caravans. Facilities include toilets, showers, fireplace, picnic tables and drinking water. Pets are allowed.

properties.name: Parachilna Campground
properties.description: Parachilna Campground is community owned and offers low cost camping for tents and caravans. It is aslo suitable for large rigs.Facilities include amenities block, showers, toilets, gas BBQ and a coin operated washing machine. Camp fees can be paid at the Prairie Hotel.

properties.name: Bute Caravan Park
properties.description: Bute Caravan Park offers powered sites for tents, camper trailers, and caravans. Facilities include toilets, showers, and water supply. Local attractions include Gunnerbills gallery and Bute Fauna park.

properties.name: Bolto Reserve
properties.description: Bolto Reserve camping area is located on Khartoum Road. Sites are suitable for vehicle based camping, caravans and camping trailers. Facilities include toilets. In the area you can enjoy fishing, swimming and canoeing in the Murray River. Fees are paid to the council.

properties.name: Balgowan Caravan and Camping area
properties.description: Balgowan Caravan and Camping area is located in SA. The campsites are suitable for tents, caravans, camper trailers and motorhomes. There are limited powered sites available. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ facilities, showers and toilets.

properties.name: Long Point
properties.description: Long Point camping area offers views of the northern lagoon, and access to a small jetty. Located 26km west of Meningie off Long Point Rd. Campsites are suitable for tents, vehicle based camping and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, picnic tables and picnic shelter. Explore the lagoons and the sandscapes of the peninsula. The beaches are accessible by 4WD. You will need to bring your own water and firewood. Bookins can made in advance.

properties.name: Cambrian Campground
properties.description: Cambrian campground is situated between the Heysen and ABC Ranges at the North end of the Bunyeroo Road. There are 13 sites available, surrounded by native pine trees throughout the river red gums along the creekline. You will need to bring your own firewood. Fire resttrictions apply. Pets and generators are not allowed. Facilities include toilets and a self-registration station on site.

properties.name: Cable Bay Beach Campground
properties.description:
Cable Bay Beach campground is located adjacent to the beach and offers great views of the offshore islands. 

There are 9 campsites availalbe for vehicle based camping or camper trailers. Facilities include pit toilets. 

Enjoy snorkelling, swimming, fishing or exploring the rockpools. 

You will need to bring your own firewood and drinking water. 

Fire restrictions apply, and generators are not permitted.

properties.name: Kotgee Camping Area
properties.description: Currently Closed

properties.name: Lyrup Flats Section
properties.description: Lyrup Flats Section camping area is located in the Murray River National Park and is signposted off the Sturt Hwy. Camp sites are suitable for vehicle based camping, camper trailers and caravans. This is a remote area, so you need to be self-sufficient. In the area you can enjoy swimming, fishing, and caneoing. Dogs are allowed at this campsite.

properties.name: 3 OClock Creek Campground
properties.description: Located 10km west of Dalhousie Spring, 3 O'CLock Creek camping area offers shady, bush campsites for vehicle-based camping and camper trailers. Drinking water is available and firewood may be collected. Enjoy bushwalkig and birdwatching. Self-registration is available at Dalhousie.

properties.name: 42 Mile Crossing Campground
properties.description: 42 Mile Crossing camping area caters to the self-sufficient camper. The camp ground is the most popular entry to the main beach, where you will need 4WD to access the final 1.3km. The campsite is suiable for vehicle-based camping, camper trailers and caravans. Facilities include toilets, picnic tables and picnic shelter. A permit is required from the self-registration station.

properties.name: Horse Rock Campground
properties.description: Horse Rock campground, set amongst coastal mallee, has 2 sites in Lincoln National Park. There is access to Proper Bay with a small boat.

properties.name: Browns Beach Campground
properties.description: 26km north-west of Marion bay is Browns beach campground. Surrounded by the dunes and a well known salmon-fishing beach. This camp has 10 sites available for trailers, caravans and vehicle-based camping. Facilites include toilets. You will need to bring your own water and firewood. FIre restrictions apply. Booking can be made online.

properties.name: Koolamon Campground
properties.description:
Situated on Aroona Creek at the base of the ABC Range this campground offers stunning views of the landscape that inspired artist Sir Hans Heysen. The 4WD section is surrounded by river red gums and acacias. 

There is a small area for 2WD vehicles. This campground provides minimal shade and shared firepits and bbq plates.

Access: Selected campsites are 4WD only.
Suitable for: tents, camper trailers, caravans.
Facilities: long-drop toilets, bbq plates.
Campfires: allowed (seasonal fire restrictions apply).
Number of campsites: 13 allocated campsites.
Unpowered. Water tank located at toilet block. NPWS cannot guarantee consistent water quality and supply.

properties.name: Taylors Landing Campground
properties.description:
This campground is sheltered in mallee scrub behind the beach which is accessible via a boardwalk and stairs. Boats can be launched from a concrete boat ramp. 

There are 4 allocated, unpowered campsites. 

Access via an all weather 2WD track, suitable for tents, and camper trailers. Facilities, long-drop toilet. Campfires permitted, fire pits not provided (seasonal fire restrictions and conditions apply). Swimming, boating, fishing, birdwatching, short walks, and trekking. 

There is a boat ramp (4WD access only), with a large day visitor car park adjacent.

properties.name: Grindells Hut Campground
properties.description:
Located approximately an hour's drive west of Balcanoona via Wortupa Loop Track. Access is 10 km up Arkaroola Road then 17 km via the signposted 4WD track. Camp sites are located along the creek below Grindells Hut. Please camp in designated sites. The Weetootla and Italowie Gorge hikes can be accessed from this camping area.

Access: 4WD only.
Suitable for: tents, camper trailers.
Facilities: long-drop toilets, bbq.
Campfires: allowed (seasonal fire restrictions apply).
Unallocted camping - maximum 9 vehicles.
Electricity: unpowered.

Camp sites are located along the creek below Grindells Hut. Please camp in designated sites. Facilities include fire pit/barbecue and pit toilets.

properties.name: Old Coorong Road Campgrounds
properties.description:
South of the Coorong National Park, you will find bush camping options along Old Coorong Road. Sites are suitable for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers. 

You will need to bring your own water and firewood. Permits are available at the self-registration station in the park.

properties.name: Purni Bore
properties.description: Purni Bore is a pleasant camping spot with abundant birdlife, however visitors need to take their own drinking water and supplies. There is a hot shower, toilets and shade shelter provided. The purchase of a Desert Parks Pass is required to camp at Purni Bore and gain access east of Dalhousie.

properties.name: Mambray Creek Campground
properties.description: Mambray Creek campground is located in the Mt Remarkable National Park. Unpowered sites available. Suited for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, heated showers and a baby change room. Fire restrictions apply. Generators are not allowed.

properties.name: Acraman Campground
properties.description: Acraman Campground is located in the Flinders Ranges National Park. This is a small campground with only 4 campsites. Toilets are located on site and self registration is at the entrance. Fire restrictions apply. Generators are not allowed.

properties.name: Yangie Bay Campground
properties.description: Yangie Bay Campground is protected by low laying hills and dense scrublands. There are 13 unpowered sites of which 6 are suitable for caravans and camper trailers. Suitable activities include kayaking and walking trails.

properties.name: Surfleet Cove Campground
properties.description: Surfleet Cove Campground is a sheltered campground which overlooks the protected waters of Boston Bay with two tent sites, four camper trailer sites, 12 caravan / motorhome sites and one large group campsite. At Surfleet Cove Campground all wood fires or solid fuel fires are prohibited.

properties.name: Pondalowie Bay Caravan Trailer Campground
properties.description:
Situated among the coastal vegetation Located near the beautiful Pondalowie Bay, this campground has 9 large caravan sites and 16 smaller camper trailer sites.

Tent sites are available at the nearby Pondalowie Bay Bush Campground.

The campground is a short walk from the Fishing Village boat ramp and Pondalowie Bay. 

- Access: 2WD and 4WD.
- Suitable for: camper trailers, caravans.
- Facilities: long-drop toilet.
- Campfires: allowed (seasonal fire restrictions apply).
- Number of campsites: 26 allocated campsites.
- Electricity: unpowered.

properties.name: Dry Stone Walling Rest Area
properties.description: This drive-through, unsealed area is separated from the highway by the wall of trees. There are no facilities, except for rubbish bins and picnic tables.

properties.name: Cradock Heartbreak Hotel
properties.description: This spacious campground is situated at the back of the hotel, just off the road in a small town. It offers grassy and level sites together with clean toilets and hot showers (the latter available for a small fee) and is suitable for big rigs. While staying here, you can also enjoy delicious meals and drinks in the hotel's restaurant.

properties.name: Bon Bon Rest Area
properties.description: Decent size unsealed drive-through bay located directly by the highway. It is exposed and has basic facilities (long drop toilet).

properties.name: Banealla Rest Area
properties.description: Decent size drive-through bay located directly by the highway. No facilities and limited shade.

properties.name: Tumby Bay Self Contained RV Park
properties.description: This is a large rest area maintained by the community pride group of Tumby Bay. Only self contained vehicles are allowed to stay here. It is a dirt carpark with some shade and surrounded by trees that shelter from wind and road noise. There are rubbish bins and potable water and a dump station.

properties.name: Flinders Highway Rest Stop
properties.description: This is an unmarked dirt pull-in rest area. There are no facilities. The area extends about 200 meters from the highway. There are some rock fire rings. There is some shade. Any type of vehicle can access this area. There is some road noise.

properties.name: 311km Peg Rest Area
properties.description: This is a large rest area near the 311km market on the south side of the highway (it is not signposted). It is dirt surface with a litter bin and no other facilities. There are trees providing shade and it extends about 200m back from the road. There are wide open clearings with pockets of trees, so it is not very secluded. 2wd accessible.

properties.name: Kleinigs Hill Lookout
properties.description:
Kleinigs Hill Lookout in Victor Harbor, South Australia, offers panoramic coastal vistas in a compact, serene setting. 

Perched atop a gentle hill, a viewing platform with telescopes provides breathtaking views of the rugged coastline, Encounter Bay, and the iconic Granite Island. 

Visitors can appreciate the area's natural beauty, spot marine life, and savor a picturesque sunset.

properties.name: Port Minlacowie Parking Area
properties.description:
on the western coast of the Peninsula, 650 m north of Minlacowie Road – access via Beegoodyewells Road – beach launch available just north of
camp ground.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Halligan Bay Campground
properties.description: Camp area at Halligan Bay in Kati Thanda - Lake Eyre National Park. Toilet and picnic tables available. Exposed, no shade. To access, turn N 7 km SE of William Creek onto Halligan Bay access track. Track is 57km and very rugged so 4WD only.

properties.name: Wharminda Soaks Picnic Area
properties.description: Free bush camp area near Hincks Conservation Park. Toilets, picnic tables and plenty of shade available but a lot of low trees so is only good for smaller vehicles. Turn left N of Wharminda train tracks and travel 8km W to area. Dirt road. Signposted.

properties.name: Pimba Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area between two highways next to Pimba's roadhouse and fuel station. It has got several garbage bins, public toilets, sheltered picnic tables, a sheltered information board, 2$ hot showers (for 5 minutes) and tap water provided. Tap water is from a hand wash sink so you can't easily fill up big bottles. The rest area has got a rocky/gravel ground and is surrounded by a metal panel fence which is great when it's windy. Free to stay but donations are appreciated / requested at $5 per person and $5 per vehicle per night.

properties.name: Fitzgerald Bay Camping Area
properties.description: This is a large designated Camp Area at Fitzgerald Bay. Please no camping in non-designated areas. The entrance and road surface is dirt. The campground is a one-lane road up the bay with pull offs on the side for camping. There is a rubbish bin and no other facilities. Any vehicle can access this area. There is some shade available. The beach is 100 meters away. The area is quiet and peaceful.

properties.name: 25k Peg Parking Bay
properties.description: This is a typical rest area at the 25km peg in Nullarbor National Park. There is a large gravel parking bay on the south side of the road. This area is close to the bight and cliffs. There are rubbish bins but no other facilities. There is no shade. It is used primarily as a truck stop. There is road noise. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: The Gap Camping Area
properties.description:
This is a designated camping area in the conservation reserve north of Balgowan. Permit required. Beach launching ‐– toilet facilities available ‐ good beach for kids – beach fishing for tommies and gar – no shade. There are pull-in bush sites and a cleared area for larger vehicles. Any vehicle can access this area but the road can be muddy in wet weather. No rubbish bins so pack out rubbish.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10.00; weekly $50.00; monthly $150.00; yearly $500.00.

properties.name: Thieles Sandbar
properties.description: This nice, spacious bush camping area with no facilities, except for rubbish bins, is located on the banks of the river. There are shaded and sunny spots to choose from and it's good for fishing and water sports, such as swimming and canoeing. Suitable for big rigs in dry weather only.

properties.name: Barkers Rocks Camp Area
properties.description:
On the west coast of the Peninsula, 12 kilometres north‐west of Minlaton, on Barkers Rocks Road ‐ 5 kilometre walking trail to Port Rickaby – good fishing from rocks ‐ no shade ‐ there are two camping areas and one day use car park.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Chambers Gorge
properties.description: Simple rest area next to Mount Chambers Creek. No facilities, limited shade. Located 95km E of Parachilna via Parachilna Gorge Rd. Dirt road, 4WD recommended, very tricky road.

properties.name: The Bamboos Campground
properties.description:
This is a camping area north of Balgowan in the conservation reserve. Beach launch ‐ patchy mobile phone reception ‐ no shade – access not suitable for larger caravans and motorhomes ‐access track can get overgrown and sandy.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Cowleys Beach Parking
properties.description: Six KM of a good dirt road leads to a level dirt parking area overlooking the beach. There are no facilities so only self-contained vehicles should visit and leave no trace. The land is privately owned and the owner frequently visits. The area has no shade and shelter from the coastal wind. All vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Curdimurka Railway Siding
properties.description: Free parking area at the abandoned railway siding ruins. No facilities available, no shade. Located just N of Oodnadatta Track, 100km W of Marree.

properties.name: Carappee Hill Campground
properties.description: Basic bush camping area in Carappee Hill Conservation Park. Picnic table here and some shade from trees. Located on Carappee Hill Rd, 44km S of Kimba via Cleve Kimba Rd.

properties.name: Roxby Downs Rest Area
properties.description: Really large gravel roadside rest area with no facilities. The further away from the highway you drive, the lower the noise levels become and there is plenty of space to get away from the traffic noise. 48hrs max stay.

properties.name: Andamooka Camping Ground
properties.description: Simple camp area in town. Toilet, picnic table and BBQ facilities available, with a playground and skatepark nearby. Located on Roxby Downs-Andamooka Road. Honesty box for donation.

properties.name: Knobbies Camping & Caravan Area
properties.description: This is a community campground at Iron Knob. It is highly developed with a bitumen area for caravans, gravel area for big rigs, small dirt area for tents. Any type of vehicle can access this area - and it is large enough to accommodate many vehicles. There is a toilet, shelter kitchen with picnic area, gas BBQ, playground, rainwater drinkable water, dump station, recycling and rubbish bin. It is In a small quiet town and is peaceful at night. There is little shade. Please pay donation.

properties.name: Wirrulla West Rest Area
properties.description: This is a standard dirt rest area 9 km W of Wirrulla or 84 km E of Ceduna. It is a level dirt pullover on the south side of the highway. There is a picnic table and rubbish bins. On the western end there is a dirt access road that is more secluded than the rest area. It is next to the highway so there is road noise. There is some shade. All vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Hogwash Bend
properties.description: Shady bush camp on the S bank of Murray River. No facilities, but has a boat ramp and is a nice spot for swimming and fishing. Located on Hogwash Rd, 20km E of Morgan via Cadell Valley Rd.

properties.name: The Marryat Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area close to highway so can be noisy. Emergency phone, a big shelter with a few picnic tables underneath it, a few garbage bins and a rainwater tank with tap provided. The rest area has got a gravel ground and is surrounded by trees and bush.

properties.name: Stockyard Plain Disposal Basin Reserve
properties.description: Camping spot N of Sturt Hwy. Toilets, showers and picnic tables available here. Key (deposit required) & permit must be obtained from Waikerie Information Centre. Located 19km SW of Waikerie. GPS at entrance.

properties.name: Goyder's Line Memorial Rest Area
properties.description: This is a camping spot 3 km N of Melrose or 22 km S of Wilmington. There are multiple dirt entrances that lead to parking areas and turnarounds. The surfaces are dirt and level. There is a concrete causeway that runs through the creek which is currently dry. This camping spot has rubbish bins and fire pits but no other facilities. It is shaded with gumtrees and bush and secluded. It is near the road but road noise is minimal at night. All types of vehicles can access this area. Long vehicles may be limited to the portions of the park closer to the road.

properties.name: Terowie Railway Rest Area
properties.description: This is a parking area at Terowie at the old railway siding. It is the site of the old Terowie Railyard. There are no facilities. The surface is a large grassy area. There is enough space for many vehicles. The area is quiet and some shade is available. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Mulga Well Rest Area
properties.description: Basic, big rest area off the highway down a 300m gravel road so won't be noisy. Rest area has got a sheltered picnic table and two garbage bins provided. It is surrounded by some trees and bush and has a gravel ground to camp on.

properties.name: Clements Gap School Camping Area
properties.description: This is a camping area inside and behind the old Clement Gap Schoolgrounds. There are no facilities. The main entrance had a clearance of <3 meters so tall vehicles access using the side entrance 100 meters down the road. There is a parking area in the Schoolgrounds and a large grass field behind the Schoolgrounds. Any vehicle can access this area. The Schoolgrounds are full of historical information and displays. This is a peaceful area but some road noise is heard from the nearby road.  Shade is available.

properties.name: Cordola Camping Area
properties.description: Camp spots along river at Pelican Point. No facilities but some shade from trees and a boat ramp. It's also a nice spot for swimming and fishing.Located on Pelican Point Rd, 12km S of Morgan via Morgan-Blanchtown Rd.

properties.name: Pootnoura Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area 100m off the highway down a gravel road. It provides a rainwater tank with tap, a sheltered information board, three garbage bins and a big shelter which covers two picnic tables and can fit two cars underneath it. You park and camp on a gravel road and the rest area is surrounded by bush.

properties.name: Olary Rest Area
properties.description: 2km E of Olary. 65km SW of Cockburn. Suitable for Tents, Campervan and Big Rigs. Facilities include Toilets, Bins, Picnic areas, Pub across road. Hardcore rest area suitable for self-contained vehicles. Adjacent to the road on the left hand side when coming from Broken hill. Some clay/sandy areas which can be used for camping in swags.

properties.name: Algebuckina Bridge Neals Creek
properties.description: Basic riverside campsite with no facilities, but lovely views over the bridge. Close to town.

properties.name: Yunta Centennial Park
properties.description: This large unsealed drive-through rest area is located just off the highway, by BP station and the post office. There are toilets and picnic tables. Donations are appreciated.

properties.name: Little Blue Lake
properties.description: Large parking area by the lake on Mount Salt Rd. A rubbish bin is the only facility, very limited shade. Located 17km SW of Mount Gambier.

properties.name: Big Bend River Camping
properties.description: This is a Camp Spot 6 km S of Swan Reach or 17 km N of Nildottie, turn W onto Old Loxton Rd. Follow the good dirt road until you reach the river. This is a secluded and quiet camp area on the river. Be self contained - only rubbish bins are provided. Any type of vehicle can access this area. There is shade and a boat ramp. Maximum stay:  48 Hours

properties.name: Millicent South Rest Stop
properties.description: An extremely basic drive-through roadside bay with picnic facilities, but no rubbish bins.

properties.name: Roxby Downs Lions Park
properties.description: Free camping area at the Lions Park in Roxby Downs. Toilets, bins and picnic tables available. Must be self-contained. Located on Burgoyne St.

properties.name: Monalena Lagoon Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area next to highway. A big shelter covering two picnic tables, a sheltered information board, a few garbage bins and a rainwater tank with tap provided. The rest area has got a gravel ground to camp on but also has got some extra areas with red dirt and bush to camp on, these areas will be less noisy as they are further away from the highway.

properties.name: Worlds End Campground Burra Creek Gorge Reserve
properties.description: This is a camping ground  26 km SE of Burra in the Burra Creek Gorge Reserve. The camping area is on the left as you enter the reserve. There is 500m of dirt road that is suitable for all vehicles but may be tough in prolonged wet weather. The camping area is on grass and overlooks the gorge. There is a toilet and rubbish bin. The area is peaceful and quiet. Some shade is available. There are activities and walks in the gorge.

properties.name: Forestry Information Stop Area
properties.description: Large grass area, SC only. Picnic tables, all fires prohibited, walking track and info on forestry available.

properties.name: Nooltana Creek Parking Area
properties.description: Unsealed rest area on The Outback Hwy. Picnic tables are the only facility, no shade here. Located 10km N of Hawker.

properties.name: Cowell RV Parking
properties.description: This is a large level dirt parking area for self-contained vehicles only. There are rubbish bins and no other facilities. Any type of vehicle can access this area. The road is dirt and there is no shade or shelter from wind. 14 day maximum stay.

properties.name: Lakes Edge Camping Area Lake Gillies Conservation Park
properties.description: This is a camping area 76 km W of Iron Knob. Turn N off Eyre Hwy 67 km W of Iron Knob or 17 km E of Kimba.
