There is a 9 km dirt track to camp area in good condition and suitable for off road caravans & camper trailers. If driving down toward the lake, 4WD is recommended as tracks can be sandy. There are no facilities at this campsite. There are informational signs about the lake and environment. It is quiet and peaceful and secluded. There are shady and nonshady places to camp.

properties.name: Purnong Reserve Camping
properties.description: Parking Area at Purnong. E side of river, beside ferry crossing. There is a gravel carpark on the right side (facing river), no fires or tents. There is a grass and dirt clearing on the left side. Any type of vehicle can access this area. Toilets are just 50m up the road. There is shade and a rubbish bin. It is peaceful and quiet but vehicles are accessing the ferry.

properties.name: Tiparra Rocks Camping
properties.description:
This is a large Camp Area 8 km N of Balgowan. Beach launch – good snorkelling ‐ no shade – access not suitable for larger caravans and motorhomes ‐ access track can get overgrown and sandy.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: 38k Peg Parking Bay
properties.description: This is a typical rest area at the 38km peg in Nullarbor National Park. There is a large gravel parking bay on the south side of the road. There are some rocky and dirt tracks that lead all the way to the cliffs - these are suitable for small vehicles only. Two wheel drive is fine to access the cliffs, but there are some rocks that can damage tyres so go slow. There are no facilities. There is no shade. There is road noise in the gravel pit area. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Carrow Wells Camping
properties.description: This is a historic well site and free campground. The dirt road to the site is  good. There is a rubbish bin and no other facilities. The road at the camp can be sandy and rocky. Long vehicles can access but may have trouble turning. 2 wheel drive is ok. There is little shade.

properties.name: Ardune Range Rest Area
properties.description: Spacious rest area on the corner of Konetta Naracoorte Rd & Lucindale Mount Burr Rd. Picnic tables, bins and some shade available. It has a drive-through layout and provides a choice of shaded or sunny spots. The toilets are new and well-kept, the surface is gravel and grassy and accessing this rest area is easy.

properties.name: Appila Springs
properties.description: Short drive from the village of Appila. Composting toilet. Bring own water. Shelter sheds with information about area, wildlife, birds etc. Beautiful scenery, quiet and peaceful.

properties.name: Tractor Beach Campground
properties.description: Small (only 4 sites) primative campsite with composting toilet.  Payment by honesty box, maintained by Streaky Bay District Council. Not much room on sandy tracks, not suitable for trailers or caravans.

properties.name: Lock Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Park is located in the township of Lock with the Bowling Club next door and the Hotel and Supermarket within easy walking distance. 

Lock township is located in the centre of Eyre Peninsula making travel to other towns from this central point, easy.

properties.name: Clare Valley Caravan Park
properties.description: Clare Valley Caravan Park is a great tourist park in Clare Valley for spending quality time with the family enjoying the fresh air. We have a range of cabins and camp sites available for tents, RVs and trailers, with reliable powered sites available.

properties.name: Broughton Bay RV Park
properties.description: Port Broughton RV PARK is free but please leave a donation

properties.name: Mt Monster Conservation Park
properties.description:
A great little spot, about 10K of the Dukes highway at Keith.
The track in is a bit tight for vans over 25ft, but manageable.
There are a number of sites as you enter and near the main carpark, but the best sites are either on the acres of flat ground near the exit, or better still in the old quarry area although it's a bit tight there for bigger rigs. Surface is gravel everywhere so solid to drive on.
If you have a big rig, drive in the out gate and the big stress is just inside, but probably get someone to walk in front it's only about 100 mt to where you leave the track to camp.

properties.name: Woolshed Cave
properties.description:
Woolshed Cave is a limestone cave located in the Nullarbor Plain in South Australia. It is about 100 kilometres north of Ceduna and is accessible by a 4WD track. 

The cave is about 100 metres long and has a number of chambers. The largest chamber is called the Woolshed Chamber, which is where the cave gets its name. The cave is home to a variety of stalactites and stalagmites.

Woolshed Cave is a popular tourist destination and is open to the public for guided tours. The tours are conducted by experienced cavers and take about 2 hours.

properties.name: Big Winch Lookout
properties.description: The Big Winch Lookout is a popular tourist attraction in Coober Pedy, South Australia. It is a large metal structure that resembles a winch, and it offers panoramic views of the town and the surrounding desert.

properties.name: Snowtown Centenary Caravan Park
properties.description: Low cost camp ground located in Centenary Park. Walking distance to town. Flush toilets. Drinking water.

properties.name: Lucky Bay Camping Area
properties.description: Small camping area with beach access for 2-4 SC campers at the end of the Lucky Bay shacks road. No facilities except bins. Public toilets nearby. 16kms from Cowell. Place fees in box and display permit.

properties.name: Port Gibbon Campsite
properties.description:
Point Gibbon Campground is a scenic camping spot located on the Eyre Peninsula in South Australia. Known for its stunning coastal views and pristine beaches.

Located at the end of Port Gibbon road where it meets the sand dunes, a flat beachside camping area with bins and easy beach access for pedestrians and vehicles.

Visitors can enjoy a range of activities such as fishing, swimming, and beachcombing. The area is also popular for its opportunities to spot local wildlife, including dolphins and various bird species. Facilities at the campground are basic, providing a more rustic and natural camping experience.

properties.name: Emu Bay Campground
properties.description:
The camping ground is situated in the picturesque small town of Emu Bay and is within walking distance of a fantastic white sandy beach. The level sites make this an ideal camping ground for caravans or motorhomes.

Although there are no toilets located at the camping ground, a playground, toilets, BBQ facilities and sheltered picnic area are available nearby (approximately 500m).

properties.name: South Australia's Southern Most Point
properties.description: South Australia's southernmost point is located at Cape Martin, also known as South Point. This remote coastal location marks the southern extremity of the Eyre Peninsula, a prominent peninsula in South Australia.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Streaky Bay Foreshore
properties.description:
Welcome to Discovery Parks - Streaky Bay Foreshore, where our coastline steals the show. It's a paradise for families and fisherfolk alike.

Discovery Parks - Streaky Bay Foreshore provides a serene retreat with a variety of accommodation options, including well-equipped cabins and spacious camping sites. 

The park’s location along the foreshore makes it an ideal choice for guests looking to enjoy the natural beauty of the Eyre Peninsula, with easy access to beaches, local attractions, and recreational activities.

properties.name: Nyroca Camp & Function Centre
properties.description:
Nyroca is located on Flinders Highway, 55kms north-west of Port Lincoln on a 21ha natural bushland setting.

With two fully-equipped modern kitchens, Nyroca can host large functions, and the unique outdoor chapel is ideal for bush weddings and church retreats. Full catering by arrangement.

There are powered and unpowered campsites, and caravans and motorhomes are most welcome.

Free Wifi is available and use of the washing machine and the kitchen oven is included in the tariff.

properties.name: Wattle Point Camp Site
properties.description:
Wattle Beach is suitable for all vehicles (has to have on board facilities) and has some shade. The rubbish is only collected during holidays.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Larantinga Wetlands
properties.description: Larantinga Wetlands is an oasis in the Adelaide Hills of South Australia, home to over 150 bird species. Take a walk along the boardwalks and trails, or rent a paddle boat and explore the waterways.

properties.name: Poochera Hotel and Caravan Park
properties.description: Aussie country Hotel, with basic Hotel style accomodation as well as a small Caravan Park out the back, we have evening meals from 6.00pm to 8.30pm Tuesday to Saturday & 6.00pm to 8.00pm Sunday, we also do lunches from 11.00am to 2.00pm Thursday to Sunday.

properties.name: Moorook
properties.description:
A beautiful spot right on the river dogs welcome on a lead there are only a few powered spots about 4 down the grass end but plenty of non powered areas.

There is a boat ramp and day area and 2 camping area.

properties.name: Harveys Return Campsite
properties.description: Beautiful location in the national park. No amenities, lots of shade and walka available.

properties.name: Stansbury Walking Trails
properties.description:
The Stansbury Walking Trail is a total distance of 6.3 km, along the coastline, from the town jetty to Pitts Cutting - south of the township.

The trails provide walking, cycling and disabled access to the region's coastal reserves, with rest areas and lookout points along the way. Along the walking trail you'll also find adult gym equipment, which can be used in conjunction with your walk.

properties.name: Mount Muirhead Lookout
properties.description:
The Mount Muirhead Lookout is a great place to view the surrounding Millicent flats, the Mount Burr Range and Forestry South Australia pine plantations. 

You can see across the rich black soil flats to the township of Millicent and further on the horizon to the Limestone Coast and Canunda National Park.

properties.name: Ingalalla Waterfalls
properties.description:
Ingalalla Waterfalls is a beautiful waterfall located in the Second Valley Forest, on the Fleurieu Peninsula in South Australia. It is a popular tourist destination, known for its easy access and stunning scenery.

The waterfall is a two-tiered drop, with the lower tier being the most popular for swimming.

properties.name: Hillocks Drive
properties.description:
Hillocks Drive embraces several kilometres of spectacular, rugged coastline interspersed with quiet, sandy beaches and rock pools. 

A photographer's delight, well known for rock and surf fishing and a haven from the pressures of city living. Kangaroos, pygmy possums, emus and native birds abound in nearby scrubland. Hillocks Drive is located 16 kilometres from the restaurant and facilities of Marion Bay and 18 kilometres from Innes National Park. 

Hillocks Drive is best known for bush camping. 

Camping areas are spacious and cater for a variety of different camping styles.

properties.name: Heron Bend Reserve
properties.description:
Heron's Bend Reserve area is popular for camping and bushwalking. It is located along the Murray River in the Riverland region of South Australia. The reserve includes the eight-kilometre Overland Corner Walking Trail, which takes you past some old Aboriginal campsites. There are also some excellent examples of red gum, black box, and river coolabah trees in the reserve. 

The Heron's Bend Reserve is a great place to visit for a weekend getaway or camping trip. There are plenty of activities to keep you busy, such as bushwalking, fishing, swimming, and birdwatching. You can also visit the historic Overland Corner Hotel, which is located just a short walk from the reserve.

properties.name: Ethel Shipwreck
properties.description:
The Ethel Shipwreck is a popular tourist attraction located on Ethel Beach in Dhilba Guuranda-Innes National Park on the Yorke Peninsula, South Australia. The shipwreck is typically buried beneath sand, but it is occasionally exposed during stormy weather conditions with high tides and huge swells.

The Ethel was a 711-tonne, three-masted iron barque that was built in 1876. She ran aground in a storm while en route from South Africa to Port Adelaide in January 1904. One man drowned as he tried to swim ashore with a rescue line, but the rest of the crew reached land safely.

properties.name: Coles Crossing Camp
properties.description: Basic campsite with no amenities. Camping is usully not permitted 1st November to 30 April due to bbush fire season. Managed by DEWNR

properties.name: Gleesons Landing
properties.description:
On the west coast of the foot, 19 kilometres south west of Corny Point ‐ access off Corny Point to Marion Bay Road. Toilet facilities available, 4WD beach launch for boats, water pump available for bathing and washing but not suitable for drinking. There is little shade. Site is suitable for
conventional vehicles, it is close to surf beaches, good beach fishing, no mobile phone reception, many small camping areas as well as areas suitable for groups, rubbish and recycling bins provided.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Corny Point Backbeach Camp
properties.description: Basic camping with no amenities, but stunning views. 24 hour maximum stay.

properties.name: Memory Cove
properties.description:
There is plenty to see and do in Lincoln National Park and Memory Cove Wilderness Protection Area. Boating, fishing, beachcombing, swimming, bird watching and nature walks are all popular activities. A variety of designated campgrounds in the park offer easy access to the beaches, bays and walking trails. Lincoln National Park overlooks Boston Bay, the largest natural harbour in Australia, with granite headlands, sheltered bays and scenic offshore islands. On the southern side of the park are the massive, wind-sculpted sand dunes of the Sleaford-Wanna dune system and the pounding surf of the Southern Ocean.

Memory Cove itself is a magnificent and secluded bay with a pure white sandy beach, cradled between densely vegetated headlands. Memory Cove provides a very special camping or day-visit wilderness experience. Explorer Matthew Flinders named the area in honour of his crew who lost their lives while searching for water. When Flinders reached the area in 1802, fresh water supplies were so low that he sent eight of his crew off to search for more. They never returned. 

Booking is essential!
properties.fees: You must book to camp in Memory Cove, and a pass and key are required. A $50 key deposit is required. Vehicle (max 8 people) - $12; Park vehicle entry: $11.00. Please bring the money as change is not available.

properties.name: Plushs Bend
properties.description:
Nice and shaded area for camping with good access road. No amenities. Max. stay 7 days.
$10 per night
No tent camping

properties.name: Breakaways Lookout
properties.description:
The Breakaways Lookout in Flinders Ranges is a stunning vantage point that offers breathtaking panoramic views of the unique and otherworldly landscape. Its rugged terrain, characterized by striking red earth and eroded mesas, resembles a Martian landscape. 

This remote and awe-inspiring location is a favorite among nature enthusiasts and photographers, providing an unforgettable glimpse into the ancient geological history of Australia.

properties.name: Mount Barker Rest Stop
properties.description:
Westbound vehicles only (there is an eastbound equivalent 3km further east). 

Pretty noisy as right by the freeway and a stop for truckers to check their vehicles before a long descent, but a convenient rest stop for Adelaide.

Got a toilet a few bins and a rest area.

Max stay 20hr

properties.name: Wrights Bay Bush Camping
properties.description: Nice paddock style campsite by a beach. Lovely soft sandy beach, nice  for walks, fishing and relaxing waves. Lots of kelp with so many colours it’s amazing.  We saw Stingrays, birds and the sunset.

properties.name: Murray River Queen Backpackers
properties.description: The Murray River Queen Backpackers is the ultimate budget accommodation in the Riverland. With 113 beds our hostel has a large bar area, rooftop deck, a water blob, 12 person barbecue boat for hire, large do it yourself commercial kitchen and our famous Thai Restaurant - Wok on Water.

properties.name: Burra Creek Gorge Reserve (Worlds End)
properties.description: This secluded riverside campground is large and offers good shade. It is located on the banks of Burra Creek and is an attractive destination for birds and wildlife. There are plenty of level and shaded sites and good amenities available here, including toilets and picnic tables.

properties.name: Warooka Memorial Oval
properties.description: This camping area with good facilities and a playground is located by the tennis court (available for hire). There is a petrol station nearby. Donations are welcome here.

properties.name: Streaky Bay Turnoff Rest Area - Poochera
properties.description: Large area located just off the highway, only a short drive away from a Roadhouse. There is plenty of space and shade, and the layout of this site allows for a bit of privacy. The facilities are limited to picnic tables and it might get a bit noisy.

properties.name: Port Gibbon Foreshore
properties.description: This spacious rest area with good facilities and a dump point is located beside the port in a seaside village and offers scenic views. 7km dirt road to reach campsite

properties.name: Mexican Hat Cheetama Beach
properties.description: This scenic and dispersed camping area is located on the beach with no amenities. Vehicles can access the top of the bluff and the main beach, where you can choose the spot that best suits your needs. For superb fishing head far west.

properties.name: Mambray Creek Rest Area
properties.description: A large roadside drive-through rest area located next to a railway line, just off the highway, on both sides. For overnight stays, you can drive further into the land and park between some trees for extra privacy and minimized noise levels. There are no facilities, other than picnic tables.

properties.name: Kooma View Old Farmhouse Camping
properties.description: This old homestead, located on a working farm just off the highway, has been kindly opened to the public by the farm's owners. The campground is large and grassy, with good facilities that include a camp kitchen with a seating area. Donations are welcome and the owners are more than happy to talk about the history of this place.

properties.name: Hancocks Shaft Rest Area
properties.description: Spacious drive-through rest area with no facilities. It is separated from the highway by some scrub, which limits the traffic noise slightly. There is not much shade or privacy and the site is frequented by trucks.

properties.name: Coodlie Park - Port Kenny - Venus Bay
properties.description:
Located on Great Australian Bight and the beautiful Eyre Peninsula coast of South Australia, here at Coodlie Park Eco Retreat we are wholeheartedly committed to sharing the extraordinary experience of our unique off-grid bush campground and cottage eco retreat with visitors from all around the globe. 

As a passionate husband and wife team, we are both strong advocate for sustainable living and traveling, and we aim to uphold our dedication by offering a unique blend of relaxation and adventure by embracing sustainable eco-tourism nestled amongst the pristine beauty of the Eyre Peninsula.

properties.name: Lipson Cove
properties.description: Lipson Cove is renown for its stunning views, with offered activities ranging from swimming, canoeing, boating and fishing. Around fifteen campsites are available, with basic facilities (toilets).

properties.name: Rapid Bay Camping Area
properties.description: Rapid Bay Camping Area provides a relaxing atmosphere with basic facilities. Amenities include electric BBQs, cold showers, and toilets. Booking side without booking no chance and rangers very rude Fires are banned.

properties.name: Brinkworth Travellers Overnight Stay
properties.description: Brinkworth Travellers Overnight Stay has powered and unpowered sites with all of the basic amenities, including showers. Maximum stay of 3 nights. Fires are prohibited. Call to book.
properties.fees: AUD $6 Site (Basic); $12 Site (Power and Shower access)

properties.name: Wittelbee Conservation Park
properties.description:
Wittelbee Conservation Park has basic bush campsites within their coastal park. 

Fires are prohibited from 29 October to 15 April. 

Call for enquiries.

properties.name: Loch Luna Game Reserve
properties.description:
Loch Luna Game Reserve has a few camping areas with basic bush facilities including toilets, picnic tables, fire pits, and BBQs. 

Fire ban is in effect from 15 November to 15 April . 

Call regarding any enquiries.

properties.name: The Gums Campground
properties.description: The Gums campground has five shady sites which are accessible by small caravans. 4WD suggested. Facilities include limited fresh water, and a pit toilet. The surf beach is a short walk away, and fishing is available along the 4WD track.

properties.name: Murray Bridge Showgrounds
properties.description: Murray Bridge Showgrounds is suitable for self contained vehicles only. Pets are permitted. There are no facilities available.

properties.name: Port Augusta Motorhome Park
properties.description: Port Augusta Motorhome Park is located on Power Station Road and is suitable for self contained vehilces only. A dump point is available.  There is a maximum stay of 14 days.

properties.name: Western River Cove Campground
properties.description: Western River Cove camping area is situated alongside a remote estuarie on the north coast. Camp sites are suitable for vehicle based camping. Facilities include toilets, BBQ, picnic shelter and drinking water. You will need to bring your own firewood. A camping permit is required and can be obtained through the Kangaroo Island council.

properties.name: Port Gibbon Jetty Campground
properties.description: Port Gibbon Foreshore camping area provides sites for tents, caravans and motorhomes. Facilities include dump point, toilets, fireplace, picnic tables, and water. Pets are allowed. Activities include fishing, birdwatching and walking trails.

properties.name: Bool Lagoon Game Reserve
properties.description: Bool Lagoon Game Reserve camping area is suitable for tents and caravans. Facilities include toilets, picnic tables and BBQ.  Bookings can be made online.

properties.name: Murray Lagoon Campground
properties.description: Murray Lagoon Campground is located in Cape Gantheaume Conservation Park. It provides site for vehicle based camping, camper trailers and motorhomes. Facilities include toilets, water, and picnic tables. Camping permits can be obtained for the Murray Lagon ranger station.

properties.name: Melrose Showground
properties.description: Melrose Showground camping area offers creekside camping. Sites are suitable for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, hot showers, and drinking water. Local attractions include climbing at Mt Remarkable. In the area you can enjoy biking, horseriding and bike trails. Enquires can be made through the Distric Council.

properties.name: Bunyip Park
properties.description: Bunyip Park camping area provides 2 powered sites as well as unpowered sites, suitable for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, showers, BBQ, picnic tables and shelter. You will need to bring water and firewood. There is fishing in the area. There is a maximum stay of 24 hours.

properties.name: Border Cliffs Campground
properties.description: Border Cliffs Campground is located in Chowilla Game Reserve. It provides self-sufficient bush camping. Toilets are available. You will need to bring your own fire wood and water. Activities include fishing, canoeing and walking trails.

properties.name: Wedina Well Campground
properties.description: Wedina Well Campground is suitable for vehicle based camping and caravans. There is a wood fire available. Entrance of site is on Calc Road with a "Reserve" sign posted. You will need to be self sufficient. Permits are required and can be obtained through Parks SA Ceduna.

properties.name: Scrubby Camp
properties.description: Scrubby Camp camping area is situated beside the Cooper Creek. Sites are suitable for vehicle based camping and camper trailers. There are no facilities available. 4WD is required. Permits are needed.

properties.name: Yeldulkie Weir
properties.description: Yeldulkie Weir picnic area is located 37 km W of Cowell or 5 km E of Cleve. A donation is requested.

properties.name: Kudriemitchie Campground
properties.description: Located in Innamincka Regional Reserve, Kudriemitchie Campground is suitable for vehicle based camping and camper trailers. You will need a 4WD along the Coognie Track. A camping permit is needed. There are no facilities available. You must be self-sufficient. Activities include fishing and swimming.

properties.name: Sceale Bay Bush Camping
properties.description: Sceale Bay Bush Camping area is suitable for vehicle based camping. There are no facilities available. You must be self-sufficient. There is great beach and rock-fishing. Pets are not permitted.

properties.name: Goldsmiths Beach Camping Area
properties.description:
Goldsmiths Beach Camping Area offers 10 open, sandy campsites. A popular spot for fishing with weak mobile signal. Suitable for all vehicles and has some shade.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Mozzie Flat Camping Reserve
properties.description:
Located at the far end of Sturt Bay, Mozzie Flat Camping Reserve provides sites for vehicle based camping. It is suited to off road vehicles and camper vans only. There are limited facilities. The beach can be easily accessed from the camp by a boardwalk. There are two small camping areas, some shade and patchy mobile phone reception. Activities include swimming and fishing. Pet are allowed.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Mungerannie Hotel
properties.description: Located beside the Derwent River, Mungerannie Hotel has 15 basic rooms and  a camping ground for any style of camping. Camp fires are allowed. You will need to bring your own fire wood. Check in and payment can be done at the Hotel.

properties.name: Coonalpyn Soldiers Memorial Caravan Park
properties.description: Coonalpyn Soldiers Memorial Caravan Park offers powered and un-powered sites. Facilities include shower, laundry area, and electric BBQ.  Local attractions include BMZ track, swimming pool and playground. An honesty box is available, or fees can be paid to carekater in the evening.

properties.name: Morgan Conservation Park Northern Section
properties.description: Morgan Conservation Park camping area offers bush camping suitable for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include BBQ and picnic tables.  Activities include swimming, fishing, canoeing, and hiking trails. Pets are not allowed.

properties.name: Comet Bore Campground
properties.description: Comet Bore Campgroun located in Ngarkat Conservation Park offers bush camping for vehilce based camping, caravans and camping trailers. There are no facilities avaialbe. Generators are allowed. You will need to be self-sufficient. Pets are not allowed.

properties.name: Old Man Lake
properties.description: Old Man Lake campground, located in Little Dip Conservation Park offers lake side camping. There is no access for caravans. Pit-style toilets are available. There are limited facilites. You will need to be self-sufficient, including your own water. In the area you can enjoy walking trails. Bookings can be made online.

properties.name: Swincers Rocks
properties.description:
No shade, suitable for conventional vehicles with care, often garfish and squid off rocks, good snorkelling, no mobile phone reception.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.
properties.fees: Permit full price: nightly $10; weekly $50; monthly $150; yearly $500

properties.name: Bush Camping - Hillocks Drive
properties.description: Hillocks Drive camping area near Butlers Beach offers bush camping. Sites are suitable for tents, caravans and campervans. Facilities include eco toilets, bore and rain water and rubbish bins. Hot showers, washing machines and flush toilets can be found at the local shop. Camp fires are permitted. You will need to bring your own wood, metal bucket and metal shovel.  Bookings can be made online.

properties.name: Farina Station Campground
properties.description: Farina Station Campground offers bush camping or you can stay in the Shearer's quarters. Camping facilities include woodfire, BBQ, picnic tables, showers, and toilets. You may purchase firewood at the campsite or bring your own. The quarters include bathroom, laundry, basic kitchen and TV. (Bedding not provided.) Advanced bookings are not availalbe for campsites.
properties.fees: AUD $5 per person per night (camping) AUD $25 per person per night (Shearer's Quarters)

properties.name: Louth Bay Campground
properties.description: Louth Bay Campground offers five unpowered sites suitable for vehilce based camping, caravans and camper trailers.  There are only toilet facilities available. In the area you can enjoy fishing, swimming and walking trails. Pre bookings are not accepted.

properties.name: Minnipa Apex Park
properties.description: Minnipa Apex Park is suitable for overnight camping. There is access for caravans and big rigs. Facilities include toilets, showers, electric BBQ, drinking water and picnic tables. A good spot while exploring Tcharkuldu Rock and Pidappa Rock.

properties.name: Trig Campground
properties.description: Trig Campground located in Deep Creek Conservation Park, offers unpowered campsites for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets and showers. You will need to bring your own water. Pets  are not allowed. Bookings can be made online.

properties.name: Mount Pleasant Caravan Park
properties.description: Talunga Park Caravan Park operates as a recreation park, showgrounds and caravan park. Powered sites are suitable for tents, camper trailers, caravans, RVs, and big rigs. Features include electric BBQ, toilets, showers, picnic tables, tennis cours, and playground.

properties.name: Murphys Haystacks
properties.description: Murphys Haystacks park area is suitable for caravans and motorhomes. Facilities include toilets, and picnic tables with shelter. This rest area is for 24 hour use only. Mobile phone service is available.

properties.name: Yallunda Flat Showgrounds
properties.description: Yallunda Flat Showgrounds offers a campsite with toilets, BBQ and fire pit. Pets are allowed.

properties.name: Antechamber Bay North Campground
properties.description: Antechamber Bay West Campground located in Lashmar Conservation Park offers sites for vehicle-based camping, camper trailer and caravans. Facilities include toilets, BBQ, wood fireplace, picnic tables and sheltered picnic area. You will need to bring your own food and water. You can enjoy birdwatching and canoeing at the nearby Lashmar Lagoon. There is also great swimming and fishing at Antechamber Bay, on the eastern end of Kangaroo Island. A self-registration station is located on this site.

properties.name: Pooginook Conservation Park
properties.description: Pooginook  Conservation Park is set among sand dunes and mallee scrub. The camping area is suitable for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers. A great place for birdwatching. Wood fires and solid fuel fires are not permitted. Gas fires are permitted on non fire ban days.

properties.name: Cockburn Village
properties.description: Cockburn Village Camping area is located near the village Hotel. The site is suitable for tents, caravans, camper trailers and motorhomes. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ facilities, toilets, showers and access to water.

properties.name: Loxton Motorhome Reserve
properties.description: Loxton Motorhome Reserve is a campsite only suitable for self contained vehicles.  No tents allowed. A maximum stay of 3 nights. There are no powered sites. Facilities are limited. There is a park ranger who visits the campgrounds. Across the road is the Loxton Swimming Pools.

properties.name: Gravel Bay
properties.description:
*camping is not permitted in the Berry Bay car park areas

On the west coast of the foot on Berry Bay Road, 18 kilometres west of Corny Point, via Light House Road, camping permitted on the coastal reserve, at bottom of cliff, no mobile phone reception, no shade, 4WD only.

When camping at any of Yorke Peninsula Council’s bush camp grounds, you will need to bring your own water and firewood; gas or fuel stoves are preferred. It is your responsibility to familiarise yourself with any fire bans in place. Dogs kept under control or on a lead are welcome.

properties.name: Koonalda Homestead
properties.description:
The only option for camping within the Nullarbor Wilderness Protection Area. 
This is a basic campsite suitable for tents, caravans and camper trailers. There is an interesting car graveyard on site and basic facilities. Bring your own supplies.

properties.name: Little Gums Campground
properties.description: Little Gums Campground is located in SA. This campsite is only suitable for tents and smaller vehicles and caravans. There are only 5 campsites. Facilities include picnic tables and pit toilets. Bring your own water supply.

properties.name: Dingley Dell Campground
properties.description: Located in Flinders Range National Park, Dingley Dell gampground is situated on the Oraparinna Creek. Check out the popular Adnyamathanha rock carvings at the Perawurtina Cultural Heritage. The campground offers 8 sites for camping. Facilities include toilets and a self-registration station located on site.
properties.fees: AUD $14 per vehicle $8 per additional person $5.50 per child

properties.name: Dalhousie Springs Campground
properties.description: Dalhousie Springs Campground in Witjira National Park, offers sites for vehilce based camping, and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets and cold showers. In the area you can enjoy bush walking, swimming in the hot springs, and walking trails. Dalhousie Homestead ruins are a short drive away.
properties.fees: AUD $19 per vehicle $9 per additional person $5.50 per person (groups over 20ppl)

properties.name: Teamsters Campground
properties.description: Teamsters campground located in Flinders Range National Park, is situated on the cliffs of the Brachina Creek. It offer 5 sites, 2 that are suitable for buses. Facilities include toilets and a self-registration station on site.

properties.name: Brachina East Campground
properties.description: Brachina East campground has two different sites, located on the banks of Brachina Creek and Aroona Creek. Located on the high section of the southern bank, you'll find the 2WD camping section. The 4WD section is accessed by a rugged track across the creek. Sites are suitable for vehicle based camping.  Facilites include toilets, wood fireplace and a self-registration station on site.

properties.name: Waganny Camping Area
properties.description:
Gawler Ranges National Park will be closed from 26/10/2024 until 01/11/2024 for public safety while a pest animal control program is undertaken.

Waganny Camping Area, located in Gawler Ranges National Park offers open woodland camping for vehicle based camping, caravans and camping trailers. There are no facilities available. You will need to be self-sufficient with water, firewood and gas/fuel stove. Permits apply

properties.name: Stenhouse Bay Campground
properties.description: Located in Innes National park, Stenhouse Bay camping area is 6km off Marion Bay, close to the visitor centre, shops and tavern. Near by this campsite you'll find a beach and historic jetty, great fishing, surfing, snorkelling and bushwalking. Camping is suitable for caravans, camper trailers, and vehilce-based camping. Facilities include toilets, BBQ, and picnic area. Bring your own water and firewood. A gas/fuel stove is preferred.

properties.name: Mark Point
properties.description: Mark Point is located in Coorong National park. With a boat ramp near the camp, it is an ideal site to explore Lake Alexandrina. Camping is suitable for caravans, trailers and vehicle-based camping. The beaches are accessible by 4WD. Enjoy fishing, canoeing, sailing, and walking trails.  Bring your own water. Fire restrictions apply.

properties.name: Italowie Gap Campground
properties.description:
The Italowie Gap camping areas are located approximately 20 minutes from Balcanoona on the Copley-Balcanoona road. There are two camping areas. The first area is on the south-western side of the gap via a small access track. 

This area is set amongst river red gums below a small cliff face and is a shady spot in summer. The second area is located on the north-eastern side of the gap, off the access track behind the information bay. 

These sites are set amongst wattles and river red gums near the start of the Italowie Gorge Hike.

Access: 2WD and 4WD
Suitable for: tents, camper trailers and small caravans.
Facilities: nil.
Campfires: allowed (seasonal fire restrictions apply).
Unallocated camping - maximum 6 vehicles.
Electricity: unpowered.

properties.name: Engine Point Campground
properties.description:
Engine Point campground sits above a shallow sandy beach with beautiful views of Boston Bay. 

There is little shade and exposure to westerly winds. There are seven allocated campsites for unpowered camping. Access all weather 2WD track for all sites except campsite 4 which is 4WD access. 

Suitable for tents, camper trailers and caravans. 

No facilities, nearest are at September Beach (approx 2km). Campfires permitted, fire pits not provided (seasonal fire restrictions and conditions apply). Swimming, fishing, birdwatching, short walks and trekking.

There are no amenities.

properties.name: Trezona Campground
properties.description:
This peaceful campground along Brachina Gorge Road is ideally located for several loop walks. The campground is a short walk from the internationally-significant geological Ediacaran Golden Spike.

Trezona Campground is located in the Flinders Range National Park. There are 18 campsites suitable for tents, caravans and camper trailers. 

Facilities include compost toilets, picnic tables and BBQ facilities. No drinking water is available so bring your own supply.

properties.name: Malkumba-Coongie Lakes Campground
properties.description:
The park is a pristine water world made up of channels, waterholes, lakes, internal deltas, shallow floodplains and interdune corridors and swamps. Motorboats, camp fires, fishing and generators are not permitted in the park, ensuring a genuine wilderness experience. 

Malkumba-Coongie Lakes offers camping around the lake's edge. Toilet facilities are located at the Cooper Creek day visitor area and campground.

Camping fees are per vehicle per night

- Access:4WD.
- Suitable for: tents and camper trailers.
- Facilities: Long-drop toilet.
- Campfires: not allowed.
- Unallocated campground: maximum 10 vehicles.
- Electricity: unpowered.

properties.name: Weetootla Gorge Campground
properties.description: Weetootla Gorge Camping area is located along the Balcanoona Creek. The camping area is suitable to 4WD vehicles and smaller caravans. Facilities include pit toilets. Fire restrictions apply.

properties.name: Aroona Ruins Campground
properties.description: Aroona Ruins Campground is situated near the historic Aroona Ruins and is also the beggining of the Heysen Trail. Facilities include campsites, water, toilets, toilets and rubbish bings. It is 2WD/4WD accessible. Pre-booking is not available. You must purchase a permit from the Department for Environment and Heritage offices.

properties.name: Black Box Campground
properties.description: Located on the riverbank, among a large area of trees in Murray River National Park. This campsite is accessible by 2WD, although some areas are unsealed. It is well suited to caravans and tents. It is close to many walking tracks and is an ideal place for birdwatching. Pre-bookings are not available.

properties.name: Point Gibbon South Camp
properties.description: This is a campsite about 3km south of Point Gibbon. There are no facilities, but there is a rubbish bin further south on the road. There is cliffside beach camping and some campsites further from the coast that are more sheltered. The road is dirt and in good shape but in wet weather can become muddy. Any vehicle can access this are but longer vehicles may have difficulty. There is no shade and little shelter from wind.

properties.name: Teddy Bear Tree Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small standard rest area on the B100 Flinders highway. The surface is gravel and level. There is a small dirt pull-in space as well. It extends about 20 meters from the road and road noise exists. There is a covered picnic table as rubbish bin. There is shade. All vehicles can access this area but large vehicles may obstruct the area for others. There is an informative interactive teddy bear tree - as a reminder for depression awareness, someone had created a teddy bear memorial in which people can add messages of support or bring their own teddy bear to attach to the tree.

properties.name: Cummings Monument Lookout
properties.description:
Cummings Monument Lookout is a scenic lookout located on the Flinders Highway, approximately 47 kilometres from the town of Coulta, on the Eyre Peninsula of South Australia. It offers stunning views of the coastline, including the rugged cliffs of Sheringa and the Point Drummond Peninsula.

The lookout was named in memory of Leo Cummings, a local fisherman who drowned in a boating accident in 1959. A monument to Cummings was erected at the lookout in 1961.

To get to Cummings Monument Lookout, drive south on the Flinders Highway from Coulta. The lookout is located approximately 47 kilometres from Coulta, on the left-hand side of the highway. There is a large car park and picnic area located at the lookout.

properties.name: Cliffside Camp Area
properties.description: This is a large cliffside camping area on the northern point of the peninsula. The track in is level and passable by 2wd - but it is slightly sandy and rocky. There are few level areas and sharp turns so long vehicles will have trouble accessing this area. This is a cliffside camp and there are no trees and little protection from the wind. It is very peaceful and not terribly popular. The road to the turnoff is dirt/rock and about 18km long, but well graded. There is no road noise but wind could be a factor, especially in poor weather. The cliffs can be unstable and children must be supervised.

properties.name: Yalata East Rest Area
properties.description: This is a smaller rest area signposted from both directions. There are a few gravel pullovers right next to the road that could accommodate large caravans but trucks and buses will have a hard time maneuvering this area. Further back from the highway the surface is sandy dirt and leads into bush. The whole area is shaded and accessible by 2wd. There is a rubbish bin and rock fire rings but no other facilities. There are low-hanging trees.

properties.name: Baird Bay Campground
properties.description: Campsite for SC vehicles offering BBQ and good access to dolphin watching boat cruises.

properties.name: Border Village Roadhouse
properties.description: Reception at the gas station. Laundry room (4$ wash + 3$ dry). 15$ per camp site. 85$ for a 3 single beds cabin (shared bathroom, 65$ for one bed + 10$ each additional). Other price classes available. Restaurant open limited hours.

properties.name: Border Rest Area
properties.description: Large rest area located just off Western Hwy at VIC/SA border. Toilets and sheltered picnic table available, some shade from trees. Lots of space. 15km W of Lillimur.

properties.name: Montecollina Bore Rest Area
properties.description: Basic rest area off Strzelecki Track with sheltered picnic tables. Located 150km S of Moomba. Access to the campsite is just S of campsite, dirt road.

properties.name: Tcharkuldu Rock
properties.description: This beautiful camping area with good facilities is located approx. 500m off the access road (5km off main road), around the granite rock. It offers scenic views, walking tracks and birdwatching. Suitable for caravans and camper trailers.

properties.name: Tippipila Creek Bush Camp
properties.description: Simple camp area E of the creek. Flush toilet available, limited shade. Located on Birdsville Track, 180km S of Birdsville.

properties.name: The Hancocks Lookout
properties.description:
The Hancocks Lookout Rest Area is a quiet place in the middle of nowhere.

You will get some nice photos for your album here.

Camping permitted for 1 NIGHT ONLY

properties.name: Ingomar Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area next to highway. Rest area has got two big shelters, one covering two picnic tables, the other one covering four picnic tables, two garbage bins, a sheltered information board, a rainwater tank with tap and an emergency phone. The rest area has got a gravel ground and is surrounded by bush.

properties.name: Marla South Rest Area
properties.description: Basic rest area next to highway so can be noisy. It provides two garbage bins and a sheltered picnic table. There are lots of marks left by old fires. You camp on a gravel road and the rest area is surrounded by trees and bush.

properties.name: Rilli Reserve
properties.description: This spacious and open campground is located on the bank of the Murray River and has no amenities. It is accessible in dry weather only and offers some shade, together with a river access. The river offers water-related activities, incl. swimming and good fishing.

properties.name: Puntabie East Rest Area
properties.description: This is a large rest area 48 km W of Wirrulla or 45 km E of Ceduna. It is a level dirt surfaced bush camping site that extends about 250 meters back from the road. There are rubbish bins and a picnic table. There are numerous bush camping sites, some with fire rings. There is shade and seclusion but even in the back road trains can be heard passing on the road. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Tarlee Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 1 km N of Tarlee. 54 km S of Clare or 39 km N of Gawler. The surface is level and sealed with some dirt areas and a grassy median between the pulloff and highway. There are no facilities or rubbish bins. Road noise is present as it is right next to the highway. All vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Ingomar North Rest Area
properties.description: Basic rest area next to highway. The rest area has got a sheltered picnic table and two garbage bins provided. It has a scenic outback lookout, has got a gravel road and is surrounded by bush and some trees.

properties.name: The Frances Recreation Ground
properties.description: Large, grassy camping area provided by the Frances locals. Toilets, picnic tables and bins available. Located in the E side of town, at the end of Second St. Max stay: 24hrs.

properties.name: The Knob Beach Park Area
properties.description: This is a medium sized beachside camping area just northeast of Port Gibbon. The dirt road in is in good shape. The entrance and parking area is dirt and portions are muddy but in good weather 2wd vehicles can easily access this area. There is a long drop toilet and a rubbish bin and no other facilities. There is limited shade and shelter from the wind. The carpark by the toilet is larger and more sheltered and better suited for large vehicles. Near the coast the track becomes sandy and rocky and is better for smaller vehicles or 4wd. There is little road noise here.

properties.name: Heron Bend - Overland Corner Conservation Reserve
properties.description: Bush camping area located on the bank of the Murray River, accessible via a sealed road in dry season only. At the GPS location follow the road until you reach the river bank. There are plenty of level camping spots, shaded and sunny areas and enough privacy, but no amenities. The main attraction in this area is the 8km Overland Corner Walking Trail passing by some old Aboriginal campsites.

properties.name: Colona Rest Area
properties.description: Exposed large drive-through rest area with no facilities and not much shade, located directly by the highway.

properties.name: 52k Peg Parking Bay
properties.description: This is a typical rest area at the 52km peg in Nullarbor National Park. There are two large gravel parking bays on the south side of the road. There is a rocky and dirt track that leads all the way to the cliffs - it is suitable for small vehicles only. Two wheel drive is fine to access the cliffs, but there are some rocks that can damage tyres so go slow. There is a rubbish bin and an untreated water tank here but no other facilities. There is no shade. There is road noise in the gravel pit area. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Hutchison Memorial
properties.description: Rest area about 400 off the highway down a gravel road. It's a very basic rest area and has nothing but a memorial. There are lots of parking spaces and the rest  area is surrounded by some trees and bush.

properties.name: Parachilna Gorge
properties.description: Gravel rest area next to Parachilna Creek. Picnic tables and rubbish bins available, limited shade available. Located on Parachilna Gorge Rd, 13km E of Parachilna.

properties.name: Kingston South Rest Stop
properties.description: Typical roadside drive-through bay rest area with a rubbish bin and a picnic table.

properties.name: Hettner Landing
properties.description: This is a camping area at Walker Flat. Riverside camping turnoff is 50m N of General Store. No tents or tent pegs. No fires or cars on grass. The area is a dirt carpark that is suitable for all types of vehicles. About 6 caravans can utilize the area before its full. There is shade and it is a peaceful and quiet, scenic camp.

properties.name: Owen Oval Parking Area
properties.description: This is parking area at Owen. Entry off Railway Tce behind Grain Silos. The surface is dirt and gravel and there is an area with concrete slabs. There is a toilet, unfiltered water, and rubbish bin. This area is quiet and shady. Any type of vehicle can access this area. Maximum stay:  48 Hours

properties.name: Roxby Downs Rest Area
properties.description: Free rest stop located off Roxby Downs. No facilities.

properties.name: Strangways Siding
properties.description: Free roadside rest area on Oodnadatta Track. No facilities, no shade. 40km SE of William Creek.

properties.name: Warrina Siding
properties.description: Free rest area off Oodnadatta Track. No facilities, no shade. Located 95km S Oodnadatta or 105km NW of William Creek.

properties.name: The Twins Rest Area
properties.description: Basic rest area next to highway. Rest area has got two garbage bins and three picnic tables, one being sheltered. The rest area has got a gravel ground to camp on and is surrounded by bush and a fence.

properties.name: Narrung Jetty Reserve
properties.description: Grassy free camp area at W end of the Narrung Ferry. Toilets, bins and picnic tables available. Located at the end of Poltalloch Rd. Max stay: 72hrs.

properties.name: Ramco Point
properties.description: Bush camping area on the banks of Murray River in Ramco. Toilets and picnic table available at boat ramp but free camping is further down the road from there. Great area for fishing. To access, take Ramco Rd 5km W of Waikerie and turn N at the 'Ramco Point' sign (road next to Ramco Primary School)

properties.description: A beautiful natural pool with incredibly clear water, perfect for swimming.

properties.name: Locks Well Beach
properties.description:
Beautiful beach suited for swimming. 

Locks Well is renowned for being one of the most reliable locations for consistently catching Australian salmon in South Australia.

The Locks Well beach is accessible by a 120 metre wooden staircase comprising 283 steps.

There are also amenities and a lookout offering spectacular panoramic views of the rugged coastline.

Public Toilets and Rest Area available.

properties.name: Tunkalilla Beach
properties.description: Tunkalilla Beach is a straight beach, backed by a low fore dune and wave over wash deposits, and continuous grassy slopes. The surf zone average is 60 metres in width and is cut by beach rips every 250 metres in the west, with several reef controlled rips to the east.

properties.name: Stenhouse Bay Jetty
properties.description:
The Stenhouse Bay Jetty is located within Innes National Park on Yorke Peninsula. A picnic shelter with several tables is provided on the top of the hill with scenic views down over the jetty. Fantastic fishing opportunities exist for beginners through to seasoned anglers. The 200 metre long jetty was built in 1913 to support the gypsum mining industry at Marion and Inneston Lakes. In its early days, 14 one-tonne horse drawn wagons ran along a wooden railway from Inneston Lake to the Stenhouse Bay Jetty, which was eventually replaced with steel tracks and trains. Gypsum was tipped from the wagons and trains down the hillside and loaded onto the large ships waiting at the jetty below 24 hour hours a day. Much of the stone infrastructure can still be seen at the base of the jetty and the old railway can be walked along what is now known as the Thomson-Pfitzner Plaster Trail Hike.

Interpretive signs are in place along the trails for visitors to learn more about the history of the area. Park entry fees apply, which are payable online. Please refer to website for current pricing.

properties.name: Port Noarlunga Beach and Jetty
properties.description: Port Noarlunga is located approximately 30 kilometres south of Adelaide and was originally created as a sea port. The picturesque steep red sandstone cliffs of Port Noarlunga and long jetty provide visitors with scenic walks and a place to fish.

properties.name: Long Beach at Robe
properties.description: Long Beach at Robe is a safe family beach with gentle surf and is quite unique as its one of the few beaches where you are able to drive your car onto the sand. A unique part of Robe's Heritage.

properties.name: Glenelg Beaches
properties.description: Glenelg Beach is Adelaide's most popular beach, offering a buzzing vibe and great atmosphere for all to enjoy. There are always fun events happening at Glenelg from volleyball tournaments to New Year's Eve concerts and fireworks.

properties.name: Coffin Bay National Park
properties.description: Known for its remote coastal scenery, the bays and coastline around the Coffin Bay National Park are ideal for boating, fishing, sailing, scuba diving and windsurfing. You can explore the park's coastal landscapes of high windswept cliffs and massive dunes, pounding surf beaches and sheltered sandy bays.

properties.name: Cape Spencer Lighthouse
properties.description: The short walk (approximately one hour return) to the Cape Spencer Lighthouse takes in spectacular views of the offshore islands. The lighthouse not only provides safe passage for vessels today, but also offers an insight into the past. A visit to Cape Spencer gives you the opportunity to learn about the area's maritime heritage by reading the maritime signs at the lighthouse itself. The walk also provides a unique opportunity to view the rugged cliff lines along the southern coast of Innes National Park.

properties.name: Blowhole Beach
properties.description: Blowhole Beach lies at the western boundary of Deep Creek Conservation Park. Access is via a steep four wheel drive decent to a car park on the eastern headland, otherwise there is car parking at Cobblers Hill two kilometres inland.

properties.name: Beachport Surf Beach
properties.description: Beachport Surf Beach is excellent for surfing. A parking area, toilets and cold shower are provided and entry is free. Memorial Lookout located at the Beachport Surf Beach, is dedicated to the memory of two service men killed dismantling a mine during World War Two.

properties.name: Beachport Conservation Park
properties.description:
Beachport Conservation Park's white sandy beaches and coastal flora is home to an array of birdlife, making it an ideal spot for bird watching. 
Bring your binoculars for the chance to spy a rare orange-bellied parrot that occupies the coastal salt marsh and beach dune habitats.

properties.name: 42 Mile Crossing & Beach Access
properties.description: So named because of its distance from Kingston, the 42 Mile Crossing is the best all weather, all year round four wheel drive vehicle access to the ocean beach. It is the closest point for two wheel drive vehicles to access the beach.

properties.name: Glenelg Beach
properties.description: The beach of Glenelg is a very nice place to go. It has some nice streets with shops and cafes as well. At the beachfront there's a large playground for kids. At the beach entrance there's a water tap and a free cold shower. There're also clean public toilets.

properties.name: Echo Holiday Parks - Port Pirie
properties.description: Located in town on the banks of the Port Pirie River, overlooking the picturesque Southern Flinders Ranges. With Solomontown beach, playground, picnic areas and a jetty adjacent to the park, Echo Holiday Parks - Port Pirie is the perfect place to stay.

properties.name: Nundroo Hotel Motel Caravan Park
properties.description: Nundroo Hotel Motel Caravan Park
properties.fees: AUD $8 x2 Adults (Unpowered); AUD $20 x2 Adults (Powered)

properties.name: Cape Banks Lighthouse
properties.description:
Cape Banks Lighthouse is a historic lighthouse located on Cape Banks, a rocky headland on the northern coast of Kangaroo Island, South Australia. It is situated approximately 10 kilometres north of the town of Kingscote. 

The lighthouse was built in 1872 to warn ships of the dangerous coastline and to guide them safely into Kingscote Harbor.

properties.name: Bordertown Recreation Lake
properties.description:
72 hour stay only. No tents allowed. Self contained vehicles only.
Camping is available for self-contained travelers in motorhomes, caravans and camper trailers, for a fee of $10 per night. There is a self pay station as you drive through the gate.

properties.name: Troubridge Hill Lighthouse
properties.description: The Troubridge Hill Lighthouse is a unique and striking lighthouse located on Troubridge Hill, overlooking the Gulf St Vincent on the Yorke Peninsula in South Australia. It was built in 1980 to replace the Troubridge Shoal Lighthouse as the major coastal light in the area. The lighthouse is unique because it is built from special wedge-shaped clay bricks that were custom-made for this lighthouse. The bricks are red in color and have never been rendered or painted, giving the lighthouse a very distinctive day mark.

properties.name: Myponga Beach
properties.description: Myponga Beach occupies a small valley that has been carved by Myponga Creek and is now partially filled with river and marine sediments forming a flat plain occupied by a few houses and an elongated lagoon and wetland that flows across the southern end of the beach.

properties.name: Cactus Beach
properties.description: Experienced surfers from all over Australia and overseas congregate at the iconic surf mecca of Cactus to test their skills on two left hand breaks and one right hander. This is where they can experience the freedom of surfing in natural unspoilt surroundings.

properties.name: Antechamber Bay East Campground
properties.description: Antechamber Bay East Campground located in Lashmar Conservation Park offers various campsites for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include toilets, showers, wood BBQ, picnic tables and shelter. You will need to bring your own firewood and water. In the area you can enjoy swimming, fishing, canoeing, and walking trails. There is a self-registration station on site.

properties.name: Coles Point Camp Area
properties.description:
This is a large area with beautiful cliffside camping at Cole's Point. No facilities. Pack out rubbish. Exposed cliffside camping and less exposed bush camping. 

The area has a few branching roads - some of which are not suitable for long vehicles. The surface is variable but rocky and in some areas unlevel. It is tranquil and quiet but exposed to coastal weather. 

All vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Cuddle Creek Restaurant Tavern and Caravan Park
properties.description: Quiet camping next to a creek, just off the main road behind the Tavern. Lots of space with grass. Registration inside the Tavern.
properties.fees: Powered for 25$ and unpowered sites for 20$ available.

properties.name: Hookina Creek
properties.description: Rest area off Outback Hwy just N of the creek. Picnic tables available, no other facilities. Entry to camp area is 750m N of the creek, 18km NW of Hawker and 13km S of Mernmerna.
