properties.description: Redcliff campsite offers beautiful beachfront camping and accommodation.

properties.name: Tailem Bend football Oval showground
properties.description:
Tailem Bend is located along the cliffs of the Murray River, about 99 kilometers east of Adelaide. The town was established with the arrival of the railway in 1887 and has since become a hub for pig farming, dairy production, and grain cultivation.

The Tailem Bend Football Club, situated on Granites Road, offers camping spots for $10 per vehicle per night. Visitors can contact the caretaker, Brian, to settle fees and discuss the duration of their stay (which is flexible). Brian also provides access to amenities like toilets, showers, and a BBQ upon request. Potable water is available, and pets are welcome on leads. During the football season, meals are served on Thursday and Saturday evenings.

For a step back in time, "Old Tailem Town" is a theme park showcasing the history of early settlers from 1860 to 1960. Adventurous visitors can also take part in the park's Ghost Tours held in the evenings.

Cost: $10 per vehicle per night. The town's financial records are kept at this location, so guests can drop receipts into the provided box.

Parking: Water is available, pets must be on leads, and there is access to toilets, showers, and a BBQ (contact Brian). No set time limit for stays. To reach the camping area, stay left towards the netball courts, with shaded sites under trees. Meals are available Thursday and Saturday evenings during the football season.

properties.name: Headings Cliff Lookout
properties.description:
Headings Cliff offers stunning views of the Murray River and is one of the most photographed scenes in the region.

Just a short 10-minute drive from Paringa, the unique, rich colors of the golden limestone cliffs make it a must visit destination during your time in Renmark.

Follow the fenced track and choose to take in the magnificent views from ground level or make your way up the tower platform for an even higher vantage point.

There is ample parking onsite with plenty of room for long vehicles to navigate and turn around.

The outlook from the river is also breathtakingly beautiful. Enjoy the orange-red glow of the cliffs at sunset via boat, canoe, kayak or as you pass by on your houseboat adventure. But really, no matter what time of day you get to visit Headings Cliff, the view promises to be spectacular!

properties.name: Wreck Crossing Campground
properties.description:
Only accessible during the summer months, this campground has 5 allocated camp sites offering shade and is accessible by 2WD. 

This campground may be closed during winter due to wet conditions.

- Access 2WD and 4WD.
- Suitable for camper trailers, tents.
- Facilities: nil.
- Campfires not allowed.

Number of campsites: 
- 5 allocated campsites.

Electricity: unpowered.

If you are intending to camp on the beach near the crossing, please book a Beach Camping site.

properties.name: Penola Coonawarra Caravan Park
properties.description: Unwind in peaceful Penola. Our caravan park offers comfortable accommodation, stunning scenery, and easy access to local attractions.

properties.name: Clare Valley Cabins
properties.description: Unwind in cozy Clare Valley cabins. Perfect escape for couples & families. Explore wineries, hiking trails & local charm.

properties.name: Roonka River Front Cottages
properties.description: Relax and unwind in our charming riverfront cottages. Perfect escape for couples and families. Book your tranquil getaway now!

properties.name: Hillsview Cabins and Caravan Park
properties.description: Stay in nature at Hillsview! Cozy cabins, spacious caravan sites, stunning hill views. Perfect escape for families and couples

properties.name: Talunga Park Caravan Park and Recreation Grounds
properties.description: Unwind at Talunga Park! Caravan sites, recreation grounds & stunning surrounds. Perfect for families and outdoor lovers.

properties.name: Marree Oasis Caravan Park
properties.description: Refresh and recharge at Marree Oasis Caravan Park. Cabins, powered sites, and amenities in the heart of the outback. Book now!

properties.name: Lucindale Caravan Park
properties.description: Relax and unwind at Lucindale Caravan Park. Enjoy stunning scenery, top-notch facilities, and friendly service. Book your stay today!

properties.name: Pondalowie Bay Bush Campground
properties.description:
Positioned near the beautiful Pondalowie Bay this campground is nestled among the Mallee vegetation. 

Great location for activities such as surfing, fishing and bush walking.

- Access: 2WD and 4WD
- Suitable: tents only
- Facilities: long drop toilet
- Number of sites: 26
- Campfires: allowed (seasonal fire restrictions apply).
- Electricity: Unpowered

properties.name: Holder Bend Camping Reserve
properties.description: Spacious free camping by the Murray River, not sure if self contained only but we camped here fine

properties.name: Anita bush camp
properties.description: Coin spacieux légèrement éloigné de la route facile d'accès

properties.name: Coonalpyn Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Coonalpyn Caravan Park (also known as the Coonalpyn Soldiers Memorial Caravan Park) is a perfect spot for travellers to rest while on the busy Adelaide to Melbourne touring route.

Set amongst park-like settings with ample shade, the Coonalpyn Caravan Park offers a welcome rest for the weary traveller. During the warmer months travellers can cool down by taking advantage of the community swimming pool which is situated next door.

Within walking distance visitors can discover the spectacular silos (which were painted by renowned artist Guido van Helten in February 2017) and the Coonalpyn Arts Trail. Country hospitality is just around the corner and at it’s best with good old fashioned service at the local hotel, bakery, coffee shop and quirky roadside waffle and jaffle shop.

properties.name: Shoreline Caravan Park
properties.description:
Come and experience the picturesque waterfront views of the Flinders Ranges. Situated off the highway the Shoreline is the "quiet park" of Port Augusta.

The park offers absolute beach frontage where you can fish, swim or go for a leisurely walk along the beach to the stunning Red Bank Cliffs at the top of the Spencer Gulf.

properties.name: Barossa Valley Hop On Hop Off Tour
properties.description:
Travel around the Barossa Valley wine region with freedom on this hop on hop off tour to explore the region at your own pace. On this tour you will see the beautiful scenery of this region including historic villages, vineyards and farms and have amazing cellar door gourmet food and wine experiences.

This hop on hop off tour departs daily from the Barossa Region and regular scheduled buses operate between 11am and 4pm. No need to worry about driving as this tour allows you the freedom to experience several locations and taste the award winning wines in beautiful venues. 

Highlights

-   Barossa Valley Hop On Hop Off Tour
-   Experience Barossa's spectacular scenery
-   Australia’s best and renowned wine region
-   Stay as long you like at any stop
-   Amazing food to suit all tastes & budgets
-   Taste South Australia’s award winning wines

properties.name: Stony Rise Campground Campsite
properties.description: Nice camping ground. Close to the beach and to town. Toilets but no showers. Good shade on one side.

properties.name: Discovery Lagoon Caravan and Camping Ground
properties.description:
The camp ground is set in 4 acres of bushland and is part of a 100 Acre plot, set beside a lagoon, named by the French when they arrived on the island as Discovery Lagoon, giving the campsite its name. In summer the lagoon dries out, but rainfall permitting fills in the winter. Many migratory birds flock here at this time as they search for prime nesting sites and the lagoon comes alive!

The site is often visited by native wildlife such as wallabies, they love the fresh grass around the site and have been known to visit the campers in the camp kitchen on an evening. There are echidnas here too, if you are lucky you may see the rare albino echidna who frequents the site along with Kangaroos & Koalas to mention a few!

properties.name: Wallaroo Beachfront Tourist Park
properties.description: Caravan and camping grounds. Powered and unpowered sites. Cabins. Pet friendly, jumping pillow, free WiFi, fish cleaning facilities.

properties.name: Spalding Cove Bush Campground
properties.description: Campground in lincoln NP. Bumpy drive to get there. No need for 4wd, just high clearance. No allocated sites so pick your own right by the beach. Little shade and little wind shelter

properties.name: Kangaroo Island Ocean Safari
properties.description:
Enjoy an exhilarating 75 minute coastal and wildlife tour around the coastline of Kangaroo Island with Aboriginal-owned Kangaroo Island Ocean Safari. Visit places like Dolphin Cove, Cuttlefish Bay, Kangaroo Head and Snapper Point. 

Cruise through the brilliant blue waters to spot wild marine animals that inhabit this environment, such as dolphins, seals, and birds. The tour's skipper will provide informative commentary to help you learn about the surrounding area.

properties.name: ONYA Eco-Camping Park
properties.description: ONYA Eco-Camping Park is a self-sufficient campsite nestled in the Flinders Ranges. This incredible landscape is perfect for people travelling to the Flinders Ranges who want to stay off-the-grid. Drop toilet so all types of campers welcome.

properties.name: American River Campground
properties.description: Unbeaufsichtigter Campground. Es hat einen Ticketautomaten (no cash). Es gibt WCs und Duschen, Abfallcontainer, powered und unpowerd Sites. Einen gedeckten Grill für BBQ. Gedeckte und ungedeckte Picknick Tische. Leider gibt es KEINE Möglichkeit zum Abwaschen. Mit 35.00 AUD für eine powerd site eher teuer.

properties.name: Port Neill RV Park
properties.description: Level gravel parking lot with firepits, off the main road into town. Extremely quiet and short walk from town.

properties.name: Maitland Show Society Caravan Park
properties.description: Google above for website perfect for a night to sort out the rest of the peninsular holiday JW

properties.name: Cooinda Retreats
properties.description:
Cooinda Retreats is a beautiful retreat, bunkhouse or tented camp experience for schools and community groups that also has a small campground for recreational travellers.

The RV Park and Camp Stay is immersed in nature and has magnificent views down to the Fleurieu coastline. Whilst we are less than a 5-minute drive to central Victor Harbour, walking down to the town or the beach along Hindmarsh River trails and bike paths only takes 20 minutes (or 30 minutes if you meander all the way down along the river trails). We sit just above the township but with the scrubland in front of us you will feel miles away from the busy coastal town.

properties.name: Eagle Waterhole Campground
properties.description: Walk-in campground for Hike and Heysen Trail. Tank of unfiltered water there. Closest parking is at Goondaloo picnic area

properties.name: Bon Accord Hotel
properties.description: Free to camp in spacious and relatively flat ground providing a $20 spend in the hotel. Hot showers, and toilets on site. Limited menu but hearty meals. Close to a truck stop so some noise in the evenings. Hotel full of character and very friendly owner.

properties.name: Len Barker Reserve Campground
properties.description:
The Yorke Peninsula has a range of bush camping spots that will set you back around $20/night (or cheaper if you stay longer), including this magic spot.

A permit is required to camp here.

properties.name: Monarto Sporting Complex
properties.description:
Council-confirmed campground for up to 48 hours stay. 

Warm showers, clean toilets, and bins.

properties.name: Palmer Cricket Ground Camping
properties.description:
Secluded small campground next to a cricket field.

Donation.

properties.name: Kingston RV Park
properties.description: Large grassy area close to beach and jetty. 48hr for $10.

properties.name: Parndana Hotel and Caravan Park
properties.description:
Parndana Hotel Camping and Caravan Park is located in the heartland of Kangaroo Island with easy access to all of the main attractions.  Township services include: Golf Course, BMX track, Children’s Playground/Picnic Park, and Museum. Mechanical & Petrol supplies, Post Office, 7 day Supermarket, 24 hour laundry mat and caravan wastage disposal site.

The Camping and Caravan area is situated approx. 200m from the Hotel which contains self-contained cabins, 8 powered sites and  unpowered sites. The area is surrounded by native bush land, with chance sightings of possums, wallabies, koalas and other native fauna.

properties.name: Farrell Flat Hotel
properties.description:
Hotel with a Camping spaces. 

You can camp for free if you get something in their pub.

properties.name: Head Of Bight Whale Watch and Viewpoint
properties.description:
Head of Bight offers fantastic views with or without whales and travellers are encouraged to visit all year long. 

Bunda Cliffs are part of Australia's most awe-inspiring coastlines and HoB is the perfect location to take in this majestic sight.

The Head of Bight whale watching area on South Australia's remote Far West Coast is famous for its land based viewing of the magnificent Southern Right Whale between May and October.  Visitors follow a cliff-top boardwalk to a viewing platform from where migrating whales may be seen.

properties.name: Yamba East Rest Area - Westbound
properties.description: This long, bitumen drive-through rest area has no facilities, except for picnic tables, and it's located just off the highway. There is limited shade and it's suitable for big rigs. Available to westbound traffic.

properties.name: Yamba East Rest Area - Eastbound
properties.description: This long, bitumen drive-through rest area has no facilities, except for picnic tables, and it's located just off the highway. There is limited shade and it's suitable for big rigs. Available to eastbound traffic.

properties.name: Yalata West No. 2 Rest Area
properties.description: This large and open overnighter with no amenities, other than rubbish bins, is located just off the highway. There are some shaded spots further from the highway and it's suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Yatala East No. 2 Rest Area
properties.description: This large and gravel drive-through rest area with no amenities, other than rubbish bins, is located just off the highway. There are some shaded spots further from the highway and it's suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Western Flat Recreation Reserve
properties.description: This nice camping area with good facilities and a playground is designed for self-contained caravans and motorhomes and it's located off the road. Donations for using amenities are requested.

properties.name: Watraba Rest Area
properties.description: This drive-through rest area is located just off the eastbound side of the highway and it has no amenities, except for a rubbish bin and a picnic table. Suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Tarlee Rest Area
properties.description: Drive-through rest area with no facilities, located in the corner of a junction. It's quite large, and therefore private with a few trees scattered here and there for shade. The traffic noise can still be heard, though!

properties.name: Sheringa South Rest Area
properties.description: This nice rest area with no facilities, except for picnic tables, is located just off the highway. There are a few trees, which provide shade and shelter. Suitable for large rigs.

properties.name: Red Banks Conservation Park
properties.description: This beautiful camping area with good facilities is located in the Red Banks Conservation Park. It's easily accessible via highway and offers scenic landscape, walking tracks, bird watching opportunities and limited shade.

properties.name: Railway Reserve Park Kalangadoo
properties.description: This nice overnight rest area with no amenities, except for picnic tables, is located on Railway Tce in Kalangadoo. For self-contained vehicles only with a maximum stay of 48hrs.

properties.name: Puntabie East Rest Area
properties.description: This rest area with basic facilities, incl. picnic tables and rubbish bins, is located off the highway. There is a limited shade.

properties.name: Lipson Cove
properties.description: This scenic camping area with no facilities, other than toilets, is located on the Eyre Penisula, approx. 9km from the highway and quite close to Tumby Bay (worth a visit!). There are about 50 individual campsites and swimming, fishing, boating and kayaking are permitted.

properties.name: Clayton Station Outback Adventures and Station Stays
properties.description:
Clayton Station Outback Adventures and Station Stays are situated on the Birdsville Track, 54 kilometres north of Marree.  Luxury two bedroom self contained units with spacious decking overlooking the Clayton River into magnificent outback sunsets.  

Nestled in the heart of the outback for total relaxation away from the bustle of the city.

Relax in a hot artesian bath with the chandelier of stars overhead and enjoy the serenity of the outback.

properties.name: Spalding Hotel
properties.description:
Barbed Wire Pub offers a range of accommodation in the hotel. 

There is also parking behind the hotel for self-contained vehicles.

properties.name: Cullyamurra Waterhole
properties.description: Cullyamurra Waterhole camping area is located in the Innamincka Regional Reserve. Campsites are suitable for vehicle based camping, camper trailers and caravans. There are toilet facilities available. Local activites include fishing, swimming, boating and walking trails.  You will need a camping permit.

properties.name: Point Westall Viewpoint
properties.description: Stunning coastal views.

properties.name: Minkie Waterhole Campground
properties.description:
Located in Innamincka Regional Reserve, Minkie Waterhole provides sites for vehicle based camping and camper trailers. 

It can be accessed by the Fifteen Mile Track. 

A secluded campground, set amongst river red gums. The
Minkie waterhole has an abundance of birdlife. The campground is located 9 km south-west of Innamincka via the Fifteen Mile Track.

Camping fees are per vehicle per night.

Access: high clearance 4WD only.
Suitable for: tents and camper trailers.
Facilities: long-drop toilets.
Campfires: allowed (seasonal fire restrictions apply).
Unallocated campground – maximum 8 vehicles.
Electricity: unpowered.

properties.name: Robinson Park Motorhome Reserve Jamestown
properties.description:
This paid campground provides drinking water and is dog-friendly. 

Only self-contained motorhomes and caravans are allowed; camper trailers are not permitted. 

The campground has a maximum of 12 sites with a stay limit of 5 nights. 

Tent camping is not allowed, and all campers must be fully self-contained.

properties.name: Kings Site Campground
properties.description: Kings Site camping area offers basic camping for tents, and camper trailers. The site is located off the Fifteen Mile Track south-west of Innamincka. There are no facilities available. In the area you can enjoy fishing, swimming and canoeing. A permit is required.

properties.name: Keith Showgrounds
properties.description:
The Keith Showgrounds offers powered and unpowered sites suitable for tents, motorhomes and caravans. Facilities include showers and toilets. 

Advanced bookings are available.

properties.name: Morgan Conservation Park  Southern Section
properties.description: Morgan Conservation Park is located in SA. This is a small bush camping site, suitable for tents, caravans and camper trailers. Facilities include picnic tables, BBQ facilities. Activities include swimming, canoeing, hiking and walking.

properties.name: Stokes Bay
properties.description: Stokes Bay Campground is located on Kangaroo Island. The campground contains basic facilities such as toilets, picnic tables and BBQ facilities.

properties.name: Warooka Oval Camping Ground
properties.description:
Warooka Caravan and campground offers basic facilities such as toilets and picnic tables. 

There is no drinking water available so bring your own supply. Suitable for tents, caravans and camper trailers.

properties.name: Lock 4 Section Katarapko
properties.description: Lock 4 Section Katarapko is located in the Murray River National Park. Campsites are well-equipped including toilet facilities, BBQ and picnic area. The Katarapko area includes floodplains and several wetlands. This is an ideal place for birdwatching, canoeing and kayaking.

properties.name: Youngoona Campground
properties.description: Located on the eastern slope of the Trezona Range, Youngoona offers self-sufficient camping. Campsites are suitable for caravans, camper trailers and vehilce-based camping. Facilities include toilets and wood fireplace. Enjoy the Heysen Trail or mountain biking through the area.

properties.name: Katarapko Campground
properties.description:
ndividual secluded camp sites in this section are situated along the majestic Murray River, Eckerts Creek and Katarapko Creek. Most campsites offer shade and the ability to launch canoes. Learn about Wetlands on the Ngak Indau Wetland Trail, European history on the Craggs Hut Walk, or Aboriginal history on the Kai Kai Nature Trail. New to the Park are the Katarapko and Rodeo Trails. More information is available on the website.

Dogs ARE NOT permitted in the Katarapko Campground camping areas. Dogs are only permitted on a leash in the Old Rodeo grounds area between Berri and the first bridge/creek crossing. Please refer to the Park map.

Access 4WD or 2WD in dry conditions. Suitable for tents, camper trailers, caravans. Facilities: long-drop toilets. NO CAMPFIRES ALLOWED DURING FIRE DANGER SEASON. Number of campsites: 55 allocated campsites.

properties.name: Murphy's Haystacks
properties.description: This is a tourist stop off the B100 Flinders highway. Large rock formations called Haystacks cover this private farm property. Camping is permitted here. Please make a donation if camping. There are picnic tables and there is a toilet. The road is sealed and parking area is gravel. There is little shade. It is quiet and peaceful and the rock formations are interesting. This area can be cold and windy. No fires.

properties.name: Great Australian Bight Rest Area No.2
properties.description:
No camping or overnight parking allowed.

This is a typical cliffside rest area in Nullarbor National Park. On the south side of the road, two separate dirt and rocky tracks turns South to head toward the cliffs.

properties.name: Great Australian Bight Rest Area No.1
properties.description: This is a typical cliffside rest area in Nullarbor National Park.

properties.name: Big Bend Lookout
properties.description:
The Murray River has its own mesmerizing riverside gorge, comparable to Northern Territory’s Katherine Gorge .  Big Bend cliffs are located near Nildottie and Swan Reach where you can visit by boat or take a road trip, only one and half hours from Adelaide or 40 minutes from Mannum.

Take the picturesque riverside road from Mannum and travel by a free ferry ride across Walker Flat.  Here the ferry side incredible cliffs will start your riverside cliff adventure.   A short distance down the road just outside Nildottie, stopover at the ‘Big Bend Lookout’ where the Big Bend views will take your breath away.

A popular nesting ground for cockatoos and known as the tallest cliffs and the longest single bend along the entire length of the Murray River, Big Bend must be seen to be believed.

One of the Mid Murray’s natural wonders!

properties.name: The Painted Desert Lookout
properties.description:
The Painted Desert in South Australia, also referred to as the Arckaringa Hills, is a breathtaking landscape that captivates with its striking natural beauty. 

A true geological marvel, it’s a dream destination for photographers. If you're looking to capture stunning Outback scenery, this remarkable spot is an absolute must-see.

properties.name: Old Perlubie School Site Rest Area
properties.description: This is a large rest area 13 km W of Wirrulla or 80 km E of Ceduna. It is a level dirt surfaced area with bush camping sites and shady areas. There is a rubbish bin and some fire rings but no other facilities. It is a large area that extends 500 meters back from the highway. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Peterborough Rest Area
properties.description: This is a large rest area 2 km E of Peterborough. There is a large gravel open area on the east side of the area and a shaded park area on the west side. There are picnic tables and rubbish bins but no other facilities. The area is close to the highway so road noise is present. All types of vehicles can access this area but larger vehicles may be restricted to the open non-shaded area. The area can be muddy in wet weather.

properties.name: Olarinna Creek
properties.description: This remote campsite is located on the Oodnadatta Track. It is large and quiet, but doesn't provide much privacy - park behind a bush for a bit of shelter. There are no facilities and 4WD is recommended.

properties.name: Cohen Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small standard rest area on the Eyre Highway. There are rubbish bins and dirt surfaced tracks into bush. The bush is not very dense but provides some shade. There are tight corners so long vehicles will have trouble in this area. There is also low hanging branches on trees. The rest area is clean but only about 100m from the highway so road noise exists. 2wd accessible.

properties.name: Ricciuto Creek & Hart Lagoon Wetlands
properties.description: This dispersed bush camping area located on the bank of the Murray River is accessible with a 4WD via a dirt road. There are plenty of camping spots, shaded and sunny areas and enough privacy, but no amenities. The surface is level.

properties.name: Halidon Rest Area
properties.description: Unsealed rest area on Karoonda Hwy. Picnic tables and bins available, some shade available. Located at the S end of Halidon, 7km N of Sandalwood.

properties.name: Woolshed Flat Rest Area
properties.description: This is a medium sized gravel and level rest area between Quorn and Port Augusta. There is a picnic table and fire rings. There is some shade and scenic views of the Flinders Range. Any vehicle can access this area. The area extends 100 meters from the road so road noise exists. In heavy rain there can be water on the road.

properties.name: Yalata West Rest Area
properties.description: This is a very large rest area. Near the highway there is a water tank (drink at own risk) and a picnic table as well as rubbish bins. The surface is gravel but away from the road dirt and rocky tracks lead to large clearings (about 1-2km from highway). These offer shade and there is also a large square pit that can be driven into. All vehicles can access this area. Road noise is reduced the further away from the road.

properties.name: Peake Rest Area
properties.description: This rest area with toilets, picnic tables and a public phone is located off the highway, beside the Peake Memorial Hall. It's suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Wudinna East Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 7 km W of Kyancutta or 6 km E of Wudinna. It is a small gravel pullover attached to the south side of the road. It is not separated from the road and does not extend far. There are no facilities. Vehicles parked here are visible from the road completely. There are a few places in the bush where tents could be set up, but not for vehicles. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Wawirra Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Camping Area 26 km after Olary going away from Broken Hill. Suitable for both self contained and non self contained vehicles. With some spots suitable for camping. Facilities include covered picnic areas and bins.

properties.name: Kromelite Rd Rest Area
properties.description: Roadside stop over, picnic tables, SC only. Marginal cell reception.

properties.name: Iron Knob Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 1 km W of Iron Knob, at Hwy A1 junction. It is a small and flat dirt surface area with a tourist information sign and no other facilities. There is no shade or shelter. It is visible and near the road so road noise is constant. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Polkdinney Park Kyancutta Rest Area
properties.description: This is a camping area at Kyancutta, next to and behind the Kyancutta general store. Toilets available next to store. There is a shaded picnic area, rubbish bins, and toilet available. The parking area is a grassy as dirt area - some is open and some leads into the bush. This is a smaller site and can be busy. All types of vehicles can access this area. It is quiet and peaceful.

properties.name: Swan Reach Conservation Park Camping
properties.description: This is a self-sufficient camping area in the Swan Reach Conservation Park, 14 km W of Swan Reach or 16 km E of Sedan. It is not signposted and the 2 km dirt road S of Hwy is very easy to miss, but GPS leads to the turnoff. The turnoff is a rocky road that extends about 2 km through the park. It is very bumpy but 2wd can manage if traveling slow. Periodically down the road our pull offs into bush sites for camping. There are no facilities here so be self-contained and sufficient. The area is shaded and sheltered, but the highway can be heard. This is a nice place for birdwatching. Long vehicles may have trouble finding a suitable place to pull In without blocking the road.

properties.name: Brimbago Rest Area
properties.description: Spacious drive-through rest area with no facilities. It is separated from the highway by a lush string of trees, which limits the traffic noise. There is not much shade or privacy and the site is frequented by trucks.

properties.name: Bookaloo Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area next to highway and train track so can be noisy. Picnic table under shelter and two garbage bins provided. There are some marks of old fires being made. Rest area is on a gravel ground and is surrounded by some trees and bush.

properties.name: Stockyard Plain Rest Area
properties.description: Simple drive through rest area on Sturt Hwy. Sheltered picnic table and bin available, some shade from trees. Located 20km W of Waikerie or 20km NE of Paisley.

properties.name: Coorong Rest Area
properties.description: Very basic roadside bay rest area with a rubbish bin and a picnic table available.

properties.name: Port Wakefield South Rest Area
properties.description: This is a medium sized rest area 25 km N of Dublin or 10 km S of Port Wakefield. Southbound only. The surface is sealed and there are some dirt areas next to the pullover to park. A covered picnic area and rubbish bin are available. It is right next to the A1 highway so it is loud. There is little shade and shelter. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Geranium Rest Area
properties.description: Small rest area on Mallee Hwy at the N entrance to Geranium. Picnic table and bin here, with a little bit of shade from trees. Located 75km W of Pinnaroo or 70km E of Tailem Bend.

properties.name: Peake Creek Siding
properties.description: This gravel drive-through overnight rest area with no amenities is located off the Oodnadatta Track, close to the creek (with salty water). There is a limited shade and views are limited to the ruins of the Peake Creek Siding. 4WD access only.

properties.name: North Tent Hill Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area next to highway. Surrounded by some trees and bush but can still be windy and noisy. Picnic table under shelter and two garbage bins provided. Rest area has got a gravel ground to camp on.

properties.name: Lyrup Turnoff Rest Area
properties.description: A very large roadside drive-through rest area located just off the highway. For overnight stays, you can drive further into the scrub for some extra privacy and minimized noise levels, although it will still be quite exposed. There are no facilities.

properties.name: Lake Harry Ruins
properties.description: This overnight rest area with no amenities is located off the Birsville Track. Access by 4WD only.

properties.name: Warrow North Rest Area
properties.description: This is a medium sized rest area on the B100 Flinders Highway that is not signposted. The area is gravel surfaced and level. There are rubbish bins and picnic tables. It is shady and there are some low hanging tree branches but any vehicle can access this area. No fires. It is roadside.

properties.name: Dublin North Rest Area
properties.description: This is a large rest area 21 km N of Dublin or 14 km S of Port Wakefield. Northbound only. The surface is a long sealed pullover. There is a small dirt surface to get off the loop. There is a picnic table and rubbish bin. The rest area has some shade but is very loud as it is directly next to the A1 highway. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Lincoln/Eyre Highway Junction
properties.description: This is a small standard rest area on the Flinders B100 highway. The surface is gravel and level. There is little shade and the area only extends 50 meters from the road, so road noise exists. All vehicles can access this area. There is little shade and shelter from wind. There is a tourist information sign for activities in the area.

properties.name: 85k Peg Rest Area Nullarbor National Park
properties.description: This is a typical rest area at the 85km peg in Nullarbor National Park. It is a medium sized dirt and bush area on the south side of the road. There is taller bush here that provides some shelter from wind and seclusion, but little shade. There is a picnic table, covered picnic table and rubbish bin but no other facilities. There is some road noise here. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Olary Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Rest Area 2 km E of Olary. 65 km SW of Cockburn. Suitable for non self-contained vehicles, accessable dirt track (which isnt signposted) on left hand side coming from Broken Hill. Ample space for camping with some grassy scrubby patches for tents. During wet conditions 4WD vehicle is required.

properties.name: Orroroo Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 8 km W of Orroroo or 5 km E of Morchard. It is a large area with 3 entrances. The surface is dirt and gravel. There is a large shaded level portion on the western side and a small dip down to a lower area that has some low hanging branches. The upper area is more suitable for long and large vehicles, but access is possible to both areas. There is shade and it is next to the highway but traffic is light at night. All types of vehicles can access this area except trucks.

properties.name: Morgan East Rest Area 2
properties.description: Gravel rest area on both sides of Morgan Rd. Sheltered picnic tables and rubbish bins available. Some shade. Located 16km E of Stuart.

properties.name: Coomandook North
properties.description: Basic rest area on Dukes Hwy. Rubbish bins here, no other facilities and limited shade. Located 5km NW of Coomandook or 30km SE of Tailem Bend.

properties.name: Mathesons Bore
properties.description: Rest area 300 metres off the highway down a gravel road so there won't be any noises. It provides lots of parking spaces, 2 picnic tables, one being sheltered, a few garbage bins and a rainwater tank with tap. The rest area is surrounded by lots of old dead trees.

properties.name: Drain M Rest Stop
properties.description: Sealed drive through rest area on Princes Hwy. Picnic tables and some shade from trees. Set back from the road slightly so road noise not as bad. Located 27km N of Millicent or 80km S of Kingston SE.

properties.name: Winnininnie Creek
properties.description: Rest Area 36 km SW of Mannahill or 9 km NE of Yunta. Suitable for self contained and non self contained vehicles Good grassy area and camping area on other side of creek in dry seasons. Facilities include picnic areas and bins.

properties.name: 42 Mile Crossing Rest Area
properties.description: Very basic yet spacious roadside bay rest area. Please take your rubbish with you, as there are no bins provided.

properties.name: Koongawa East Rest Stop
properties.description: This is a rest area 44 km W of Kimba or 45 km E of Kyancutta. It is a small dirt pullover on the south side of the highway. The surface is level and suitable for all vehicles. There is a covered picnic table, two rubbish bins and some fire rings. It is right next to the road so road noise is present.

properties.name: Lochiel Memorial Hall Parking
properties.description: This is a large parking area at Lochiel Memorial Hall. Self Contained Vehicles only. No signage. There is a covered picnic area with a barbecue, water, and public flush toilets. There is some shade and trees near the picnic area. The surface is dirt gravel and any type of vehicle can access this area. Maximum stay:  48 Hours

properties.name: Mount Bryan Rest Area
properties.description: Rest Area in small township. Opposite Mount Bryan Hotel. Suitable for self contained and non self contained vehicles and some grassy areas for tents and swags. Facilities include toilets, barbeque, covered picnic areas and tap water. Also has a play ground and mini golf.

properties.name: Hancocks Shaft Rest Area
properties.description: This is a medium sized standard (but not signposted) rest area on the B100 Flinders Highway. The surface is gravel and level. All vehicles can access this area. It extends about 50 meters from the road and a copse of bush separates the road from the area but road noise still exists. There is some, but little shade. There are picnic tables and rubbish bins.

properties.name: Hookeys Waterhole
properties.description: Basic bush camp area on the banks of Neale River. No facilities. Located on Oodnadatta Rd, 7km S of Oodnadatta.

properties.name: Spalding Junction Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 9 km N of Burra or 7 km S of Mount Bryan. It is a small standard highway pullover with a level dirt surface. There are some tall trees that provide shade and some grassy shaded areas suitable for tent sites. All types of vehicles can access this area. 5-6 RVs could utilize this area in the same night. There is a picnic table and a rubbish bin.

properties.name: Darkes Memorial Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small dirt rest area 55 km W of Kimba or 34 km E of Kyancutta. It is not suitable for Trucks. The surface is dirt and level but parts are bumpy and it can be muddy in wet weather. There is a picnic table as rubbish bins but no other facilities. There are some trees providing shade. Some bush separates the highway from the rest area but it's still a loud area and doesn't extend too far from the road. All types of vehicles except trucks can access this area.

properties.name: Robertstown Oval Park Area
properties.description: This is a sports field and parking area at Robertstown. There is no signage. The surface is sealed bitumen and dirt and grass, depending where you park, There is ample parking in the back of the football club for all types of vehicles. Shade is available. There is a playground, covered picnic area, barbecue, dump site, toilet, and rubbish bin. Maximum stay:  24 Hours

properties.name: Mulga Well North Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area next to highway. The rest area has a sheltered picnic table and two bins provided. The rest area has got a gravel ground to camp on but also has got an extra area behind the picnic table with red dirt to park or set up a tent. It is surrounded by some trees and bush.

properties.name: Dog Fence Rest Area
properties.description: Basic dirt rest area on Strzelecki Track. Sheltered picnic table available, no other facilities and no shade. Located 100km NE of Lyndhurst/The Outback Hwy. Dirt road.

properties.name: Ki Ki South Rest Area
properties.description: Really large gravel roadside rest area with no facilities. The further away from the highway you drive, the lower the noise levels become and there is plenty of space to get away from the traffic noise and camp in a quiet spot.

properties.name: Mallee Camp Area Redbanks Conservation Park
properties.description: This is a free camp ground in Redbanks Conservation Park. Camp underneath the Mallee trees in a designated bush camp area. There are 11 spacious sites. The 11 km dirt road and campground are well graded and level but can be muddy and impassable to 2WD in wet weather. There is a drop toilet but no other facilities. There are two nature walks to explore. Wombats, kangaroos, echidnas and other wildlife are frequently seen. The area is peaceful and quiet, but during the busy season all 11 sites may be taken.

properties.name: Hanson Rest Area
properties.description: This is a Parking Area 13 km S of Burra at Hanson. The area is near the highway junction and is a pine forest. There are dirt/gravel tracks in between the trees and there are some low hanging branches. It is not a large area but could accommodate about 6-10 vehicles. It is heavily shaded and there are no facilities. Any vehicle can access this area.

properties.name: Poocher Swamp Rest Area
properties.description: Simple large, grassy rest area. No facilities but plenty of space to park and a little bit of shade from trees. Located on Cannawigara Rd, 8km W of Bordertown. Signposted out front.

properties.name: Marryat Creek North Rest Area
properties.description: Basic rest area next to highway so can be noisy. Only has a picnic table under shelter and garbage bin provided. Has got lots of camp and parking spaces, a gravel ground and is surrounded by bush.

properties.name: Eight Mile Corner Rest Area
properties.description: This circular drive-through rest area is located just off the highway. It offers picnic tables, rubbish bins and enough room for big rigs. 20hrs maximum stay.

properties.name: Culburra North Rest Area
properties.description: This large campground is located just off the highway, however there are plenty of trees scattered around to provide shelter and act as a noise barrier. There are no facilities except for rubbish bins and picnic tables.

properties.name: Merriton Rest Area
properties.description: This is a typical highway pullover on the Northbound side of Princes Highway. There are rubbish bins and picnic tables. The surface is sealed level bitumen. There is some shade. It is right next to the road so road noise exists. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Bon Bon Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area next to highway. Rest area has got two big shelters covering 2 picnic tables, unsheltered picnic tables, a few garbage bins, a sheltered information board, a rainwater tank with tap, non flush toilets and a not working handwash sink.  The rest area has a gravel ground to park on and is surrounded by bush.

properties.name: 164k Peg Rest Area
properties.description: This is a typical rest area at the 164km peg in Nullarbor National Park. There is a short dirt pullover that leads to a large dirt/gravel parking area with tracks leading into the bush. Some tracks go far into the bush. There are rubbish bins and a picnic table but no other facilities. This is a bush camping site with some secluded bush sites and open areas, but little shade. This site is medium sized and secluded. There is road noise. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: 21 Peg Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small highway rest area 20 km SE of Burra or 64 km NW of Morgan. The highway pull off is dirt and becomes muddy in wet weather, but all vehicles should be able to access this area. Long vehicles may take up too much space. There are covered picnic tables and rubbish bins but no other facilities. There is so shade and some bush cover but most of the area is exposed to the road. It is loud.

properties.name: Morgan East Rest Area 1
properties.description: Basic gravel rest area on Burra-Renmark Rd. Picnic tables and bins here, some shade from trees. Located 55km W of Renmark.

properties.name: 157k Peg Rest Area
properties.description: This is a typical rest area at the 157km peg in Nullarbor National Park. There is a short dirt pullover that leads to a large dirt/gravel parking area with tracks leading into the bush. There are rubbish bins but no other facilities. This is a bush camping site with some secluded bush sites and open areas, but little shade. This site is medium sized and secluded. There is road noise. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Millicent North Rest Stop
properties.description: This is just a roadside bumpy dirt bay with a picnic table and a rubbish bin.

properties.name: Tailem Bend South Rest Area
properties.description: This overnight circular rest area is located at the end of a sealed drive, just off the highway at the GPS coordinates provided. It is large and situated among trees, which helps limit the noise and provides shade. There are no amenities here, other than a picnic table. This area is famous for its abundance of bush walks.

properties.name: Parrakie Rest Area
properties.description: This large drive-through rest area with no facilities, except for picnic tables, is separated from the Mullee Hwy by a wall of trees. It provides some shade and has limited traffic noise. Suitable for big rigs.

properties.name: Iron Knob East Rest Area
properties.description: This is a parking area 30 km SW of Port Augusta or 39 km E of Iron Knob. It is not signposted. There is a dirt track on the south side of the road that leads to a small bush camp. Only 2-3 small vehicles can fit here. There are no facilities. There is some shade. Road noise is loud and constant. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Poochera Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 2 km W of Poochera or 45 km SE of Wirrulla. It is a medium sized dirt pullover that is level and runs adjacent to the South side of the highway. There is some Mallee scrub and bush separating the area from the highway. There are rubbish bins and a picnic table. It is next to the road and loud. It is accessible by all types and sizes of vehicles, including trucks. There is little shade.

properties.name: Reedy Creek South
properties.description: Basic unsealed rest area on Princes Hwy. Bins are the only facility here, limited shade. Located 30km SE of Kingston SE.

properties.name: Keith South Rest Area
properties.description: Sealed rest area on Riddoch Hwy. Sheltered picnic tables and bins available, limited shade. 11km S of Keith or 50km N of Padthaway.

properties.name: Padthaway North Rest Area
properties.description: Shady camp area on Riddoch Hwy. Picnic tables and bins available, plenty of space to park. Located 50km S of Keith or 13km N of Padthaway.

properties.name: Kathleen Creek
properties.description: Simple rest area among the trees on the banks of the creek. No facilities but shady. Located on Oodnadatta Track, 130km E of Marla.

properties.name: Lowbank Landing
properties.description: Basic camping area on the S bank of Murray River. No amenities but is a nice spot for swimming and fishing with plenty of shade and a boat ramp. To get there, travel 5km E of Holder on Sturt Hwy and turn N on dirt road to get to campground.

properties.name: Saddleworth Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small parking area 3 km N of Saddleworth. It is a short pulloff that extends about 20 meters from the highway and is sealed. There are rubbish bins but no other facilities. There is some shade and tree cover. There is significant road noise as this area is directly next to the highway. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Yantanabie South Rest Area
properties.description: This is a medium sized rest area and truck stop 25 km NW of Poochera or 22 km SE of Wirrulla. It is a standard dirt surfaced level pull over with some bush and trees dotted throughout the area. The rest area is visible from the road but on the western side there is a small track into the grass and bush that leads to a more secluded spot. There are rubbish bins and a picnic table here. As it is designated for truck parking and on a busy highway, it is noisy and dirty. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Tantanoola East Rest Stop
properties.description: Basic roadside stopover. Picnic tables, sealed parking and rubbish bins. Opposite petrol station.

properties.name: Kimba East Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 52 km SW of Iron Knob or 35 km E of Kimba. It is a level dirt surfaced pullover with dirt tracks that lead a couple hundred meters back into the bush. There are shady bush sites and the open are next to the road for larger vehicles. Any type of vehicle can access this area. There is a rubbish bin and no other facilities. There is road noise but the further back in the bush you go the less noticeable it is.

properties.name: Karoonda East Rest Area
properties.description: Small rest area E of Karoonda on Loxton Rd. Picnic tables and rubbish bins available but very little shade.

properties.name: Haslam Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small standard rest area on the B100 Flinders highway. The surface is dirt and level. It has a covered picnic table, uncovered table and rubbish bin. There are two small shaded pull-ins for small vehicles. There is room for buses and larger vehicles but it is a small area. The area extends only 25 meters from the road and road noise exists, although the road is not a major highway.

properties.name: Nackara East Rest Area
properties.description: Parking Area 35km after Yunta on right hand side of road. Suitable for self contained vehicles only with some shaded areas. Facilities are limited to covered picnic areas and bins.

properties.name: Morambro Creek Rest Area
properties.description: Shady rest area located on the corner of Riddoch Hwy and Bordertown-Naracoote Rd. Picnic tables available. 26km NW of Naracoorte.

properties.name: John S Christian Reserve
properties.description: This is a camping area 19 km NW of Walker Flat. From Walker Flat there is a 9 km good dirt road suitable for all vehicles. The reserve is in a quiet and shady valley that had plenty of space for tent sites but limited space for vehicles - long vehicles will not fit or block access. The surface is dirt and grass. It is peaceful and forested. There is a memorial stone to John S Christian, toilets, and a picnic table.

properties.name: Tenbury - Hunter Reserve
properties.description: This is a camp ground at Swan Reach, take ferry N across to W side of river. Bush camping on river bank. 500m E of ferry crossing. The surface is a level gravel ground. There are shaded sections and open sections. Any vehicle can access this area. It is a popular campground and fills up early in peak season. There is a toilet, dump station, rubbish bin. There is a picnic area separate from the campground. It is quiet but not secluded as the campers are in close vicinity to each other. Maximum stay:  96 Hours

properties.name: Glendambo South Rest Area
properties.description: Basic rest area next to highway. Sheltered picnic table covered in graffiti and two garbage bins provided. The rest area has got a gravel ground but also has got some extra areas with red dirt where you can park or set up a tent as well.

properties.name: Cutana Rest Area
properties.description: Rest Area 32 km SW of Cockburn or 35 km NE of Olary. Both sides of the road. Some areas suitable for self and non self contained vehicles. Facilities include Bins, Covered Picnic Areas.  Some Sandy areas suitable for camping.

properties.name: Nundroo East Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small standard rest area on the Eyre Highway. It is not suitable for large trucks or buses. The surface is dirt and rock and there are rubbish bins and fire rings. There is some, but little shade. The rest area does not extend more than 100m from the road, so it is a loud site. 2wd accessible.

properties.name: Port Germein South Rest Area 1
properties.description: This is a signposted rest area on the southbound side of Princes Highway. The surface is sealed and any vehicle can access this area. It is used and a truck stop. There are no facilities except a rubbish bin. There is road noise and some bush shelter from wind.

properties.name: Iron Knob West Rest Area 1
properties.description: This is a large parking area  21 km SW of Iron Knob or 66 km NE of Kimba. It is a gravel area attached to the northern side of the highway. It has rubbish bins and a few trees but little shade and no other facilities. There isn't any way to park away from the highway so it is very loud and you are visible from the road. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Goyders Line Memorial Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 11 km W of Koongawa or 20 km E of Kyancutta. It is a large area on the northern side of the highway. There is a medium sized gravel pit that is level and suitable for big vehicles. There are dirt paths leading toward the back with a picnic table and rubbish bins and bush camp sites. There are some paths that are low and muddy. This is a large area that is accessible by all types of vehicles and can fit many overnight. There is some bush camping and shady sites as well as open areas. It can be windy.

properties.name: Chandada Pioneer Park Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 15 km W of Poochera or 46 km E of Streaky Bay in the locality of Chandada. It is a level dirt pullover on the North side of Streaky Bay Highway. There is a picnic table and rubbish bin, some historical displays, and a few trees. There is little shade or shelter from weather. It is a quiet area but there is some noise from the road. All types of vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Maitland Rest Area
properties.description: This is a small overnight parking area in the town of Maitland. Small vehicles only. There is drinkable water and a toilet, picnic area and rubbish bins. No fires. It is quiet, peaceful, and shaded. Maximum stay:  24 Hours
